reviews.review_content: I know there cheap, but they look and feel like they should be £2!! Also one soul on the inside is bigger than the other one. I also don't recommend getting these if you want comfort or stability, be lucky if you can walk down the road without slipping! Absolutely disgusting trainers!
Broke after one week shoes
I had to return it ,heavy and with a strong soal also doesn’t fit my actual size
They are OK for the price but if you have wide feet then these are not for you
Comfy shoes and not too bulky however in my work place I get lots of static shocks with these
Great other than you’ll be slipping and sliding in them no grip
reviews.review_title: Wear them on site all the time

reviews.review_content: They are nice and bright ambit after a few week they started to fall apart

Upon first impressions of quality and design, I was most certainly impressed.The sizing however does indeed run small for me, hence why it was a good choice that I sized up when ordering, as I am usually a 8.5uk in most footwear.These however are a 9uk and they do fit me but after a couples day of wear, I then started developing sore areas where the trainers began to rub against me and it then got to the point that I sadly just could no longer wear them.But if you are not as wide footed as myself then I do say not to let that put you off from purchasing as it all comes down to each persons feet and no two of them are the same.But in regards to quality and looks, then they certainly do not fall far from the word amazing.
reviews.review_title: Great Quality & Look Awesome But Hurt.....

reviews.review_content: Comfortable safety shoes that I wear to work. They are very good all-round protection. The colour is awesome and they are fairly breathable for safety shoes. My only annoyance is the fact that they claim to be light weight. These are not light weight shoes by any means. They are actually very heavy and a lot heavier than my other trainers.
reviews.review_title: Good quality, but not light weight

reviews.review_content: Very comfortable & light but look really casual & with the added toe protection,are ideal for my job.Order your normal size as they fit perfectly.

Quick delivery, lightweight safety shoes. I ordered a 6 but had to size down. Bought for warehouse work. First nite they did hurt my toes a little but seem to be OK now. Dont think they will last forever, but at £24 and I have a second boot to swap, so I'm not wearing every night, I'm happy with them so far. Ordered the grey but ended up with the blue due to sizes left.
Delivered on time
Seems to be good quality and comfortable after wearing them a day
Bought these for my son and he said they are comfortable and not so bulky as the boots he has
Really comfortable and light weight
They are comfortable but for a full shift at work expect aching feet still

These trainers being safely rated with steel toe caps, they are bulkier than your standard trainer but they look surprisingly good still. I really like the colourway on theses with the contrasting blue. Anti slip heel and good cushioning underfoot. One of the steel toecaps feels more uncomfortable than the other though, rubbing against the top of my toe on one foot - not sure if it's the trainer or just how I walk. Overall good quality though.

The only downside to these trainers for me is the weight of them. They are not quite is lightweight as I was expecting. Especially after reading the product description. That aside, I have found them to be very comfortable to wear for prolonged periods of time and true to size. The trainers offer great support and feel sturdy too. Recommended.

I have been wearing a pair of safety shoes/trainers from SROTER for the past year and have been really pleased with them, both with their comfort level and with the safety they have provided (i have stepped on several large nails, which have penetrated the sole, but not gone through the Kevlar midsole), but the soles have now started to wear and could do with replacing, so i thought i would give this model a try.I must say that I really quite like the look of this product (although they look a little chunkier around the heel/sole than I would typically like). It has a nice modern design with their black to grey fade colour scheme.  They are light weight and very comfortable to wear for long periods of time.The upper is made from a woven mesh, giving quite a nice appearance and unlike my previous moel that had a “sock design”, meaning there is no tongue, this one is more like a regular shoe, offering a little more support at the heel.The outer sole is quite thick, adding to the cushioning effect on your feet to help with fatigue and has a Kevlar midsole to offer protection from puncturing (up to 1100 N) and of course the toe box has a steel cap to protect your toes from impacts, providing up to 200J / 15KN of crush protection.I ordered these trainers in my usual size 9 and they do fit very nicely. There is just enough wiggle room without them feeling too big.So as far as looks and comfort go, I think this is a great product and performs very well in both areas.The only thing i am not too keen on is the design of the sole, which feels a little slippery. When on the feet, i found them to be quite slippery on carpeted surfaces, but not bad on wood or concrete, although i have a feeling they won’t cope very well with wet or damp surfaces and i’m not sure that they will wear particularly well if your job involves a lot of walking.If they last as well as my previous pair from SROTER, then i think the £39.99 asking price is pretty reasonable and definitely worth considering if you need a pair of safety shoes to wear all day.
reviews.review_title: SROTER - YIYEP - Steel Toe Cap Trainers Safety Shoes

reviews.review_content: I have been looking for a cheap good quality shoe for a long time and came across these yesterday!!! Wow wow wow these have to be the most comfortable safety shoe on the market as I’ve tried other brands and they come nowhere near to these shoes ! Very light and don’t make your feet sweat and plenty of room for your toes !! I was shocked how good the quality is for the price and I work in a hot and humid warehouse and my feet don’t sweat like other brands I have used and honestly it’s like walking on clouds that is how comfortable these are !!!!!FANTASTIC PRODUCT 5⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Having worn safety footwear during various jobs, it is great to have a pair of safety shoes that are good enough to wear with jeans.The shoes are very lightweight and comfortable to wear from first day.
They are excellent very comfortable and very durable excellent quality.

Thanks very much I love these , their so comfy best work steal cap trainers they have ever bought out by far 😀 really recommend 100 per cent , and nicely packed and delivered very quick too , also lovely colours you get a nice choice not that I was bothered about the colour
Fantastic shoe to wear light and nice to wear all day and suitable for a wider fit person
Ok
Very comfortable safety trainers , good to drive in
Fit on the big side, however very comftable and good value.
Really comfortable and light ✨️

reviews.review_content: I am a size 8.5 uk but did have a black pair size 10 which believe it fitted lovely , but washed them and dried them on a low heat, they shrunk so much I couldn’t get them on, so I ordered a new pair, size 10 as I really liked them, these took almost 2 weeks to come even though it started next day delivery, when they came, they were size 11 uk can’t be bothered to send back.
reviews.review_title: Don’t put the anywhere close to heat.

reviews.review_content: I ordered 3 pairs of crocs, one was too small/narrow. I returned the item, it was held in Netherlands customs for some time - I have no control over this. It finally reached the seller and they rejected it!!. I have no idea where the crocs are, and have not received a refund. Be aware if crocs fit then great, if they don’t you might end up like me!.
Tried on a size 6 in store and bought them here but they were way too small and so I had to pay to send them back for their mistake.
Only two months old and stitching is coming away !! Not happy
Ordered a size 8 as I am in trainers, but they’re far too big. Tried to swap but I was asked to pay £17 to go down a size 🤦🏼‍♂️

Was advised fits actual size on profile. I’m a size 7 to small and tight. Should of got a size 8. Couldn’t send them back as I can’t leave my home alone due to illness. Shame really as I was really looking forward to wearing them.

Very disappointed as these were ordered as a gift and I’m sure I’m not asking too much when I assumed I would receive a pair of crocs. No I received just one! I am being refunded and sending one shoe back. Maybe it can be reunited with the other one and be sent to someone as a pair.

After wearing these once, they shrunk in the heat of the car (which I was not aware could happen) after speaking to a member of Crocs customer service they made it very clear they would not honor the 90 day replacement guarantee all because they were bought via their amazon store and not their website.
Ordered in March, delivered in August.Completely the wrong size and don’t even look real. Poor quality and service.I wouldn’t even give 1 star but it’s the only way I could post!

I have three pairs of these, bought a year, six months and a day ago. The first are fine; super comfy and stay on like glue. They are my favourite shoes and I wear them most days, even on hot summer days. The second, the lining has come away from inside the shoe so folds itself inside out every time I take them off. The lining on the third is poorly aligned around the top edge so the plastic rubs. I’ll try another pair as I like them so much but one out decent pair of three smacks of a very poor manufacturing process. Shame.
After wearing for a week the lining began to come away leaving a Sharpe plastic ridge digging in your foot.
Comfy and good at first but lining soon gets loose and flat
Disappointed that not even a shoe box. Shame because it was for a gift too
reviews.review_title: Shoes look OK. But no shoe box. That's disappointing

reviews.review_content: I think for the length of time it took for me to receive this item, along side the price paid... The company could have checked the item was 100% before shipping it. The yellow glue mark from the lining is very off putting and if I decide to keep these it will have to be cut off.Another thing I would recommend would be to size up. My normal crocs have a decent space in them, however my foot is nearly off the end of these.

Way too big, so returned and ordered the next size down, when those arrived one fit comfortably and the other one was way too tight that it hurt, 3 pairs of crocs returned in the same week due to sizing issues, I won’t purchase any in future either. Sizing is too weird not worth the hassle.
Had to send these back. Thought that they were ordinary insulated crocs but when they arrived, they had a very high arch inside that was really uncomfortable.Unfortunately, I couldn't wear them.

Review from 18 months ago - Bought these for slippers, really warm to wear, comfortable, narrower than normal Crocs due to the lining so I don't need to use the rear strap to keep them on my feet.Will see how long the lining lasts, it's stitched in so can't be changed.Edit after 18 months of wearing every day -Lasted well, lining stayed in place, very little wear on the soles (used indoors only) been washed a few times, the lining went flat and has worn through in one place, so I bought another pair... Big mistake...The stitching was appalling, I see some reviews where it actually came away, plus one of mine hardly had any glue holding the liner in and it was loose and came out with my foot each time. There was also glue on the fluffy liner which irritates the skin and had to be picked off.Quality control must have been on a coffee break when these were made.Returned for a refund
reviews.review_title: Warm, comfortable, narrower than normal Crocs, second pair were awful...

reviews.review_content: Great croc, very comfy but they sent the wrong size shoe. Sent me size 10 instead of size 9. Attempted return but needed me to send the parcel to Florida from the UK and had lots of steps to follow. A lot of effort to return. Very dissapointed

I have a normal pair of crocs which I love so thought I’d get some lined ones to use as slippers but not only are these much bigger than expected the lining isn’t soft and comfortable like expected and they are no more comfortable than normal crocs. Bit of a waste of money, just buy normal non lined ones

reviews.review_title: I bought these 6 days ago and they are already broken. Not happy

reviews.review_content: tldr. They got narrower and with fur inside are too tightI have a pair of crocs classic that are great for going to the pool in but too cold during winter. They bang around on my feet in a comfortable way. I got these so I could have a warmer pair. The same size is tight on my feet so I think "Linings will make it smaller" so I order the size up. These are tight on my feet too. So I hold them back to back with my Crocs classic... the larger size is somewhere between 0.5 a 1cm narrower than my old ones, and with a lining making the inside smaller they are tight on my feet. Since these are now the largest size they have I can't get another pair.Just tried them on and am likely going to return them.

I'm a size 10.5 but I ordered and recieved a 12. Could not get my foot in far enough and my entire heel was off the back. The crushing sensation became painful within 10 seconds. I think they're overpriced by £10-15 but since crocs became popular the price has rocketed.I ended up buying a size 14 which have just arrived. The furry lining is all compacted as if they have been worn before and had lots of white specs in them that I had to vacuum out.To sum up: they're ok if you get the right size and don't mind paying the crocs premium price.
Didn't actually realise they would not be real crocs... Will do for round the house bit of a shame
Add around 20% speed with the cushion, money well spent for the mrs
Lovely and comfy however I've has them 2.5 m9nths and the fur on the inside has come away already baring in mind they haven't been worn much the last 3 weeks due to the weather change
Would recommend sizing up as they were too tight so 100% size up!

Bought these to protect my feet from the chilly weather that is the British winter. Comfy, durable, and lightweight - all of what you want from a trendy shoe like this. But you’re in for a treat, not only does it provide you with the above benefits, but it absolutely stinks out your place free of charge.I wear these everywhere inside, but wearing them constantly after a shower has been one of my worst decisions - they feel moist, and also makes your feet smell…bad. To give you an idea of the funky scent that has been brewing in my crocs, imagine you’ve just been to the gym, taken off your socks and just sat there taking in the fishy smell over your dinner which you forgot was out of date. It’s bad, a scent I would not wish upon my worst enemy.But seriously, if you are to buy these, they’ll keep your feet warm - but you might need to wash them and your feet once or twice, and also invest in a few bottles of Febreze.UPDATE:Following recent heated talks with my partner about the intensity of the stench, I had to put them through a good wash and I’m happy to announce it now smells fresh. But I’d recommend wearing socks to prevent natural foot sweat from seeping into the croc sole & so starting the vicious cycle again.

The non-removable lining is a real pain.I wash these every few weeks min.  Drying is a nightmare.  Inside. Outside. Greenhouse. Tumble dryer.  Lying in Aug sunshine They take forever to dry.  They should have put the liner on some velcro/other fixings.  Inflexible if you're near water.  The liner also becomes embedded with grass and other plant/ ground-level detritus.

I have the exact same size in the Unisex Bayaband style and they fit perfectly.These on the other hand are much narrower, even taking the liner into account, and as such I cannot fit into them comfortably.The quality looked good and the liner warm. It's a shame.

The crocs are great and comfy, although I did order a size 10 UK Mens and got a size 11 delivered so they are slightly too large. However that is fine since I only plan on using them for indoors.Overall happy with the purchase but consider going a size down or use amazon prime try before you buy. 🙂

I love me some Crocs but it’s the first time purchasing from Amazon and buying the clog lined Crocs. Just a heads up the do run small, my other Crocs from JD and Asos are (women) UK6/US8 so I ordered these from Amazon (women) UK7, according to the options given and after reading some reviews saying they come up small/short. Well they didn’t fit so I had to return them and order a size up which is UK8 (which I know isn’t my real size) so these definitely are not true to size.I’ve ordered a men’s UK6 (women UK7) before from JD but there were not insulated with the warm fluffy lining, they didn’t fit,  was too large hence why I thought these one would fit but didn’t. However after going up another side to the women UK8 they did fit perfectly so I think it’s just the sizing is off on these, everything is lovely and it’s genuine Crocs.I have mobility issues, lower back pain and sciatica so I’m looking forward to wearing these clog lined Crocs during the cold months. They are comfortable!
Too big

These are really cosy but come up small so size down! I actually ended up returning as I got some Town & Country clogs for a quarter of the price and I figured if it rains the rain will go through the holes into the fir!
Lovely and warm
Keep your feet warm. For some reason keep my feet dry when walking in the rain. Amazing 👏
These are very comfy, though I feel like the fluffy inside makes the shoe a little smaller on the inside, so mine were on the tighter side.
reviews.review_title: A little smaller than expected but comfy

reviews.review_content: SUPER snug and comfy stay on and secure feeling 100% recommend these. HOWEVER.. I’m a size 4 I bought a size 4 and I’d say they are too small and hurt the toes and don’t really notice this until you are walking about in them so I would definitely recommend 1 size up on the fur lined ones!! Get the next time up and these are a bargain

They're so comfy! And they are easy to slip on and off, and a good size. However, they are a nightmare to clean (the lining), it doesn't detatch so you have to wash the whole shoe, and I tried once and left it to dry all day and it didn't and then they started to smell damp so I had to re wash, and leave them Infront of a fan. The fuzz also loses its softness quickly
reviews.review_title: So comfy but hard to clean

reviews.review_content: Absolutely love these never got them of my feet fit perfectly not tried washing them yet so can’t comment about that
Bought for my son for Christmas. Finds these very comfy like slippers but can be worn outside. Really pleased with them

So I needed a pair of house shoes to bob outside and slip on in a jiffy. These Crocs are great, very durable, very comfortable, and warm.They are perfect for needing to slip on quickly, which is a must when you have a puppy. They have also stood up well to a chewy pup who often sneaks off with the shoes when you not looking.The size I ordered was true to my foot size, and they fit well. They are also easy to clean/wipe down when you need to remove dirt.Overall a really practical and comfortable product would reccomend

I am in my 80’s and spend a lot of time indoors or in the garden. Really fed up with slippers which don’t fulfill the promise of comfort,warmth and hardwearing soles. Some are very expensive but not worth their cost. AT LAST I discovered crocs(thanks to my granddaughter)They are BRILLIANT. Fit perfectly, cosy and warm because of the lining and good for nipping outside to the garden. I did go a size up from 5 to 6because of the lining and they fit perfectly.

Bought for my daughter who really loves these. Wears a size 6 1/2 shoe and bought a size 7 Croc, which fits comfortably. She says they are comfy and warm, easy to put on and off and stay on her foot fine. Only downside is that the lining is glued to the shoe so can’t be removed for washing or replacement.

Having gone from “I’ll never own crocs they’re hideous” to owning some for the easy slip on off functionality but “I’ll never wear them out” to “oops I accidentally went out in my crocs” to “I can’t live without them I must now have house crocs, messy crocs, best crocs…” these are super cosy and keep my feet lovely and warm whilst providing superior comfort!
I’ve never owned a pair of crocs before and I wish I had tried them sooner. They’re comfortable, warm and lightweight. Give them a go
Say what you want about Crocs, these lined crocs are super comfy and they fit so well. I wear them around the house and at work on my night shifts. Love em!
They're just the job for wearing indoors and outdoors. Keep my feet nice and warm. Not heavy to wear either. The blue colour is nice too.

Never had crocs before , I like yellow and am only using in garden , on reflection may be should have gone for darker colour, fleece inside keeps feet warm, I don’t bother with socks if wearing these , only downside is if the grass is wet then the fleece bit gets wet and takes a while to dry , I should have thought that through

Suffering from plantar fasciitis and needing something for comfort after advice from friends suggested these would do the job. Only just received bit they are comfy went up a size after reading the reviews and fit perfectly.
Never liked the look of crocks and actually hated them before even trying them, but I actually took the plunge to annoy my kids and guess what, they are actually great, not much more to say.
reviews.review_title: First time for clogs and yes they are great

reviews.review_content: Ordered an 8. What arrived claimed to be an 8 on the tongue but no way on earth is it right. Maybe wrong label placed in shoe because it was more a 9.5 than an 8. It is more annoying than anything else as they do look decent. Not amazing and for the money you can absolutely find much much better trainers from Under Armour. If they fit I would have still kept them though but certainly not bought any further pairs. Sorry guys but these are not true size.

So hard to find good wide fitting shoes, I hoped these would be the answer.Tried them on the house and all seemed great. Decided to take a chance with them as quite expensive for a brand I have never heard of.Sadly after less than 5 min walking in them the pain in my feet was unbearable. The style and fit clearly does not suit my feet and now I have a pair of trainers I can’t wear. Gutted.Can’t even return now they have been worn.

I’ve had the shoes for 1.5 months, in total I’ve worn them maybe 10 times - the first fit was perfect but they very quickly stopped fitting right. My feet now slide around inside, there is zero support and they’re totally out of shape. Not worth the money paid for them, I’m really let down. Comfort wise? When they fit at the beginning, great now they’re about as uncomfortable as you can get.
reviews.review_title: Out of shape and totally unusable

reviews.review_content: So first up. This is the best trainer I have ever had. I have been fighting some knee issues and these shoes have helped immensely. I bought these 7 weeks ago. And now the base is coming completely loose. It seems that the glue is failing. So are they fit for purpose? No. Are they are amazing shoe. Yes.

Sent direct from China, bought size extra wide and what arrived seem like size 12. Width was great length was ludicrous. I processed a 'return' and I was issued a refund and told I could keep the shoes. Nuff said.
Pick a darker colour, if i buy again

Bought these for my Dad as hebhas terrible rheumatoid arthritis and his feet are a mess, wish he had returned them as the souls are not soft at all. I would find them uncomfortable. Very expensive waste of money.

Measured these against my £25 ascis trainers which are just a basic trainer and these were no wider infact they were slightly smaller and my trainers are just standard trainers nothing special about them. The fitvilles had a spongy sole same as my trainers and were lace up same as my trainers, they had no arch support as described and just a basic insole same as my trainers. So my question is why spend £60 on these if they are no different to standard trainers. I'm sending these back for a refund and I would not recommend them if you are looking for wide fit trainers.
reviews.review_title: Not any wider than standard trainers so no point in paying £60

reviews.review_content: I ordered these trainers as they are wide fitting, however I was unable to even get my feet into the trainer due to the idiotic design of a fixed tongue! Whoever thought that restricting the opening on wide fitting shoes was a good idea is obviously in the wrong job!!

This trainer cannot be opened to get your foot in it. The only access is through the top...with a shoehorn. First one i've ever had like this...weird. I am sending it back. if you have to take one off while you're out you are going to have a lot of trouble getting your foot back in it!
reviews.review_title: Only access for your foot is through the top,

reviews.review_content: This trainers are quite heavy .

The shoes are very comfortable, easy to slip on and off with the added bonus of a nice wide fit and they look quite nice. But, and this a big but, I would have expected that for this money they would have at least been water repellent!! But NO even the dampest slightly raised grass results in water ingress to a scale that I may have just gone out in my socks.  For a supposedly sports/ activity shoe this can only be described as no better than flip flops and definitely not fit for purpose. 🙁

I feel like these are like stalletoes or something I'm 2 inches taller wearing them. Don't seem natural to me feels like I'll break my ankle. They are wide enough which is rare. Also the soles made from some plastic nonsense not rubber like they advertise. I won't be keeping them

I got a pair of these in UK size 9.5 wide. I've had trainers from New Balance and Asics in the same size and found them to be a good fit but finding them in a wide fit is now extremely difficult. These are at least one whole size bigger than any I've had before. The soles are stiff, like trainers from decades ago, the overall style is bulky (more bulky than the pictures suggest) and the colours are paler than shown in the pictures, which makes them look cheaper. They took ages to arrive as well. If these were £30 and sized correctly they'd be fine but for this price they're bad value.

I recently bought a pair of tennis shoes from FitVille and loved them, so I was looking forward to trying out these trainers. Unfortunately they were not true to size, they felt too loose and roomy on my feet and were slightly too long in length, which is strange because the tennis shoes I got (same size: UK 11 Wide) fit me perfectly.I also didn't like the fact that they don't have a tongue opening, the shoe is all one piece of mesh material; I much prefer shoes to have a tongue because it makes them easier to put on and take off and makes them easier to tighten. The laces don't go far enough down the foot to tighten the shoe from top to bottom properly either.Just when I thought I'd found a go-to shoe brand for my wide feet I try these out and am left disappointed. Shame.

I found them quite heavy on my feet and lose around the ankle to the extent it was changing the way I walk, so I’ve returned them, please note you lose 20% on the return amount plus postage to Germany so I doubt I’ll be purchasing trainers again from this company, the cost of you don’t like them and need to return them is prohibitive

For a shoe advertised as 'X-wide' fit, the opening is extremely tight when trying to get them on your feet and remain tight around/below the ankle when you're wearing them, there is literally no give. Plenty of space for the toes when/if you get them on though.

I was really disappointed by the shoe.The sizing is far too big, well over 1 size too big, and they are very wide too, even for someone who has wide feet.The quality is poor, and they are in no way a running shoe. Don't buy these for actual running.The best way to describe them is like a big pair of Sketchers.
reviews.review_title: Not in any way a running shoe

reviews.review_content: I have a walking pair of fitville trainers which have been great, and thought I'd try this running pair. as it did now fit, sent back,

I bought these after discovering Asics Gel Venture running shoes in a 4E width and that experience means only 4E will do now - solved so many foot pain issues. I run and walk a lot so those Asics are superb. Price wise these are, at full price, similar to the Asics but would say the Fitvilles don’t quite live up the same quality and functional design detailing of Asics. These get a huge thumbs up for width and arch support built in but I would describe these as general footwear and not sports shoes. The main reasons would be - the fit is a little loose (ironically width) around the arch area of the foot, the heal fit is also a tad too flat so doesn’t fit snuggly to my heal shape. The final issue is the lacing and tongue. The tongue isn’t separate to the sides - more like a slip on - so limits the tightening up. The lacing holes fall short in distance at the ankle compared to most sport specific shoes. This results in a too loose fit around the ankle for running or any sport - in my opinion and for my desired fit - everyone is different.  I would recommend these as wide fit daily footwear but not sports shoes. A real plus for Fitville is the arch support and stock wide fitting that are available. My reason for not simply re ordering Asics comes down to the usual issue with specialist sports brands - they never seem to either have stock or keep the range consistent.
reviews.review_title: Great wide fit shoe but, perhaps, not for sports.

reviews.review_content: Firstly, I really like fitville shoes, this being my 4th pair.I find the fit brilliant, (I wear the wide, not extra wide), and they're really comfortable.HOWEVER!The tread seems to wear remarkably fast, this pair for instance I've had a week, yup seven days worn probably 4 days and the tread is already disappearing, it's not as I walk much, I'm a driver by trade.My last two pairs were similar and the first pair cracked across the sole making them unwearable.If fitville sorted it's soles then they'd be on to a winner.
Ideal if you have bionions and  need the extra toe room

These are a good solid pair of trainers. I did have some trepidation in ordering another pair of Fitsvile trainer as my earlier purchase had to be returned as the gap to place your foot in was too small for my swollen feet, given I had neuropathy.

Best fitting trainers I have ever brought !I ordered the wide fit which is perfect for meI will buy again in the future

But these really are a great fit.
these are possibly the comfiest trainers i have ever worn, i have flat feet and need a wide fit, i can wear these all day without any discomfort, 5 out of 5 from me, well worth the money! 👍

reviews.review_content: The price and availability of this shoe seems to be a bit all over the place, perhaps depending on time of the year. Certainly the prices I saw for it over the summer are definitely not worth paying.On the good side, the shoe design is smart, with an all black design that isn't too distracting, and can pass off as being a smart shoe suitable for many working environments. The shoe is light, with side and upper inner meshing as well as some ventilation holes along the side doing a good job to help keep the feet cool in the summer months. The structure around the heel is pretty good and although the lip folds in, the rest of the structure usually remains upright, making for a shoe that's easier to slip on without needing a horn or a pull tab.On the negative side, this iteration seems to have a pretty poor insole design, that starts wearing away pretty quickly with extended use. Also, this design doesn't have a particularly thick or strong leather, and you may find that with a few months usage tears begin to form near the toes

reviews.review_content: Comfortable and flexible walking shoe. Wear them frequently for walks around town and parks. reviews.review_content: These shoes were a little tight at first but soon became very comfortable to wear.  Great for walking in.  If you suffer with plantar fasciitis they are supportive and pain when walking is a memory.  I recommend these shoes.

After experimenting with different brands over the years, I've been wearing both Reebok Classic Leathers and Reebok Hi-Tops - both plain black and plain white - for more than 20 years. I find them supremely lightweight and very comfortable... and they last for ages. The only downside is that they are always a little stiff at first so take about a week to wear in and stretch to the exact shape of my feet. After that... bliss.I stopped buying plain white ones some time ago but still have 3 pairs of Hi-Tops in use, 1 pair still unworn in their box as I now prefer the low-slung versions as I've aged and no longer need the ankle support.The time came to replace my black Reebok Classic Leathers and I was surprised how much the price had risen... plus the sole appears to now be very heavily ribbed, which I'm not keen on. I found these 'Reebok Men's Work N Cushion 4.0 Walking Shoe' which look the same but with a less heavily ribbed sole... and are cheaper. Win-Win... but the proof is in the wearing.After a week of wearing first 1 then 2 pairs of socks to stretch the uppers to the shape of my feet... it's back to bliss again.Now, if only there was a 'Reebok Classic Leather' *slip-on* style for us very much older folk, life would be perfect. :)
On my feet all day and these are a comfortable shoe.They are not a work shoe but are fine for someone who walks a fair bit or standing for long periods.

My other half got these as he walks for a living and it has been hard to find trainers which are comfy and last a while, we got these on the off chance they may be some good and i have to say he has had them a little over a year and they are still going strong, no rips or holes appearing and they are still as comfy as they were when we first got them, 5 stars from me

Pity I had to give away 2 new pairs before I discovered these Reebok trainers. The gentleman who stated how most makes of trainers are inclined to be much slimmer fitting was spot on. Ideal for diabetics who want to retain blood flow to their toes.A E Bird

reviews.review_content: Colour not as advertised

Zunächst zu mir: Bin über 1,90 m groß, rund 100 kg und habe die Schuhe für Hobby Badminton und Squash gekauft. Trotz Körpermaße und Hobby Sport habe ich einen recht aggessiven Spielstil mit vielen schnellen, auch seitlichen, Richtungswechseln. Daher suche ich einen Schuhe mit gutem Seitenhalt und guter Stützung. Übelicherweise trage ich Größe 46, habe mir den Schuh aufgrund anderer Rezensionen in 46 2/3 bestellt.Erster Test im Wohnzimmer:Hatte als andere Alternative einen "normalen" Hallenschuh einer anderen Marke bestellt, der sich auch ganz "normal" angefühlt hat. Im Vergleich fällt sofort auf, wie steif der Spezial ist. Im ersten Moment unangenehm, aber wenn man die ersten schnellen Schritte und Richtungswechsel macht, ist das großartig.Als nächstes fällt beim normalen Gehen oder leichtem Joggen die harte Kante der Sohle an der Verse (gegenüber der Rundung vieler anderer Schuhe) auf. geschmeidiges Abrollen kann man vergessen. Aber auch das ist bei flotten, kurzen Bewegungen und Sprüngen kein Problem und trägt evtl. sogar noch etwas zur Stabilität bei.Dann zur allgemeinen Passform: nach ein paar Minuten im Wohnzimmer kam ich zu dem Schluss, dass der Schuh zwar nicht bequem ist, aber an sich gut passt und seinen Job gut machen sollte. Auf jeden Fall viel stabiler als ein normaler Hallenschuh - das hat halt seinen Preis.Test beim Badminton:Gestern dann für 1,5h beim Badminton getestet und eine böse Überraschung erlebt...Das positive zuerst - der Schuh bietet wirklich genialen Halt, man hat volles Vertrauen in jeden Richtungswechsel und auch ein gutes Gefühl, nicht umzuknicken, auch wenn man mal unsauber landet. Auch der geringere Comfort fällt im Spiel überhaupt nicht auf.Nun das Problem und der Grund für die Rücksendung:Ich habe erst nach einigen Minuten angefangen es zu merken, aber alles rund um die Öffnung ist schlicht etwas zu weit hoch gezogen und eben auch genauso steif wie der restliche Schuh. Betrifft bei mir besonders die Knöchelinnenseite und die Lasche vorne. Das mag natürlich zur Stabilität beitragen, hat aber auch einen dramatischen Nebeneffekt, wenn Fuß und vor allem Knöchelform nicht 100 % zum Schuh passen - bereits nach einer Dreiviertelstunde hätte ich aufgrund der Schmerzen am liebsten aufgehört oder Schuhe gewechselt (hatte aber keine anderen dabei). Trotz gut passenden Sportsocken hat mit die Lasche die Haut vorne am Knöchel aufgerieben, ebeso wie der Seitenteil die Haut unterhalb des inneren Knöchels. Der Bereich ist durch den Druck zusätzlich noch geschwollen. Davon werdich wohl noch einige Tage was haben.Daher geht der Schuh - eigentlich schon leider - zurück. Wäre er um den Knöchel herum etwas niedriger, wäre er perfekt für meine Anwendung. So ist es aber keinerlei Option. Insbesondere da der Schuh nicht den Eindruck machen als würde er sich auch nut im Gerinsten an den Fuß anpassen...Da das Problem sicher nicht bei jedem besteht, probiert ihn gerne aus, aber stellt euch drauf ein zurückschicken zu müssen - und nehmt einen Wechselshuh mit, wenn ihr einen längeren Test plant...
reviews.review_title: So steif und hoch, dass er perfekt passen muss - bei mir leider nicht der Fall

Hatte genau die gleichen Schuhe 2016 gekauft. Die haben vier Jahre gehalten. Das fand ich gut und habe sie daher wie gehabt nachbestellt.Als erstes war die Einlegesohle im rechten Schuh einen Zentimeter zu weit hinten eingeklebt. Vorne war dementsprechend eine Lücke von einem Zentimeter. Zuerst wollte ich sie deswegen zurückschicken. Aber sicher versucht man ja solche Fehler nicht zu reparieren, sondern schmeißt die neuen Schuhe direkt in den Schredder. Daher habe ich erstmal versucht, die Sohle zu lösen. Dank schlampiger Verklebung (bei den alten Schuhen waren die Einlegesohlen auch nach vier Jahren noch bombenfest verklebt) hat das geklappt. Auch ließen sich die Klebereste leidlich von der Innenseite des Schuhs entfernen.Jetzt habe ich festgestellt, dass eine Naht im Fersenbereich reibt. Nicht hilfreich ist, dass die Passform beider Schuhe unterschiedlich ist. Der linke ist ok, im rechten schlupfe ich, wenn ich die Schnürsenkel nicht megafest anziehe.Fazit: Kaufe ich nicht mehr.

    I wanted to share my thoughts on these trainers I recently bought, honestly, they've been a game-changer for me.As someone who spends a lot of time on sites, safety is my top priority. These trainers with steel toe caps have given me a newfound confidence in my work. I've accidentally dropped heavy tools on my feet, and thanks to these shoes, I walked away without a scratch. That's a peace of mind I can't put a price on.But it's not just about safety; they're surprisingly comfortable too. I used to come home with sore feet after long days, but these trainers provide incredible cushioning and support. It's like walking on clouds, even on those tough, uneven surfaces.What's impressive is their durability. I've put them through some serious abuse, and they still look almost brand new. They're built to last, which is a huge relief considering how often I used to replace my old work shoes.Now, here's the fun part - they don't look like your typical clunky work shoes. They've got a modern, stylish design that doesn't scream "safety shoes." I've even worn them outside of work, and they blend right in.To sum it up, these safety trainers have truly changed the game for me. They've got safety, comfort, durability, and style all rolled into one. If you're in the market for work shoes, do yourself a favor and give these a try. You won't regret it.

Measure chest circumference   Place the tape measure around the chest at the widest point, just under the armpits. Make sure that the tape measure does not cut in. You should only wear thin clothing when measuring, so as not to distort the values.       2. Measure waist circumference   Place the tape measure around the waist - at the narrowest point, just above the belly button.       3. Waist measurement:   Place the tape measure around the hips - at the widest point of the hips and buttocks. Make sure that the tape measure on its back does not hang down or protrude.              Notes:   If you are between sizes, order the smaller size for a tighter fit or the larger size for a further fit. If you receive two different size suggestions for your waist and waist measurements, order the size according to your hip circumference.   Tops in large sizes (height 183 cm to 196 cm): Tops are 4.5 cm longer than normal tops. The sleeve length has been proportionally adjusted depending on the silhouette. Large sizes are available for selected tops only.   Tip: If you do not have a tape measure at hand, you can use a thread and then measure its marked length with the ruler.

Another waist 34 is a little big at the waist, so I can only use in the winter when I wear t-shirts and long sleeve tuck in shirts; not for wearing sweat shirts or banded bottom shirts.  Now my waist is 36, but I do fit comfortably in the 33 waist size and the 34 waist size.  I am satisfied with these jeans; more so because they stretch at the waist and they have more room in the crotch; for us chubbier old guys.  Being few other jeans stretch at the waist, I will be purchasing these again. I was pleased to order these sweatpants after reading many of the user reviews on Amazon.  However, I have to admit to being disappointed.I ordered size L - I am a 34" waist with a 30" inside leg measurement.  The waist fits perfectly without being tight at all, there is enough room in the body section of the sweatpants so they remain casual and comfortable without being tight, but the legs?  They are barely 30" long and if I hoist the waist up a bit then they rise almost above the ankles.  Given there was no choice of leg length, either I received a faulty pair or else the expectation is that for size L then men will have short-regular sized legs, which is rarely the case and probably a good job that my leg length was not longer.The fabric itself is comfortable to wear but I found it very thin.  They offer no actual warmth, they simply cover the body and legs.  The leg design is straight leg so the legs, at least, are as comfortable as the body.Because I sit at a desk at home for many hours a day, I wanted something comfortable to wear (jeans and dress pants are too uncomfortable to sit around in).  These sweatpants do meet that bill, they are comfortable to sit around in.  I would also have expected them to be thicker quality and warm, but they are not.I postponed writing this review until I had washed them.  The instructions say that a 30 degree wash in a machine and a low heat tumble dry is okay.  I am happy to say that I didn't notice any shrinkage.Given that these are comfortable to sit around in at a desk and appear to wash/dry without shrinkage, I decided to keep them.  Priced at £11.55 at the time of this review (reduced from £18.10) I do have to say they are not worth the money.  I have given 4 stars.  It was going to be a 3 star review but because the laundering of the sweatpants was a success then I added a star for that.

reviews.review_content: These pants are well made, extremely comfortable and very good value for money. I’m really impressed, they were an excellent buy.At the same time I bought a pair of branded pants, thinking I’d want to send the Amazon brand ones back. Quite the opposite. I sent back the branded ones..

reviews.review_content: I was so incredibly excited for this product but then incredibly disappointed once I used it. It ripped on the first day I used it. Didn’t have long nails even. The fabric just immediately ripped! It’s too expensive for what it actually offers.

They are good for a couple of times use! I used it 5 times and holes started to appear. Sent them back for a full refund.If they lasted longer, I would have kept them as they were very comfortable and did keep me from slipping.  I just wish the materials were better.
reviews.review_title: They are good for a couple of times use!

reviews.review_content: The sizing is hopeless. I gave them to a friend.
reviews.review_title: The sizing is no good. 4/5 or 6/7 is hopeless for a size 5/6.

reviews.review_content: I’m a UK 5.5 and bought the 4.5-5.5 which fits fine.  I have a very narrow foot so they feel slightly loose but hope they’ll be ok when I wear them in the pool when I’m teaching to stop me slipping! I’ll review again once I’ve worn them in the pool.Well, tried them around and in the pool before teaching (disabled children, so need to be safe!) it was like being on ice and I nearly went flying!  Definitely NOT non slip. Consequently I would not recommend these as they are not fit for purpose! Complete waste of money and dangerous to wear on any surface that is slightly smooth!
reviews.review_title: Nice looking pool shoe but NOT non slip!!!

reviews.review_content: purchased for my wife but these shoes will fit a male adult, my wife is small with size 5 shoes, which was stated but they are far too big.

I bought these swim shoes to provide a little more grip in the pool.  The base of the shoes consist of a plastic gel shaped to look like grip but are actually dangerously slippy, far more so than bare feet.  On my first time of wearing them I have slipped and bruised my ribs.  These are not fit for purpose.

Bought these to go on holiday, swimming in the sea from a stony beach. Fit felt ok on dry land, but no grip and quite slippy, also very loose when in the water, felt more like flippers. Sadly can’t return as outside timeframe.

The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
        
    
    








  
  
    So wide and big. I ordered a five these are like a seven, I would not even let my granny wear these unless her feet had swollen to elephant feet… hmm no… not even then
reviews.review_title: Big fat abnormal feet required to fit these

reviews.review_content: I wore they so I would be safe, but slipped and damaged my leg.

These were comfy and fit well, I had high hopes. However, after only four days of light use on holiday in the pool and beach, they literally fell apart. Very disappointing. I ended up having to bin them whilst on holiday as they became a trip hazard. Absolute waste of money.
reviews.review_title: Fell apart after four days - useless, ended up throwing them on holiday

reviews.review_content: Nice product, but not true to size, im a size 5, so ordered a size 4/12  to 5/12 thinking they may be tight due to the material. I will say they arrived on time, but were way to big, now im having problems trying to send them back as i can not return them due to not having a printer, and can not get to a post office or any other place because im disabled and rely on others for help !!! I can not  ask someone to take me 20 mile to return this, my only joy is going swimming once a week. Please can this be resolved ???

Bought this to wear at indoor swimming pool. Very comfortable, nice fit, and great colour BUT on the tiled floor outside the pool, AND inside the pool itself - your feet SLIP - you cannot get any grip on the bottom of the pool when trying to stand up; and slide on the steps getting out. SO NOT very safe. Otherwize would be a great item. Probably better at the beach, on sand, in the sea - rather than swimming pools.
reviews.review_title: Nice item but not good on tiled flooring

reviews.review_content: Prompt delivery.I bought my usual size but they do appear to be very large. I do have fairly wide feet but I do seem to slide about in these. I’d size down if I went for these again.They do appear to be well made but I have concerns about how good they’ll be when in use.I haven’t tried them in water so don’t know if they will continue to slide about which could be dangerous. Rubber soles but these are very thin. If they prove to be usable I’ll update the review.

Nice looking product, fits well, comfortable.  However, I wanted these to do aqua aerobics and these are so slippery on the bottom of the pool. Absolutely no grip on them.  Slip and slide all over, better off with nothing but I don't like the feel of the pool floor and in terms of hygiene, I like that I can go into the pool with them from pool side and then straight out and into the shower.
They fill with water and make it very difficult to swim

I thought these were perfect until I did an aqua class and they kept coming off.  I am a size 6.5 UK so ordered the 6-7 size as the size down 4.5-5.5 would have been way too small.  Sending them to the charity shop :(
reviews.review_title: Keep coming off during aqua class

reviews.review_content: I'm a size 7 bought size 6.5 and it's TOO BIG and very uncomfortable, my feet don't feel supported and I don't feel safe.

Had these a while now ,I don't normally write reviews but these shoes are sold for swimming and aqua well they are not safe on pool side very slippy and in the pool they give no grip what so ever,on the whole very unhappy and not really doing what they are sold for at all !!
Product looks lovely, but is the wrong size I ordered 6/7 but the packing says 41/42 which is 7/8 and they are about 1.5cm too long
Bought these to keep feet dry during dog walking. Ok for casual use and swimming baths though.

Had high hope for these, but unfortunately they broke and split at the toe after wearing only a handful of times.Sizing was good though. I’m a size UK 6 shoe and have wide feet and these were fit for purpose and comfortable. I just wish they had lasted longer!
Very comfortable when first bought but stretched so much that they keep coming off in the swimming pool. Made elastic straps to put round my foot but even that doesn't stop them coming off now.
I ordered small for a size 4-4.5 shoe and when doing aqua they fall off as they are too large and the insides have already come lose and need sticking
Still flip in the pool no good for aqua fit
reviews.review_title: Might be ok on the beach

reviews.review_content: Not too to size, at least 1-2 sizes too big
reviews.review_title: Nice but not true to size

reviews.review_content: The shoes do the job (when in the water) but they do not feel super comfortable. The feet feel sweaty (out of the water, even when the shoe is dry) and "odd", and the sole started to break just after a few uses.
reviews.review_title: Make your feet sweat and break easily

reviews.review_content: Hi I loved these when I got them. They are easy to put on and comfortable however I got them so I could do exercises and walk in the pool but they are too slippery so I need to get something else. They are great for beach swimming.

Had to return this as I purchased them for aqua fit class but found I was still slipping about with them on . Very comfortable and good enough for the beach or just swimming but not good for aqua fit.

Wore these for a day out to a water park and I could have been trying to balance on ice the soles of these shoes were so slippery. Most people wore water shoes but only this style seemed to have a grip problem. Very dangerous to wear in this type of environment but do perform better on the beach and comfortable to wear. Look good too.
reviews.review_title: Extremely slippy on hard wet surfaces

reviews.review_content: These are nice, but I found they ran a little big for me.
reviews.review_title: Comfortable but run a little big

reviews.review_content: Very pleased with these water shoes. The fit is good and the pattern is really pretty. I bought them for when I'm assisting pupils in the water so I have a bit more grip, they're perfect for that. One star deducted as they were supposed to be next day delivery, tracking stated 'handed to resident' on Thursday but I didn't receive them until Sunday.

These are very cute, snug fitting, and comfortable. The only reason 1 star dropped as not sure how long they’ll last. They seem well made but will they last more than one season? Time will tell….BTW I have 3 pairs in different prints as they’re really cute
Haven't used yet but they look quite nice and the pattern is pretty. I hope they work well in the water on my holiday.
Bought these for aquafit and they are great. I’m a size 39 so based on the other reviews I bought the 4.5 to 5.5 ones and they fit perfectly. Will buy another pair.
I am a size 5 so I ordered size 4.5/5.5 but they are still too big more like a size 6. I would like to add that I ordered a size 3.5-4 and that fits me like a glove.

These shoes are great value but do come up a bit big. I also feel like they're more socks than shoes despite having a separate hard sole. Basically,  I will wear them because I bought them but I  wouldn't buy them again

MU UK size is 6 so I have purchased size 6-7 and shouse slightly to big as to cover size 7. I guess size 4-5.5 will be to small. So my question is why the size 5-6 not available will be perfect fit for me.
Nice shoes hopefully will feel ok on the beachSizing is very big thoughChoose a size smaller than you are
reviews.review_title: Sizing is large , go down a size

reviews.review_content: Like the design but quite a thin sole and upper so not sure how hard-wearing they'll be
Look good feel good. Fit for purpose,  but would have preferred soul to be a little thicker. Hence 4 stars
The shoes feel comfortable and are nice quality. I ordered the 6/7 size (I take a size 7 shoe), and they feel rather loose. But I think once they’re wet they’ll ’stick’ to my feet 🤞
Easy slip on shoe. Great for rocks or pebbles at beach just cushions the sole and also non slip for around a pool ect
Very colourful and comfortable swim shoes. I have not yet used them on the beach yet, but I think they will be useful for protection from stony beaches. Nice and stretchy, so easy to put on.
Very comfortable & light weight to wear. Had a good grip & look great too!
Light and very comfortable, protect from the very cold water.

These swim shoes are comfortable and fit well - no flapping. I need them on my beach in Dorset  because people are always getting spines from Weever fish in their feet. One day last August there were 3 people sitting with their feet in bowls of hot water outside the lifeguards hut. If only they had bought these shoes!
I suffer from Neuropathy and the soles of my feet hurt.I got these swim shoes to wear at Aqua aerobics and they made a huge difference to my comfort. Great purchase.
👍 fit, great quality  prompt delivery
I find these supper comfy, feel safe wearing them as I'm diabetic and have had both knees replaced. Well worth the money.
For use in the  pool

reviews.review_content: I bought these flipflops as i thought branded ones from crocs would be comfortable, boy was i wrong! The textured bumps on the sole of your feet feel like needles are entering your foot and after a while start to rip tour skin off. If you're going to wear for longer than 1 minute at a time, don't bother getting them
These Crocs were supposed to size 12 UK but are more like a 13

While on the face of it these flip flops look like are made of premium materials, unfortunately there is a major design flow, in that they are only held together by glue. These fell apart after 5 months of moderate use, only a few times a week for brief periods at the swimming pool.
Flip flops look nice, but not safe when feet are wet ,and didn't last a 2week holiday as toe Post stretched to doubled in size unsafe.

The construction is faulty - the toe piece and the cross strap are glued together, not one moulded piece as usual.  Wore for 2 weeks in Tenerife and all good  but wore for 4 days in Cyprus around the pool in hot weather and the glue failed.  Rubbish!

I've worn Croc Flops for years and love them normally.  This pair gave me major blisters between my toes.  Finally realised the problem is the size of the thong between my toes is much longer. Normal pair is 2 cm high, this pair over 2.5cm high.  Exactly the same size.  Not sure if faulty pair or if these aren't really Crocs?
I previously had a pair that lasted me 10 years, only using them on holidays. I bough this pair last year, used it for 2 weeks, this year they broke after a few days. Definitely won't buy again.

I really expected better from this brand! Purchased new for my holidays, literally wore them for less than a week, please see attached images of what happened! They are made up of two sections which are only glued together!
These are stupidly oversized. I am a size 10 and I already knew crocs with big so I ordered a 9. Even these were too big and I had to return. Why crocs, why
Unacceptable, after 3 months it felt apart.

I was so excited to wear these on holidays but unfortunately within 10minutes walking they had cut both feet at the top of my toes. One of the selling points was that they didn’t rub your toes. I couldn’t wear them the rest of the holiday and had two cuts the rest of holiday.!

Could only give overall rating of 2 stars.  Nothing wrong with the product but, purchased as  a gift on 30th July, the delivery date eventually, after delays, was 17th September.  I would suggest finding another seller - even if slightly more expensive.
These are my 4th pair of crocs and I bought them last July 2022. Worn them for 2 holidays and they have come un stuck. Very very disappointed
I have normal size feet and these are uncomfortably wide..
Great flip flops, but they sent out a size 9 and I ordered a size 8?!

These have a ridge that runs down the toe thong and under your toes, in the toe/foot ridge. They gave me major blisters that took days to heal. Not what you want on holiday.Very poor design. Don’t buy them

I had a pair of there for 7 or 8 years and they were great. In fact the old one are still usable but the souls are completely bald.The new ones have been a big disappointment. The photos say it all the piping around the edge is coming off after only a handful of wears. I spent extra to get original Crocs but I won't be doing it again.

Found these to be slippery on your foot and would have preferred a not so glossy finish with the bobbles. Have had straight foam before which was actually more comfortable. Sizing of flip flops is all over the place as I tried a couple others. One of those things that might be easier to try on first in a store.

I ordered my usual size as I needed these ASAP for a holiday, they came but are too big. Unfortunately already cut off the tags but stuck by the usual size from the CROCS website, meaning they are uncomfortable and give me blisters. If you can get the right size, these are brilliant! If not, then avoid and buy directly from CROCS!
The sandals snapped after 2nd day of wearing them. I wouldn't recommend them waste of money.

Nice flip flops that feel great in your feet. I've found the material becomes super slippery when wet which is not ideally considering it is the type of footwear you have on near water. The 'C' on the croc has also gone walkies so I would not say it's super well made considering I've just been wearing it for daily, mainly indoor use.
reviews.review_title: It's nice but super slippery if your foot gets wet.

reviews.review_content: I bought these based on reviews, well they quite destroyed my feet during my 8 day holiday by the sea. Not suitable for long distances
reviews.review_title: not so good as the rating says

reviews.review_content: There is no label which describes the colour, so I'm not sure if I was sent the correct product. This was supposed to be graphite/volt green. The picture on amazon looks very dark grey, almost black, which us what I would expect for 'graphite'. The product is a much lighter grey.
reviews.review_title: Actual colour doesn't match Amazon picture

reviews.review_content: My husband always buys size 8 shoes even though he is 7.5 - 8,  also 41.  His crocs on the back say m7 w9 - they fit him perfectly.  He has just bought another pair and reading the measurements on line it said 8m w10  for US and UK m7/W8 so we thought it would be OK - they arrive with the US number on the back, but the label says m7/w8 UK so they should be fine but they are much too big - more like an 8.5.  I have a pair that say m6 W8 - work that one out!  They fit perfectly (I am always a 6 or 39), however I have no idea what I had to ask for to get these but I remember it was a big problem at the time.  Going on what has just happened you might think that the UK measurements are on the back of mine, and the US on the back of his.  How is anyone to know??Good luck!  They are good, but you will probably have to send them back.  Gail
reviews.review_title: Why is it so complicated?  Size 6 and Size 8

reviews.review_content: I have a pair of blue/white Crocband Flips bought from a shop earlier this year that I was able to compare to the grey/lime Crocband Flips that I bought via Amazon. The quality of finish is not perfect on the grey/lime flips. The rubber is blistered in places and there is a moulding plug attached. I’m sure they are genuine. I am disappointed that if they are seconds that this is not made clear, or maybe I was unlucky.
They always come with 2 size larger of what you ordered

The unisex sizing only works for men. I was replacing a pair of Crocs woman's W9s, and I expected these to fit. They’re a size too large, and they fit my husband who is usually an 8. I’ve given them to him and will order some other brand who isn’t trying to save money by being unisex. A waste of time and money.

While they look the part they are slightly wider than normal croc flip flops (I’ve had loads over the years from the croc shop at the outlet) these seem to be slight snides /coppies there is a little bit of dry glue around the croc logo at the back and the band that runs around them isn’t quite touching the croc logo at the back either and seems thicker than my others.. for the price it’s annoying as they’re basically the same price as they are for real ones in the outlet store (if we weren’t in lockdown I would have sent them back and gone to my outlet store but obviously that’s not an option) that said now I have worn them a few days  they are just as comfortable as normal crocs just slightly wider and no one is going to know they’re slight coppies/snides/fakes
reviews.review_title: Possibly slight coppies but still comfortable

reviews.review_content: Order 10 UK men/11 UK woman which to be honest seemed strange sizing..Men's 11 UK arrived . . Really big .. more like a 12.....Colour  lot lighter than photo showed ..

Seems okay and comfy. But it will be more comfortable and support better if it comes with an accurate size. I usually wear UK 9 M for shoes and after reading the review, I had went for UK 8 M. And it's still too big. 1 size difference, I sort of can accept but more than 2 size difference, that's quite bizarre to be honest.

These Crocs are value for money and very comfortable however I’ve always found the sizing not to be true. I take a U.K. size 10 but buy a size 11 for the perfect fit. This has happened wether buying in the States or U.K. Very practical especially for summers in the U.K. or wearing around a swimming pool
Overall ok

They're strong, well made, look ok. Personally, having a condition that produces hyper sensitive pain receptors, I find the little bobbles on the top of the sole a bit uncomfortable. For comfort, I preferred the Nike poolside shoes I had to replace which broke after eight years.Crocs' sizing puts me off buying in future, though. I recently bought Brooklyn low wedge which are tiny, and the 6 fitted in the bone colour but the straps were too loose in black, of the same style. My husband's sliders were massive in a ten (his usual size) but a little bit too short in the 9. I've ordered and returned more than I care to count, now. So, while I do like them when they fit, I won't be ordering anymore online, it's just too much hassle.
reviews.review_title: Sizing is a pain with Crocs

reviews.review_content: Upon wearing for the first time they did cut into my toes !The material could be made softer to avoid this happening
Comfortable
I normally wear a size 12 but in these I’m size 10 the 12 were huge
reviews.review_title: Seems well made and comfortable but sizes are screwed up

reviews.review_content: They are very good quality so you'll have no issues breaking them or your toe pulling the thong out. I'm not sure that I'd wear them again after my last holiday as they were uncomfortable after a full day out walking on them but regardless, they're a fantastic product.
Great for Holidays in the sand and walking around, safety and comfort.
It is comfortable and fit nicely. For the price oc 19 pounds. It was even better.

arrived quickly. very comfortable. they wash easily and dry super fast.  I'm 7.5 UK and went for 8ukM/9ukW. If anything they feel perhaps a bit loose. Not big deal around the house though I'd probably want a snugger fit if I were to use them for going to the beach for example. Wondering if a size smaller would actually fit perfect as they seem quite generous in volume. Also noticed the sizing on the shoe is bigger than when ordering as it says 9M/11W. Perhaps there's the issue. hope they stand up to the name and don't break too quickly as I might buy the smaller size as well.E: bought a second pair a size smaller. A bit snug when new but they do give. My only concern is the amount of wear in such a short time just wearing them around the house. You can see by yourself in the attached photo.

This is the first time I have bought CROC footwear for me to wear. I am particulrly fussy about comfort and quality in relation to footwear. The flip flops I purchased are excellent quailty and fit. I take a UK10 shoe size. The US equivalent size for men is 11 (M11). The style and shape of these CROC's are really very nice on the foot. I bought the black with a white side strip in the sole. The contact and grip with the feet and floor are very good in that the footwear remains comfortably on the feet and grip the floor surface just about ideally to allow confident non slip walking in or out. The material used in their manufacture is EVA which is a rubber type material which provides many of the benifits of rubber but without the awful smell normally associated with it. The insole of these flip flops have shape to dovetail with the foot and very small dimples which keeps the foot airiated to aliviate swet. The toe post is also quite ideal in that it is not thick or abrasive which would become quite uncomfortable after a few hours wear. This all adds to provide the wearer with all day comfort and footwear that stays on the foot without sticking to the underside of the foot. In my opion, these CROC's are well worth the money anf will provide years of quality wear. My wife has worn CROC slide on's for quite some years and thinks they are one of the best designs of footwear around, particularyly in hot weather too. They go into the washing machine periodically for a wash and always remain intact. So, I know CROC's have already earned a reputation with users of their footwear.
reviews.review_title: Great Footwear in terms of comfort, quailty, looks and value.

reviews.review_content: There is nothing to dislikeThey are comfortable stylish and hard wearing
reviews.review_title: Comfortable, stylish and hard wearing flip flops

reviews.review_content: Problem with most flip flops are weak and stay wet these are strong and completely waterproof proof so wipe down and straight in my bag. Very comfortable very happy. These are my second pair would normally last forever but dog ate the first pair.

I always swore I would never wear a pair of ‘Crocs’ but these are amazing. I’ve loved them, took them to Cyprus last week and I lived in them. My feet swelled up like Hobbit’s feet and they were a god send. They have a wide foot base so they cushion the foot and are so comfortable. I’m actually gonna but another pair and put them away so when the ones I’ve got now wear out, I’ve got another pair waiting. Cannot recommended these enough.
Super comfy and great massage like texture

I was disappointed when I couldn't find my size of another known brand flip flop that I thought was excellent before especially as the ones I had, broke a couple of days ago.  I've had them some time, so no complaints, however, I opted for these as I go away in a couple of days time, and I am so impressed with everything about them. Now, I'm a size 12G, (wide fitting), and these feel as if they were made to measure. They don't go sliding off ones feet when walking quicker than usual, they feel sturdier than my previous favourites, and... as I said... they are just the best flops I've ever had. My new favourite brand, and just to make sure I'm covered for any other unfortunate event,  I'll be buying a few pairs to keep stocked up.  Whilst I am extremely happy with these, that is my personal opinion, and I am happy to recommend these to anyone with size 12G's. (As long as that is your shoe size :) )
The flop flip is comfortable to wear. It’s great and size is perfect. This is firm and thick with some of grip while wear it. The colour is exactly as show in picture.

The top support is glued to the toe arm.One shoe wasn't glued correctly which failed. It was after I had them for a year as I only wear them on my holidays once a year.Don't leave them in the sun (Mine were Black) the glue goes soft and detaches from the toe!Poor design.
reviews.review_title: Not glued correctly, failed after light use

reviews.review_content: Perfect
Just perfect for my holiday.....never had then off my feet. I bought in black and in white too. Went with just about everything!

Le Under Armour UA Surge 3 si sono rivelate una scelta soddisfacente per chi cerca una scarpa da corsa senza troppe pretese. La costruzione è solida e il design, seppur semplice, offre un aspetto moderno.In termini di comfort, le scarpe offrono un'ammortizzazione sufficiente per affrontare sessioni di corsa di media intensità. La suola fornisce una trazione adeguata su diverse superfici, anche se potrebbe mancare di quel qualcosa in più in alcune condizioni.La traspirabilità del materiale superiore è accettabile, mantenendo i piedi relativamente freschi durante l'uso. La calzata è comoda, anche se potrebbe variare a seconda della forma del piede.In conclusione, le UA Surge 3 sono una scelta decente per chi cerca un paio di scarpe da corsa senza voler spendere cifre esorbitanti. Offrono un equilibrio sufficiente tra comfort e prestazioni per le sessioni di corsa di tutti i giorni, senza eccedere in particolari caratteristiche tecniche.
reviews.review_title: Una Scelta Equilibrata per la Corsa Quotidiana

The fabric and workmanship are both very good, as is the colour. However, the size is one size smaller than advertised, the shirt is not 'button down' as the headline shows, and the cut around the bottom is not as shown. The bottom hem has 'tails' suitable for tucking in to pants, not the rounded cut for wearing untucked, and the collar is a plain one. I ordered a 'large', the shirt size that I always have worn--and still wear--and have to give the shirt to my wife, especially after washing. I ordered another, this time XL, and it fits fine. Good shirt; rotten description of it!
just what i needed

Passform und GrößeDas Flanellhemd von Amazon Essentials enttäuscht in Bezug auf die Passform und Größe. Es fällt deutlich zu groß aus und entspricht nicht den Erwartungen an ein angenehm sitzendes Hemd. Die Passform wirkt unvorteilhaft und trägt nicht zu einem ansprechenden Erscheinungsbild bei.Verarbeitung und DesignAbgesehen von der Größe scheint die Verarbeitung und das Design des Hemdes durchschnittlich zu sein. Allerdings kann die schlechte Passform das Gesamterscheinungsbild erheblich beeinträchtigen und den Komfort beim Tragen deutlich mindern.Qualität und TragekomfortDie Größenprobleme und die unvorteilhafte Passform beeinträchtigen den Tragekomfort dieses Hemdes erheblich. Die Qualität des Flanellmaterials und die Verarbeitung scheinen jedoch im Allgemeinen in Ordnung zu sein, aber die falsche Passform nimmt dem Träger jeglichen Komfort.FazitDas Amazon Essentials Herren Flanellhemd mit seinen zwei Taschen und langen Ärmeln enttäuscht insgesamt aufgrund seiner unpassenden Größe und unvorteilhaften Passform. Obwohl andere Qualitätsmerkmale möglicherweise akzeptabel sind, überwiegen die Größenprobleme und die schlechte Passform, was das Hemd zu einer weniger attraktiven Wahl macht.
XL is easily an XXL. I’ve purchased a few Amazon clothes and they are usually a mega deal. This one was a deal on price but was made at least a X too much.

My husband always wants two pockets so he can carry around his collection of pens and other items he wants to keep on him. At the same time, he wants a classic shirt, and these are difficult to find with pockets. This one fulfils this function perfectly, and it's also thick and warm for winter. Material on the picture doesn’t look like the one that turned up
Nice fluffy material. Nothing out of the ordinary quality wise however, it's just decent for the price

I bought this shirt to wear as a layer while motorcycling in the winter. I always want to look fashionable and wear a sturdy shirt with my motorcycle gear. This shirt is perfect for that purpose and can be worn for three seasons.I am 178cm tall and weigh 100kg, and the XL size fits me well with a base layer underneath and some room to spare. The fabric is soft and comfortable to wear. The shirt is both warm and stylish, and it can be worn casually as well.I have washed and tumble dried the shirt, and the fabric's softness has not been affected, and the shirt has not shrunk. I also tried to air dry the shirt to test another reviewer's claim that it didn't require ironing. However, I had to iron it as there were multiple creases, and it would not have looked good without ironing.Overall, it was a good purchase, and the price/performance ratio is excellent. I strongly recommend it.

I Was a bit dubious - as I am quite tall and not a slim-jim, I wondered just how this would fit - well it fits very well indeed. Material has not been skimped and feels very good - after a few washed that may change but for the cost it is better than I expected. Collar size would be a little tight if I am honest but with a casual shirt how many times does one have the collar done up? Good price/material/size - thoroughly recommended (I don't often write reviews!)
reviews.review_title: Good fit, well worth the money

reviews.review_content: Bought this for my fatherExcellent fabric, very pleasant to the touch. Nice colour, good sizing, stitch work is good- much better quality than the price would suggestOnly drawback is the sewn in label is extremely scratchy- had to remove it

This is a cold-weather working shirt made from thicker brushed fabric (aka flannel) and I wear it about the house and garden during the winter months. Very good price, quick (next day) delivery by Amazon Prime. Quality is better than than many cheap shirts I have known - eg fabric pattern is woven-in, not printed; double buttoned cuffs (so you can have them tighter or looser fit), and two button-down pockets. Happy to recommend and I will buy again.
reviews.review_title: Very comfortable shirt at very good price

I needed a good, strong sock for outdoor working & thought these would be better than most out there. How disappointing as they look and feel great. Just no heel strength in the fabric. Needs doubling up, especially for the paid price. Not cheap.
