At first they were a perfect fit and seemed like a quality material.After a few washes, they have shrunk so much I cannot get them on. I've tried stretching them when wet, but no, still too small  to wear, definitely cutting off circulation.
reviews.review_title: After a few washes, they have shrunk.

reviews.review_content: I have small ankles. When bought (as another reviewer has stated), they were a little tight aroumd the ankles, but after 2 cool washes and air drying, they have become so tight that they give me pain in the feet due to restricted blood flow. I have size 9 feet .They are now completeley unwearable and so a waste of money as the return window has closed. Be very careful concerning the size; cannot imagine what they would be like on a bigger foot! a great shame as they were very comfortable.
reviews.review_title: They are tight round the ankles (size 9-11) on a size 9 foot and shrink even on a cool wash.

reviews.review_content: Felt comfortable when I first put them on. After a long walk they gave me a horrendous rash which was swollen, very hot and painful on both legs. Day three after and my legs are yet to recover. I am used to walking long distances and have never had this problem before. As a woman of average build, size 6, I ordered mens size 6-9. I think they cut off my circulation or I've had a reaction to something they have put in the sock band. Not good at all for me.

These socks are advertised in American sizes not UK so smaller than expectedAmazon seem unable to understand my frustration when I brought this to their attention  that the advert is misleading and needs changedOnly option given by Amazon is to return
The main body of the sock is comfortable but I find the grip around the ankle is very tight, I have decided not to wear them because of this.

Wore these for the first time on a proper hike, I now have blisters on both big toes. Looking at the inside of the socks there is a seam across the top of the toes, where this ends on the side of the big toe there is a bit of a lump for want of a better description. This has caused some nasty blisters of both toes. They are also, as stated by some other reviewers quite tight around the calf. I wouldn't recommend them if you do any serious mileage.

As I suffer from very clod feet in the Winter months I did a bit of research and asked a few questions regarding these socks. Based on this info I went ahead and purchased them. In my opinion they are Not very warm at all and are a disappointment. With my old woolen socks I could stand on cold floor tiles and not feel the cold whereas with these socks I feel the cold almost immediately. I realise they are not the most expensive of socks but I had really expected and wanted them to be "just right", they are far from that. I now realise that socks with zero wool content just dont do it for me.

Arrived undamaged by German postal service. Each pair has a cardboard insert, stating XL. However, I take UK size 9 shoes, and they are too tight, so I think they are size Large - mislabeled. Warm enough I wore a pair to bed, but woke up with constriction pain to my feet. Also, I wear a pair of old, thin, socks over them, most of the time, as if I wear a pair of shoes, or boots, with non-smooth, padded lining -or rough/damaged lining, the socks chaff - causing excessive wear. UPDATE: MAY 2022. The use of an "over sock" solved the wear issue; but I have found they shrink in a cold wash, and require some stretching, before reusing them. I don't recommend them.

These socks feel great but they’re far too right round the ankles. I’ve not got fat legs either. I’ve had the first wash with a few of the pairs and that’s made it worse, the wash was a quick wash at 30 degrees. They’re actually so tight it feels like the blood circulation is getting cut off. The rest of the sock size is great

way to small - just cotton terry socks - that fray very quicklythey cut the blood off to your feet they are too small by far for my size 10 UK feet my wife thinks they are too tight and she is size 7!These are very ordinary socks wrapped with a huge load of hype marketing

These Socks are a reliable choice if you're seeking a balance between affordability and quality. With their impressive comfort, breathability, and warmth, these socks offer a great value for the price.One of the main positives of these socks is their affordability. Compared to other brands in the market, YUEDGE provides a pack of five socks at a reasonable cost without compromising on key features. For those on a budget, this option allows you to stock up on multiple pairs of high-quality socks without breaking the bank.In terms of comfort, these socks excel. The cushioned sole provides a plush and comfortable feel, making them ideal for long walks, athletic activities, or everyday wear. The added cushioning helps reduce foot fatigue, providing support throughout the day. Whether you're on your feet for extended periods or engaged in physical activities, these socks keep your feet comfortable and cozy.The breathability of the socks is another commendable feature. The wicking technology efficiently draws moisture away from the skin, keeping your feet dry and fresh even during intense workouts. This is particularly important in preventing odors and maintaining overall foot hygiene. The breathable design ensures that air circulates freely, enhancing the overall comfort and freshness of your feet.Furthermore, these socks offer excellent warmth, which is particularly beneficial during colder months or in chilly climates. The combination of high-quality materials and thoughtful design helps to insulate your feet, keeping them warm and cozy. This feature makes these socks suitable for outdoor activities or simply lounging around the house on a cold day.However, one downside to note is that these socks may wear out more quickly compared to some higher-end brands I have tried. While they offer great value for the price, the durability of the socks could be improved. With regular use and washing there are signs of wear and tear, particularly in high-friction areas such as the heels. It's important to consider this aspect if you're looking for socks that will withstand heavy use over an extended period.In conclusion, these Socks offer an affordable and comfortable option for everyday wear, athletic activities, and casual outings. The cushioned sole provides excellent comfort and support, while the breathability and warmth ensure a pleasant experience for your feet. While the durability could be better, these socks still offer good value for the price. If you're looking for budget-friendly socks that prioritize comfort and performance, the YUEDGE socks are a solid choice.

they shrink after few washes........................... disappointed

reviews.review_content: The material feels nice on the skin. However, the fit was unpleasant. The chest part of the vest goes too low for my likings. Returned item.
reviews.review_title: Feels nice but the fit is off

reviews.review_content: Contrary to what has been said in other reviews these vests are not a good quality option. They shrink every wash, even on cool, and my wife has to stretch them out to make sure they stay long enough for me as I like my vests snug and long. Despite the stretching they have lost maybe an inch or two off the length and the elasticity is not good. Basically you get what you pay for, so at this price point you get low to average quality. When first wearing them and when they come out of each wash they fit nice and snug but after an hour of wearing they hang loosely and look untidy. I'll be going back to my more fitted but obviously more expensive alternative vests again.
Sizes way off - order next two sizes up = waste of time

I was looking for warm vests with a long fit. I'm 6ft 2 " with a light build and ordered the Large size.The fabric is a bit too thin to be really warm - I compared the weight with a 5 year old Tesco vest (same size) and found it to be about 15% lighter.The vests are just long enough when new, but even at 30 degrees they shrink a bit in the wash. The shoulder to hem length new is 77 cm,  after 1 wash it was 75 cm and after 2 washes it was 73 cm. At that length they tend to ride up and so I returned them.The quality is actually reasonably good and they might suit average height people, but not me.
Only got 4 instead of 5. Was promised £5 refund for missing top. Still waiting
Nice and long out of the box, slim fitting. After a couple of washes, however, on a cool cycle they shrivel in length and then ride up uncomfortably.
reviews.review_title: Ok at first but quickly deteriorate

reviews.review_content: Actual material really nice and fits well but there is a mark on the top of one of the tanks.

Good quality, but they just shrink in the wash. Even after shrinking, they're comfy and warm - so just buy a size up from your usual size. On the first wear they'll feel big, but after a couple of washes they'll shrink down to your size then
A little small. And That's before even first wash.  Might buy again will see later but would definitely go a size up

December 2023 Update :These vests are now ready to be thrown away as with in 4 months they have shrunk even more and have now lost their shape as well.July 2023:The vests fit as expected and are of an ok quality. They do shrink a bit during the first wash.The "label" is printed on the cloth at the back but the problem is that after a few washes, the label is not longer to be seen, meaning that sometimes you put the vest on back to front.
ok so i read all the reviews before purchasing and i have always been a large, these are to tight to be a large so i would say if ordering go for an XL if you are a large....material is good

size way too small

Bought for my husband. He really enjoyed them and finds the warm and comfortable.
reviews.review_title: Good quality! Resists a lot of machine washing without losing shape!

reviews.review_content: The opening for the head seem to sit to low on the back. I prefer it higher and the vest itself not so figure hugging. I hope they will  stretch and loosen up in time.
Good appearance, light weight, good shape
GOOD  BUY will buy again
reviews.review_title: Great price the multi pack good value.would buy againGood buywill buy again

The product was shipped and received very quickly so quite pleased with the delivery serviceOverall a very good purchase . Would. Definitely buy again
What a great item which is well made and absolutely excellent quality many thanks amazon

Inspired by Leonardo DiCaprio wearing a white vest in Shutter Island ….& I WAS a bit tipsy when I ordered.  Surprised how unlike Leonardo I look in it but they are lovely vests. Nice feel, nice quality & nice fit.

Maybe I should have purchased a smaller size but ignoring this I find the quality of these vests to be excellent. I have only worn two since purchasing but they are very comfortable. They feel as though they will last for years.

I bought these vests because with the T shirt ones that already possess the sleeves tend to extend below the sleeves of my polo shirts whereas these don't.They are as anticipated and the fit and quality is good and arrived promptly.

Excellent quality. Fit was a little larger than I wanted but still OK. In any event there appears to be some small shrinkage after the first wash which then makes them a better fit. For reference on sizing I am at the margins between a medium fit and a large fit. I ordered large on this order to be on the safe side.  I think a medium size is probably OK for those like me who are umming and ahhing about whether to risk it with a medium or play safe and go large.
Well fit and comfy
Good quality vests Keep their shape after washing, colours stay the same, i will buy the same in the future, if i can ever wear these ones out 🤗
met expectations completely
Fab

Me quedo un poco apretado, me huviera gustado mas grande, no se puede estirar mucho.

Very disappointed in the quality of the mask. It is almost as if I am not wearing anything. Very thin, and not insulated at all. More of something you would wear in the summer time, but even then it is so thin you might still get wind burn. Gave two star because the stitching was done well, but that is all there is good to say about it. Even the neck part is short, barely pulls down a normal length neck.

I work outdoors and when it’s cold, we need an additional later to help insulate/retain body heat. This did that decently enough for the thin material it is. My issue is that within a short period of time, the face mask part started to get runs/rips in it. It’s a stretchy material and my face/head is huge or big by any definition. I wear it 4 days a week @10hrs a day. And it already has runs like cheap stockings. Disappointing to say the least.

Though it is nice.  The product doesn't cover the neck when put on.  You get what you paid for. Its only 10 dollars i guess i can give it to my kid brother.  That being said it probably not a good fit for the average man.  for the average kid is okay.  I work in a factory that is makes frozen fruits, i don't like to wear bear nets thought this was a good substitute but its worst than a neck gaiter.Would have given 1 star, if i've returned the merchandise but its not worth my time. lost 10 dollars but i've lost more to other stupid stuff.
Not what I was expecting, it is very thin.
Cheap so can't moan that much. I wear a medium sized motorcycle helmet and this was I'd say for someone with a smaller head.
It’s a good balleclava for motorbikes so the wind and bugs and leaves don’t get in your face badly except can sometimes be itchy
Good
length is not that great. covers the head and mouth nice, neck not so much. Can hear great with it on, if you have a mask on over it breathability is not that great.

Very good

The material is stretchy and good quality and definitely expands to your head size.All in all, a great quality product and I thoroughly recommend.

Protects my neck from cold winds, keeps my ears in place so they don't bend down when putting my helmet on, and helps the helmet slide on smoothly.I wouldn't think it will keep you warm when the temperature drops, it'll be optimally comfortable between 16 - 23 celcius while riding. Also, when I have it down around my neck, it likes to rotate so the larger bit that goes around your head slips forward. A bit annoying when I'm walking about with it on like that, but it's no big deal. I still recommend it.
Not bad
Bit of a tight fit. But other wise a top item.

It is perfect for my requirements.
Excellent quality & value for money.Very comfortable to wear and cosy too.

I purchased the so-called 38" regular size.I normally wear 38" waist jeans as my actual waist is 36" but I have a bit of a butt on me, so the extra space means I'm not too tight... these arrived today and not only are they smaller than my 36" waist jeans, but they're tight on my legs too - I can BARELY get the waist done up, and they're tight on my thighs.Whoever sized these, they must have a broken tape measure, as the waist is around 35", and they're rather flimsy too.Overall, these are worse quality than those you'd get from Sainsbury's or Tescos, and don't fit well, all for the extra money you pay as they're more expensive too!I'm not going to try to get a larger pair as they might "magically" be the right size, and I'll suddenly have a pair of parachute jeans.The only reason I'm giving these a 2 star instead of one is because they actually look quite good, but make sure you try them on AS SOON AS THEY ARRIVE! Otherwise you'll be stuck with something that is too tight and claims to be 3" larger than it actually is - maybe they're sized by a short guy who claims to be taller, to make himself feel better. 😛

I ordered 42 x 30 inch specifically, and was a little suspicious when the package said 42 S.  The leg is certainly over 30 inches, maybe 31, but I'm hoping with a bit of hopeful shrinkage they may sit on the top of my footwear adequately without dragging on the floor. The waist is, similarly, over 42 inch, maybe 43+, but again I'm hoping they may shrink  enough in the wash to give a reasonable fit if my belt cinches it up a bit. Adequate but I'm not sure I'd buy from here again. I'll update after they've been washed and "bedded in".I washed them and they still seemed large. Measured them. After washing the leg length was 31" - the waist was a staggering 48" (I ordered 42 x 30). Label in jeans said 42 x 30. In fairness to the seller I wasn't expecting anything - I should have checked them before washing - but they have offered me a 25% refund anyway. I'm no style icon at 68 years of age, so they sit on my trainers and I cinch them up with a belt and wear a baggy t-shirt over the top. They're usable!!  My ADVICE - is measure them when you get them!!

I regularly go backpacking and hiking and usually wear a very expensive Haglofs LIM III rain jacket...very expensive but superbly designed.  I want it to last me for many more years...my previous one (which I still have) was used extensively for over 25 years!  But, for my local daily 'constitutionals' I wanted something a little less 'technical' that would still provide rain cover, not be too heavy, and can be left in the car if necessary without fear of theft...replacement cost has to be low.This jacket fits the bill perfectly.  I am 5' 7" and ordered the M size.  It fits perfectly...not too long in the arm, and a length that provides good cover over my backside.  I can wear this over a light base layer or several thicker layers...it's plenty roomy without feeling baggy.  The hood compacts well into the collar and while it is not the best, it does have pull cords to tighten it around the head.  I find hoods usually work best over a peaked cap though. The jacket has 4 pockets: two zip pockets outside (R&L), and two pockets on the inside.  The latter pockets have no zips and are more suited to light items like gloves, or maybe even a map.  I wouldn't put a water bottle in them.The seams are well sealed and it provides good rain protection, though I haven't tried it yet in a heavy downpour.  If moisture is felt inside then it is most likely due to condensation from perspiration...the jacket does get quite warm if you're walking at pace, like I tend to.The jacket packs into a small separate draw-string bag, rather than one of its own pockets and this makes an easily stowed lightweight package to carry in another bag or throw in the glove box or door storage in the car.Overall, at one-tenth of the price of my Haglofs jacket, this has become my go-to rain lightweight cover for short walks or car trips.  Excellent value for money.

name: Men's Original Two-Tone Memory Foam Slipper
description: Product details     Sole material     Rubber       Outer material     Synthetic       Inner material     Synthetic       Closure type     Slip-On      About this item   Open back, slip-on style allows for easy on/off. The fitted upper and back lip help prevent your slipper from flopping off your foot, especially when walking down stairs.   Memory foam insole moulds to the contours of your foot for pillow soft comfort; pamper yourself after a long day at work, or that hard working husband or Dad in your life by giving his tired feet a well deserved rest.   Breathable waffle-knit upper helps you avoid sweaty feet, keeping your toes dry and odourless. Made from 100% vegan and machine washable material.   Sturdy rubber sole with anti-slip traction lets you step outside the house to grab the mail or walk the dog.   Sizing tip: to find your best fitting size, please refer to our "Size Chart" next to the size selection menu. If you have wide feet, we recommend going up a size.   See less About this item    Product details    Product Dimensions                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  26 x 10 x 22 cm; 358 Grams   Date First Available                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  26 Sept. 2022   Manufacturer                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  RockDove   ASIN                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  B09ZQHZMRM   Item model number                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  M302   Department                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  Men's       Best Sellers Rank:  28 in Fashion (See Top 100 in Fashion)   1 in Men's Slippers       Customer reviews:         4.5  4.5 out of 5 stars         159,977 ratings               Product Description                Why do I see a product that looks identical to this one, but sold under a different brand?   RockDove is the inventor of the two-tone memory foam slipper, launched in 2017. Please beware of the impostors who steal our content but can't live up to our quality. We thank you for choosing RockDove and supporting original work.      What size should I choose if I wear a half-size?   We suggest going up a size if you wear a half-size or an in-between size (e.g. men's 7.5, 9.5, 10.5). To find your best fitting size, please refer to our size chart which can be found by clicking the size chart link next to the size selection menu.      How do I clean these?   All RockDove slippers are made machine washable. We recommend washing in cold water, gentle cycle and air drying.      I'm a lady and want to buy these. What's the right size for me?   Please use this simple conversion rule: add 1 to the men's size to get the ladies' size. For example, the men's size 8/9 is the same length as the ladies' size 9/10, but slightly wider. We also recommend the RockDove Ladies' Two-Tone Slipper.                   Making feet (and paws) happy since 2002.   Slippers that don't look boring.    That's our goal. The RockDove two-tone slipper is inspired by the vibrant hues of southern California, where we call home. Born with the laid-back vibes of a SoCal beachtown, it's easy to slip on and kick off, with a go-anywhere sole that lets you step out without switching shoes.                The Proof is in the Cushioning   Find out why RockDove slippers are so comfortable.                                        1                                     2                                     3                                     4                                     5                                     6           Why Us         Slippers by people who make only slippers     Our mission is to turn the slipper into something that's not only comfortable to wear, but also up to date with both modern living and cutting-edge shoemaking. To achieve this, we dedicate 100% of our working lives to making slippers and nothing else, nothing to distract us from our craft.         What sets RockDove apart from the rest     Innovation: we experiment with features and fabrics typically reserved for performance footwearEthical Manufacturing: no animal skins used; fair wages and safe conditions for workers (amfori BSCI-audited)Consistent Sizing: every product is fit-tested to standard UK shoe sizing prior to production          Slippers for Frontline Heroes         Throughout 2020, RockDove is giving away slippers to healthcare workers and first responders who are fighting the pandemic on the frontlines. We can't imagine what it feels to be in their shoes, so we're giving them ours -- RockDove memory foam slippers to rest their tired feet after a long shift.          Who We Are     RockDove was created for five birdwatchers of the Los Angeles Audubon Society in 2002. They were our customers, when we weren't yet a slipper company, but a beachside workshop in Santa Monica, California that resoled hiking boots. For fifteen years we protected the feet of avid adventurers as they trekked punishing terrains across southern California's mountains and deserts. As their local shoe cobbler, when customers had footwear needs, they came to us. And over time they asked for something that was badly missing, not in their time conquering the outdoors but in their lives at home—quality indoor shoes to console their high-mileage, trail-weary feet. So for Christmas that year, we made five pairs of slippers for our long-time Audubon customers using a low-cut boot last.   Shoe brands in southern California, where sunny beaches and flip flops rule, don't pay much attention to slippers. So we had little to build on. But we did know how to make comfortable, long lasting footwear. Using mattress memory foam, gel insoles, anti-shock EVA from hiking boots, and more, we designed slippers with the goal of comforting extremely tired feet. Two months later when we sent out a newsletter about our slipper experiment, customers responded with 350 mail orders. We named our slippers after the most common bird we knew, the rock dove (pigeon) often seen strutting the boardwalks of Santa Monica Pier. They’re a memento of where we’re from and what we represent.   To this day our legacy of creating footwear as if for the most exhausted, adventure-wearied feet lives on. But adventure isn’t always hanging on a rope off the side of a mountain. Everyone lives their own version of it, every single day. We make slippers so that anyone who’s on their feet all day—not just passionate outdoorsmen but teachers, chefs, nurses, cashiers, traffic cops, postal workers, and more—can count on switching into the world’s most comfortable slippers once they get home.   Our quest to get comfort down to a science pushed us to become one of the earliest adopters of high-density memory foam in slippers. In 2004, we reached out to local sleep experts at the Long Beach Mattress Company to source their memory foam toppers, which we then moulded into insoles. But mattress comfort didn't exactly translate to slipper comfort. So we obsessively tweaked the density and firmness of our foams to create that “sweet spot” level: one that offers incredible comfort, yet not so much cushioning that you’ll feel like walking in quicksand. Today, at the heart of each RockDove slipper is a multilayered foam construction—a 40-70D memory foam that rebounds with every step, a heel insert that adds firmness, and an anti-shock EVA layer.        More Styles by RockDove            Women's Two-Tone Slipper            Men's Sherpa Lined Slipper            Men's Nomad Slipper         Highlights   Easy on/off; memory foam footbed; breathable upper. reviews.review_content: When they arrived they were comfortable and thick soles. After about 2 weeks the memory foam was thin and it certainly wasn't the same as when I bought them. So that asloade rhe sizing different. As the memory foam got thinner the slipper got bigger so now they are way too big. I wouldn't buy them again or recommend.  If you do want to buy them I would suggest a size or two smaller as once you have warn them in (a week ish) the foam will compact and they will be very lose. The rest of the slipper is great but pretty useless if you can't wear them after a few weeks die to the above.

sadly not very impressed with these, I ordered a size 11 and they are quite tight in both length and width  the soles are not as supportive as I expected and the slipper comes up quite low on the bridge, no where near as nice as the old slippers I bought elsewhere, I honestly don't think these will last very long but I guess you get what you pay for, sadly not for me******* update having worn these for just over a day they have become so sloppy they are dangerous to walk in , my feet slide all over the place and don't feel safe, I need to find a different brand as I can't wear these
reviews.review_title: tight and now far too sloppy

reviews.review_content: I'm size 9UK/43EU & I bought both 9.5UK + 8/9UK sizes, because I wasn't sure how they'd fit.Both sizes were far too wide/large & kept falling off my feet when I was going up & down the stairs, which became extremely dangerous.When walking on flat surfaces around the home, they feel like the heel is slipping out the back of them & I'm falling over in them.If you don't have very wide feet, then you'd have to get 2 sizes smaller, but even that's wrong, because width wise they'd fit, but length wise they would not be long enough & your heel will be over & out the back of them & you'd feel over in them.I'm hoping that 1 of the sizes would be a correct fit for my father (size 10UK), but I'm not all hopefull.Bottom line is this:Avoid these slippers at all costs & get slippers at have a heel so you can't slide out of them.

Hello, me again, writing about another pair of slippers that within a month have stretched so they no longer fit and become dangerous to wear.When the slippers first arrived I thought they might be a bit tight, and was pleased thinking that when the inevitable stretch comes, they might fit ok.Wrong.Within a week the "memory foam" insole had compressed and the upper slackened off, meaning the slippers will slide off the front of my feet when walking. Going up stairs is like playing Twister with Death, both feet have curled toes trying to desperately grip the slippers so they don't fly off, with mostly unsuccessful results.I ended up buying a pair of grippy slipper socks. Far less likely to kill me.
reviews.review_title: Another pair of slippers that try and take your life…

reviews.review_content: These were fantastic for the first two or 3 weeks. After that the memory foam loses its spring and they offer hardly any padding.
reviews.review_title: 5* for a couple of weeks.. then 1.

reviews.review_content: The little threads are everywhere on the carpet, don't but or clean everyday!
Missing slipper
Good for a short time, but they lose all shape and memory foam after a month. They end up falling off your feet far more than they should and aren’t as warm once the the memory foam degrades.
You might as well just walk around in socks for all the support and comfort these give you!

I have had these slippers a while now, they were a fairly loose fit to start with and now after some wearing that have got so loose as to be annoying and uncomfortable. My feet now slop about inside and I couldn’t even think of wearing them to go upstairs… they would easily fall off and be far too dangerous.

I have been impressed for around 9 months, use around the house on carpets / laminate. Comfortable and easy to clean. The right one has however fallen apart at the heel from nothing but normal use. It doesnt appear to be an adhesive so must be stitching that has failed. A shame.
reviews.review_title: Alright in the short term, seemingly not built to last

reviews.review_content: When I bought these I was on a mission. I was thinking "why does it seem to be so hard to make a slipper that is nice to wear and lasts more than 5 seconds??" then I saw these. The marketing ticked all the boxes:Memory foamExtra supportGreat reviewsAnd a premium price tag to back it up.At first they felt lovely. Warm, snug, perfect fit. They had pride of place beside my bed, ready to welcome me in to the morning! And they look great.This lasted all of two nights.As time goes on (and we're talking over 10 days now), I regret buying these even more.I have wide feet, and went down a size rather than up, but after a couple of days they were hanging off my feet.After poking and prodding these slippers the reason becomes obvious:These are not the slippers as advertised.If we are to be generous, they have "manufacturing issues", as about half of the slipper isn't there. And what is, is not made from the materials advertised.The memory foam in particular is featured as "rebounds in 2 seconds". Spoiler alert: they don't. Not even after being left overnight.There is a helpful diagram under "The Proof is in the Cushioning". It's very clear that these are made with 6 components.However, only 2 of those appear to be intact, and only one is as described.Let's to the run down:1. Breathable Waffle Knit UpperPresent and correct. So we know it's the correct product as this is the outside, so hard to mess this one up. Even has the "Back Heel Collar"2. 360 Degree Memory Foam [1/4 inch]Also there! Again, you'd notice quickly if the slipper was just a scrap of fabric. Not quite confinced it's memory foam, and not sure if it's "360" [can't check the presence of this without a pair of scissors]. However, it just feels like standard foam.3. DoveFoam memory foam layer [1/2 inch]*Might* be present, or might just be the bottom of #2. However, this is not memory foam as advertised. It collapsed within 3 days (thus falling off my feet).4. Half Inch Heel Cushion [1/2 inch]Probably missing. This one's easy to check - the inside is sewn straight, and the heel is a quarter inch higher than the rest of the slipper. It's either not in there, or thinner than advertised. Either way, it collapsed within days and I may as well be walking on the floor.5. EVA Layer [1/4 inch]Missing. Pinch through the collapsed heel and by golly, all one feels is the tiny space in there for the rubber sole.6. Rubber Outsole [1/8 inch]Not very rubbery, feeling more like plastic and giving very little grip. Again, you'd think it difficult to mess this one up as it'd be quite obvious if it were missing. However, with some more pinching, what do you know - even this is incomplete. It comes in at zero arch support, and the "spiky massager" is not present.For those keeping score at home, these behemoths of slippers should be more than 1.5 inches thick at the heels!With 1.25 inches of memory foam at the heel alone. Instead they are about 3/4 thick, and maybe 1/2 an inch of standard foam.At this price point you don't expect perfect, but do expect something extra that will last longer than it takes for the recycling bin to be collected.These can easily be replaced with two pairs of sports socks and cheap sandals.Get the cheap ones, they'll probably last longer.
Don't  fit well, slob off my feet.
They look good in the advertising but quality is poor.  Within a week the stitching has started to become loose from the material and the rubber sole.
reviews.review_title: T RockDove Men's Original Two-Tone Memory Foam Slipper

reviews.review_content: Initially was a comfy warm pair of slippers. Noticed house had little plastic dots even after hoovering and cleaning up. Finally found it was the sole of the slippers which started to break up and leave small black dot like material all over the house. Disappointed.
reviews.review_title: Comfy but soles started to break up

reviews.review_content: After just 2 months of light use, the back of one of the slippers has come unstitched! They won’t last much longer, which for the price is very disapointing.Wouldn’t recomend!

so they actuly made me feel so comfy my feet ache when i get baxk from a 10 hour shift and slipping these on was like paradise! could stand and cook my food without pain and aches but literly a week in the theyre about as flat as my capet and wearing them now feels no where near as good as they did .. they do slip of your feet quite easy , quality initialy i thought these were great. but looks like im on the hunt again after some better quality .

I purchased these when I quickly nip outside to the bins to prevent me having to change into shoes. Ok, but not the most comfortable slipper in the world. At £14 does the job but would not wear these around the house
... had to return for a refund.
It took one month before they started falling apart. I only wear them a couple hours a day to walk around the flat. Not recommended.
Absolutely perfect, size , value, comfortable and quality, so much so we have had another pair and will repeat buy for other gifts

When these first arrived they were so comfortable I didn't really want to take them off. They looked smart, were lightweight and had a good footbed and sole. A solid 5 star review was on the cards.However, the more I wore them the more the memory foam forgot that it was supposed to recover and the flatter the footbed became. This meant that not only did they become less comfortable but you could feel any and every lump or gap you trod on, and they became harder to keep on one's foot. Finally they started slipping off when going up or down stairs and creating their own slip hazard - eventually causing me to fall (luckily) when going up the stairs.I really wanted to like these, but in the end I returned them, and am now looking for a replacement.CUSTOMER SERVICE: Worth 5 StarsI must add a note about their customer services. After I had returned these (and received a refund) I got a message from Rock Dove apologising that I had had problems with their slippers and offering to refund the purchase price. Although I turned down the offer I was impressed enough to see that they obviously monitor feedback, and have now ordered a different pair.

I bought a pair of these in November 2022. Nice comfy product. Looks great. But within five months of basic indoor use the insole was starting to seriously wear. Didn’t need to wear them in the warmer months. They’ve just lasted this winter but the insides are in pieces now. They will be going in the bin soon.

These are ok, but the leading rivals, the zippzaggers are much more durable and to my eyes look better too. After a few months the memory foam has flattened down and they slip off easily and do not support my feet or keep them warm. The material also seems to adhere to dust well
reviews.review_title: Ok but the zipzaggers are much better

reviews.review_content: I recently purchased a pair of these memory foam slippers and I have been thoroughly impressed with them. The open back, slip-on style allows for easy on and off, and the fitted upper and back lip help to prevent the slipper from flopping off my foot, especially when walking down stairs. The memory foam insole is incredibly comfortable and moulds to the contours of my foot for pillow-soft comfort. I've been wearing these slippers after long days at work and my feet feel so much better after a few hours in them.One of the things I appreciate most about these slippers is the breathable waffle-knit upper. It helps to avoid sweaty feet and keeps my toes dry and odourless. The material is also 100% vegan and machine washable, which is a nice bonus. The rubber sole with anti-slip traction is also a great feature. It allows me to step outside the house to grab the mail or walk the dog without worrying about slipping.However, I have noticed several issues with these slippers. Firstly, the sizing seems to be inconsistent. I needed to go up a size for a comfortable fit, especially if you have wide feet, but some users have found the slippers to be too small while others have found them to be too large, even when ordering their usual shoe size. It's important to carefully refer to the size chart and possibly go up a size if you have wide feet.Additionally, the memory foam quickly loses its firmness and support, leading to the slippers feeling like walking on a hard, carpeted floor. The soles of the slippers have also been a problem, with the bobbly textured finish shedding tiny bits of rubber onto the floor and requiring the use of tape to stop the shedding.I have also found that these slippers are not very durable. The memory foam started to lose its firmness within a week of wear, and some users have reported that the slippers are not worth the money, feeling that they are overpriced for the quality.Overall, while these memory foam slippers are comfortable, they have several issues that may make them less appealing to some users. It's important to keep these points in mind when considering a purchase.
reviews.review_title: You just give it a try

reviews.review_content: Really liked these when I first got them. Whether I'd recommend them depends on your expectations of how long slippers at this sort of price should last. I found that c.18 months of moderate use was enough to wear them out - memory foam had lost its memory, stitching on the heels coming apart, and so on.
reviews.review_title: Great, but for less than two years

reviews.review_content: Lost all their spring and grip around foot. fall off my feet so easy. Will be going in the bin sadly
I bought a pair of these in 9.5, which is what my really comfortable hiking boots are, but these were huge on me, far too big to wear, so I returned them.I've not taken a gamble on a smaller size.
reviews.review_title: Decent quality and probably comfort, but sizes seem large

reviews.review_content: Many 5 star reviews?Ummm... they're bits of cloth attached to bits of plastic that are made in China, probably for under £1.If they were £4 I'd give them 5 stars.
reviews.review_title: These ain't gonna change your life

reviews.review_content: Short-term memory foam maybe. After just a couple of weeks they became unsupportive, and seem to have 'forgotten' what shape they should be. When at first they felt snug and comfortable, they now just slide off and 'lip' at the back of them has collapsed.

I work at home, so I spend most of the day with them. Almost two months of intensive use and they are still perfect. Very sturdy, comfortable, very nice, they protect well when you hit a corner of the wall or furniture :)...I highly recommend.

Having had the slippers for some time now I am overall not particularly satisfied with them. Yes, they are very comfy on your feet but the memory foam does flatten pretty quickly and I am not a regular slipper wearer. They also do not fit on my feet very well. I have tripped a number of times while going up or down the stairs which I haven't had the issue of with similarly designed slippers before. For this reason I wouldn't purchase again and I am changing them to a safer design
reviews.review_title: Very comfy to wear but difficult to walk in

reviews.review_content: These are really nice when you first put them on, but the memory foam didn't have a very long memory I guess. After a the first weekend they'll be fairly flat. Looking at my order histor though I buy these every 2 years more or less exactly, so in the long run they must be decent right?They're pretty warm, but not too warm in summer. They hold up fairly well (other than the memory foam) and they do mould to your feet quickly. I should probably be replacing them annually really, but this time I picked up 2 pairs at once so I can try that.Overall I think they're reasonably priced and fairly hard wearing, for the odd trip outside they're great. Just beware the memory foam doesn't last long.

UPDATE 05/03/2024:I’d just like to say a thank you to the seller for reaching out to me and offering me a replacement.  This is good customer service and i wish more organisations thought more of their customers like this.  This is why I’m adding an additional star.Original review:I’ve had these slippers for just over a month now and while the memory foam support was great to begin with it stopped forming back already I.e. it’s not as firm/supported as there were from day one, and that’s only after one months use.  Some of the stitching inside has also already worn out, but in truth I find this happens with any slippers I’ve purchased.  I had high hopes following other reviews and I’ve only worn these in house, but they’ve ended up being no better than other brands so maybe they are just a little above average.
Not had these very long and already the ‘out of the box’ comfort is no more.  I will never buy another pair.
Fantastic slippers super comfortable at a great price would highly recommend superb..
Very comfortable and allow me to go outside if needed
Bought these for my husband and he loves them.
Bought for my partner he loves them, colour I thought wasn't as bright as pictured but he's happy!
These are very comfortable.  Good value for money.
Bought 2 pairs for the Christmas, on web site the picture it looked as the sole were thick and comfy, but it was really not as it looks. Useable that's all I can say.
reviews.review_title: The sole is not so comfy as it should

reviews.review_content: comfortable and durable . I`ve got 2 pairs now, one for indoor and one for outdoor use in the garden!

Review:As someone who spends a lot of time on their feet, I'm always on the lookout for comfortable slippers that provide both support and breathability. The RockDove Men's Original Two-Tone Memory Foam Slippers have exceeded my expectations in every way.Comfort:From the moment I slipped my feet into these slippers, I was enveloped in a cloud of plush memory foam. The contoured design molds perfectly to the shape of my feet, providing exceptional arch support and cushioning. I can walk around in these slippers for hours without any discomfort.Breathability:Despite their cozy warmth, these slippers don't make my feet feel sweaty or claustrophobic. The special design fabric allows my feet to breathe freely, even on warm summer nights. This is a game-changer for someone who tends to overheat in traditional slippers.Style:I've never thought of slippers as being particularly stylish, but the RockDove Men's Original Two-Tone Memory Foam Slippers are a different story. The sleek design and elegant two-tone color scheme make them look more like casual loafers than slippers. I feel confident wearing them around the house or even running errands in them.Overall:These slippers are an absolute must-have for anyone looking for comfortable, supportive, and stylish footwear. The memory foam provides unmatched comfort, the breathable fabric keeps feet cool, and the stylish design makes them suitable for both indoor and outdoor wear. I highly recommend these slippers to anyone seeking a combination of comfort, practicality, and style.Pros:* Exceptional arch support and cushioning* Breathable fabric for all-day comfort* Stylish design for both indoor and outdoor wear* Durable construction for long-lasting wearCons:* None that I can find
reviews.review_title: Comfort meets style with RockDove Men's Original Two-Tone Memory Foam Slippers

reviews.review_content: I recently purchased the RockDove Foam Slippers, and I couldn't be happier to have done so. These slippers have completely exceeded my expectations in terms of comfort and general wearability.On first slip on, the memory foam in these slippers is a game-changer. It feels like I'm walking on a cloud with every step I take. The cushioning is so plush and supportive that I find myself wearing these slippers not only around the house but also when I step outside to grab the mail or take out the trash. They really have helped with some of the plantar fasciitis that I've been dealing with. And since they are plush, but also pretty breathable, I wear them often even when it is a warm day.Another feature I appreciate is the easy on-and-off design. The backless style means I can slide my feet in and out effortlessly, which is super convenient. I have another pair of slippers that I just don't use because they are less slip on and more like putting on a shoe. And even with the low back, the slippers don't just fall off your feet.In terms of sizing, I found that they fit true to size, and the size chart provided by RockDove was accurate. I have size 15 feet and these fit without complaints out of the box.These are some great slippers and I do recommend them. They feel good and they don't look lame like some house slippers do. Great buy!
reviews.review_title: Welcome Relief for Sore Feet , Attractive & comfy 🌟

reviews.review_content: I bought these a week ago and think they are the best slipper I've ever worn. My daughter says it.feels like yoir walking in clouds.

I purchased one pair of rockfish slippers for myself last year. I have the Navy chenille one. I found them to be the best slippers I had ever bought. I purchased another pair that I only wore while I washed my navy one, again they were the chenille one in a different colour. Now once my nave once were dry I put the others away . I noticed the ones I had not worn very often were coming apart I contacted Rockdove who replaced without hesitation I couldn’t have asked for better service. My husband started to moan about something rubbing on his foot at the side where he put shoes on, then he actually admitted it was a build up of hard skin, and the leather slippers that he recently wanted was also hurting him. Being the sympathetic wife that I am ( not ) lol 😂 I did say well if you know it’s a build up of hard skin then you hsd best do something about it then hadn’t you. All our married life I had sorted everything out so if he thought I was going to sort his hard skin problem he would be waiting a extremely long long time. After listening to him moan for a another month or so he still had not done anything about it. I bought him a pair of the Rockdove slippers. He absolutely loves them he tell me something I already know is how very very comfortable they are. He also told me they didn’t rub on the hard skin. I purchased the 9.5 slip on ones. Him being a size 9 I wasn’t sure if the ones sized 8/9 would be big enough. It turned out the 9.5 are a little too big. Not that he’s ever moaned at me for getting the 9.5. I then asked him for his Rockdove slippers to wash. All I got was what am I going to wear. I said surly you can mange one day in the leather ones you wanted prior to me buying you a pair of Rockdove. So me being me such a loving and thoughtful wife that I am I say with a deep sigh. I thought I can not put my dearest husband in pain again. Having asked if he had done anything about his hard skin problem. Hence my sympathetic self ( kicked in not ) I again told him he should hurry up and get it sorted so I as any loving wife would do sigh..... sent for him another pair of Rockdove slippers for him because no matter what I can not fault his words about then being the most comfortable pair of slippers either of us had ever had. Also at such a reasonable price this time with the 9.5 being a little big I thought I would get him the size down so I purchased the size 8/9 when they came yesterday he was delighted I had purchased him another pair of the Rockdove slippers. However these are a little on the small size. Now although I will continue to purchase Rockdove slippers for my husband and I what I would say. Why do any and I mean any have duel sizing on slip on slippers. ?????????? Why. My husband is a standard size 9 he’s not awkward in anyway that he can walk into any shop pick up a size 9 shoe and they fit. I can take him to were I buy his really expensive shoes from buy a size 9 they fit. In fact he doesn’t come shopping for shoes for himself. He leaves that to me otherwise he would gulp at the prices. I have always bought real leather with leather soles and heels. Feet are a thing I personally think should be looked after from birth. People like my mum as a example didn’t really bother as they didn’t much those days if you could get them on then they fitted. Causing lots of people to suffer as they get older. Oops apologies. Going back to slip on slippers Rockdove you are the original manufacturer of these types of slippers I see many copies who I personally would not recommend. But this is one time I have to say the slip one duel sizes as in size 8/9 are a tad to small a 9.5 are a tad too big leaving me a little frustrated. He loves your slippers for comfort quality he likes the slip on ones. It would be nice to be able to buy in single sizes were I know and I am sure other would too that they are actually a proper fit. For the first time I am not leaving a 5 star rating due to slip on sizing issues.
reviews.review_title: Rockdove are the original manufacturers of the memory foam slippers so why buy copies

reviews.review_content: You know you're getting old when you buy your husband slippers for his birthday. And you know you're really flipping old when he's as chuffed as mine was to receive these. Won't stop talking about them, and is leaving the tag on to 'preserve the newness'. Really soft, well made, comfortable, and with a durable sole, so if your husband needs to briefly go outside to do a bit of man-faffing, then he can do that too. Great product.
Would never by any other brand of slipper now. My last pair of this brand lasted over 2 years of heavy use. Would advise going a size down as they do stretch with use in the first wearings
I thought these were a bit small to start with but they soon got into the shape of my feet.  Very good don't know how durable they are yet
Very pleased with the purchase; comfortable, look good and after 3 months of continuous use no signs or wear. I would buy these again.

reviews.review_content: I found that after a short while of wearing them the get very worn out around the tounge area of my shoes

For a product with such a premium price, you’d expect it to be of the highest quality and fit.. nothing of the such. I actually ordered the next sizes up to make sure it’ll fit , but in actuality it was way too tight, not only that the material was very flimsy and would easily lead to holes after a day of wearing it, sent it right back after trying one on.. do not recommend

I chose these socks as I read that bamboo socks do not shed black fluff... that was very wrong as I am hoovering every day after removing my socks!  They are very comfortable and soft, but with the fluff they produce it really is not worth buying them.. unless you happen to love hoovering.
reviews.review_title: Buy these if you like hoovering up all the black fluff

reviews.review_content: The first time you wear the socks they are soft warm and comfortable, however one wash at 40degrees and they shrink and go hard, totally unwearable.

I’ve bought many pairs of this brand previously as I like the size 3-5 for small feet they usually fit well and stay good for a long time.  These however are very thin, baggy fit as it no elasticity, I would have returned but I wore a pair today.  Given away now won’t buy again 🙁
These socks are brilliant! They lasted one whole day. Most refreshing ventilation system.
These socks are not comfortable to wear

On opening the very nice packet, the socks' fabric seemed thinner than other bamboo socks I'd purchased. However they looked nice with a strong colour. They had a soft comfortable fabric when I put them on. Sidenote: I bought these for my daughters wedding as I generally find good quality bamboo socks v comfortable and they look well.I put one of the pairs on for the wedding celebration and within two hours they were completely unravelling in my shoe: there's a seam of stitching near the toe of the dock and this came undone, to the point where my toes were completely exposed. It wasn't due to overlong toenails and none of my other socks had this issue.This pair was now unwearable and I had to put on a dirty pair from the day before.  I repacked the socks and I've just returned them and hopefully can get a refund.Let me be clear: These are absolutely the worst quality socks I've ever had. Total waste of time and money. Not all the pairs of socks came undone but one pair is enough and none if the pairs look like they would last long. Please avoid unless you want the hassle I've had to endure!

I am disappointed in these socks. After buying some about 2 years ago and giving a 5 star review I am disappointed this time round because the quality has changed. Won’t be buying anymore unless you can change the quality back to how it was. You can literally see through the new style. OMG so disappointed!
The first pair of socks out of pack did this to my ankle not sure why maybe it was the material, but I thought by getting relatively expensive socks, this happened
Perfect fit and one wash at 40 degrees and they're too tight. They shouldn't happen at the price. Really disappointed
Buy these type of socks all the time only two pairs inside when should be 4
These socks used to be great, nice stretch, soft and good quality. Most recent pair was really poor quality, there's no give in the socks and just feel extremely cheap. Really disappointing.
reviews.review_title: Not as good as they used to be

reviews.review_content: I can’t review these socks, as they were returned.. as they didn’t have soft tops they were not as expected.

Came quickly, seem good quality, not bad for warmth. Now for the bad - they are terrible for fit. Don’t matter what size of feet they go on. Bunching up in my shoes worse than fat folks in an ice cream shop on a rainy day. Had high hope, pretty disappointed to be honest
Too short.And once washed the tops tighten up

I have been using danish endurance low profile socks for two years. I loved them so I wanted to try these. Unfortunately no matter what shoe I am wearing my feet are in sweat. Haven’t experienced this before. Be aware

Unfortunately not a great fit from Danish Endurance, they're too large and slip around in your shoe while walking.I've bought their underwear before which has fit fine, but these just weren't great, which was a shame for how expensive they were
reviews.review_title: Not as comfy as cheaper brands out there

reviews.review_content: Such a shame. The docks are not cheap and feel quality. It’s such a shame I have a hole having only worn a few times. Failure occurred within 7 days of purchase.
Was expecting endurance socks, but what I received was some flimsy dress socks

I have great trouble finding socks to fit comfortably. I wear size 4 1/2 - 5 shoes and ladies socks are usually 4 - 8,  so the heal ends up my achiles or they buch up in my shoes. I thought these would be great when I saw they came in 3 - 5 size but I was unfortunately wrong. They are still too large in both foot length and width, especially at the toe where there is too much material and the stitching on the outer edge bunches up at bit in shoes.  I wear shoes with quite a wide toe bed due to arthritis but the socks still cause some discomfort.The material is really nice and soft and they seem well made although I haven't washed them yet.  I hope the manufacturer takes note of my review as I am still in search of good quality socks that fit a normal width size 4 - 5 ladies feet.
I ordered the UK 6-8 (I’m a size 7) and they seem too big for me which is annoying when I’m wearing them

I’ve had a few pairs of these over the past few years, they were lovely socks, feeling almost silky to the touch.Now however they’ve changed what they’re made of, and are far less silly and much more like the cheaper cotton versions.  They’ve also changed the inside red band with letter, it now isn’t a band but just a short red line.  No real consequence just marks the change.
reviews.review_title: They’ve changed, and not for the better

reviews.review_content: A lot thinner than expected!!
Ok, but still cause swelling
Disappointed,  received one with a hole in it, obviously quality needs to be improved when you look at the prices

I recently purchased the DANISH 6 Pack Bamboo Sock and am pleased with my purchase overall. The socks are comfortable and made of a soft bamboo material, but they run a little big. This causes them to bunch up and slide down my foot, which can be bothersome at times. Furthermore, I've noticed that they cause a little more sweating than my other socks, which can be uncomfortable in hot weather. Despite these flaws, the DANISH ENDURANCE 6 Pack Bamboo Sock is a good pair of socks. They are long-lasting and have fared well in the wash.One thing to note is that, given their shortcomings, I believe the price for these socks is a little high. However, if you are willing to pay a premium for a comfortable, high-quality bamboo sock, the DANISH ENDURANCE 6 Pack Bamboo Sock is worth considering. Overall, I would recommend giving these socks a try, but keep in mind that they may not be suitable for everyone due to fit and sweating issues.
reviews.review_title: Good but for the price you expect that

reviews.review_content: They initially felt comfortable but after wearing a few times they became distorted and didn't fit properly.

The socks are decent but do move around the foot when not wearing shoes or other footwear. They are not bad but I expect better for the price.They seem a little oversized, I wear 11.5 or 12 size shoes and they feel a little loose around the bottom of the heel hence movement. I will wait to comment longevity of the materials.

Bought two packs of these, so 12 socks, back in April 2022. I wear thermals in winter, so they've had about 6 months wear (in all senses). That's about 15 dons a pair. Already had two go through (I've attached a rather lovely photo of my toe poking through one of them). Considering these are *hugely* more expensive than many other options, I really wouldn't go for them. I was hoping for some 5 year socks and got 6 months. I don't have talons – this shouldn't happen on socks this price. Had only one worn through I'd have taken it as an anomaly. Two looks like an issue (and two more seem on the turn). Do not buy.

I got the smallest size (3-5) and have size 5 feet. The socks have very little stretch to them which might be why people like they're not too tight. I have no doubt I won't blister or get holes in them because they're just too loose!  I find that because they have no stretch, they end up feeling quite loose when I have shoes on and end up gathering in my shoes. For £25 I'm pretty disappointed and rarely wear them. Will never wear these socks and won't buy from here again.

These socks have a really soft and lovely feel to them. They have a good fit and are very comfortable to wear for long periods of times. I do a lot of walking and these are perfectly suited for that. I've had these for over a year and while they're in mostly good shape still, a few are starting to thin and wear out a bit.These are fairly lightweight socks, so their wonderful comfort does slightly come at the expense of durability from my experience of them. These are quite expensive which may be a bit of a deterrent for some, but I do really like them for the way they feel. I'd recommend giving these a try.
I wear a size 3.5, sometimes 4, and these socks are too large for me, disappointingly, as I have a few compression socks from this brand, size 3-5 that fit me. The quality seems pretty good.
Nice feeling under foot

These socks are not perticulaly comfortable, nor are they of a quality that I could honestly say warrent the price. I expected to try a pair on and go wow (ok I'm not quiet that sad) but I sort of hoped for a slight ramp up in percieved quality from, say an M&S pair of socks. Nope, they are pretty much MEH. I can't say that I will be spending my hard earned on another set. They may suprise me and get better with a few washes or maybe turn into the miracle socks that outlast all others, but until then I say again....MEH
The socks are great but dropped one star because of the seam across the toes, which isn’t flat and can be uncomfortable.
reviews.review_title: Seams across the toes are not flat.

reviews.review_content: An unimaginative Xmas which was greatly received , good quality.
Super comfy and not too thick

I absolutely love the DANISH ENDURANCE 6 Pack Bamboo Socks! They are incredibly comfortable and provide a soft, cozy feeling all day long. The bamboo material feels amazing on my skin and keeps my feet dry and fresh.The only reason I didn't give them a full 5 stars is that I wish they were a bit more durable. While they are holding up well so far, I hope they will last through extended wear and washing. Despite this, I'm still thrilled with my purchase and would definitely recommend these socks to anyone looking for comfort in their everyday wear.
Socks seem fine atm.
reviews.review_title: Comfortable but, I wonder about longevity.

reviews.review_content: Nice mid leg socks that are soft but I notice they can only be washed at 30c and I thought the advert said 40c but my mistake and it does say that it is better to dry them on a line and not in the dryer as I believe that could shrink them
reviews.review_title: Don't wash on to higher temperature setting and don't add fabric conditioner

reviews.review_content: Socks are comfy, kinda thin so are more around the year British weather. If it gets close to freezing temperatures, I would suggest thicker socks. They aren't water proof but getting them wet isn't as bad as cotton socks as they dry faster. After using these socks for sports and work in safety shoes that includes a lot of walking, one or two socks after 10 months developed a small hole on the side. I got in touch with customer support and they fulfilled their 1 year hole free guarantee agreement and I received 6 more new pairs. So you can trust this company. Also the Denmark flag makes it very easy to sort these socks!
reviews.review_title: Bamboo is better than cotton. High quality socks with real and working customer support.

reviews.review_content: Our son is very impressed with these socks, very comfortable and with a one year guarantee too.
Comfortable to wear, wash well and not tight.
I have ordered these socks previously very happy with the quality and comfort
Great quality this is my second 6pk and will buy again
Very warm and comfortable. I have Diabetic Neuropathy and found these perfect

I bought these for my Dad who has limited mobility and his leg is very swollen. His old socks, which were cotton became difficult for him to put on and get off. I ordered these and they arrived the next day. They are light and breathable so my Dad is delighted with them. I got the size up and they fitted perfectly. I will be getting more for him in the future. Excellent for people with diabetic conditions.
reviews.review_title: Very comfortable and easy to put on

reviews.review_content: This is the second batch of these. Favourite socks
I am between sizes at UK 5.5 to a 6. I opted for the 3-5 size and they fit really well. I would recommend going for the lower size range if you are in-between

reviews.review_content: cheap, bad material. Don’t buy!
Bad
reviews.review_title: This is obvi fake and also bad quality

reviews.review_content: Absolut lächerliche Qualität. Die Buchstaben sind nur aufgeklebt und gehen beim Waschen direkt ab. Retoure ist nur über ein vom Händler erstelltes Rücksendeetikett möglich und geht nach China, wo der Pullover wahrscheinlich direkt entsorgt wird. Fast Fashion in schlechter Qualität vom Feinsten. Der Versand hat zudem auch 2 Wochen gedauert. Kauft euch lieber was vernünftiges, denn hier kauft ihr Schrott.

Der Pulli riecht stark chemisch. Die Fäden sind nicht gut vernäht. Das Bündchen ist leicht gelb und nicht in der Farbe vom Pulli. Das schlimmste jedoch ist, dass der Verkäufer kein Rücksendeetikett übersendet das lesbar ist. Es werden nur Hyroglyphen ausgedruckt, so dass es einem eine Rücksendung unmöglich macht.Ich habe das Amazon Team zur Lösung eingeschaltet.Der Pulli hat eigentlich keinen Stern verdient.

Entspricht eine völlig andere Farbe als auf dem Bild! Schlecht verarbeitet! Rücksendung nicht möglich, da das Rücksendeetikett nicht lesbar ist! Kosten für die Rücksendung müssen auch selbst getragen werden, obwohl mir kostenloser Rücksendung geworben wird!? Finger weg!

Nach nur 2 mal waschen war der komplette vordere Print weg. Am Arm ist er tatsächlich noch geblieben aber das ist auch ein anderes Material. Deswegen bin ich nicht zufrieden mit diesem ESSENTIALS HOODIE

Die Rücksendung wird einem unmöglich gemacht, da das Label nur mit Schriftzeichen ausgestellt wird - keine Adresse oä ist erkennbar. Auch ist selber zu frankieren, obwohl mit FREE RETURN beworben wird.
sehr schlechte Qualität, Nähte nicht ordentlich und riecht sehr chemisch und dann noch auf eigene Kosten nach Asien zurück, ganz klar keine Kaufempfehlung
reviews.review_title: Schrott einmal um die Welt gereist

reviews.review_content: Der bestellte Pullover kam in einer ganz anderen Farbe, als das Bild auf Amazon gezeigt hat. Das Zurücksenden würde dem Verkäufer 20€ kosten, was ohnehin schwierig ist, da das Rücksende-Etikett unvollständig ist. Besser Finger von diesem Produkt lassen.
Die Qualität ist verdammt schlecht. Die Buchstaben sind nur notdürftig aufgeklebt. Beim ersten Waschen war die Hälfte weg
Die große passt total nicht zum EU Große.Komischerweise die S ist tatsächlich ein L.
Schöner hoodie, fällt dir m aber sehr groß aus. Lieber eine Nr kleiner bestellen .
Der Artikel fällt klein /kurz aus,qualitativ gut ,  Stoff etwas dicker!
Schöner Pulli, leider löst sich schon nach wenigen Wäschen die Schrift ab…
reviews.review_title: Schrift löst sich nach wenigen Wäschen

reviews.review_content: Die Verarbeitung is gut
Recht weit
It's a bit messy with the seams and are not cut off. Love how thick it is. Came a bit wrinkly

I ordered this in XXL as it did state came up small & I wanted oversized I’m a UK14 & it fits exactly how I wanted…I got the white. I think they are good quality, it’s obviously not the same as real thing but you get what you pay for & im very happy.
It fits well and is really comfy to wear. I love it!

Leider habe ich die falsche Farbe bestellt. Der Shop hat innerhalb kürzester Zeit geantwortet und mir eine sehr kundenfreundlich Lösung geboten. Ich war positiv überrascht. Auch ist die Qualität des hoodies sehr gut und auch die Verarbeitung.
Der Hoodie ist sehr gut verarbeitet, und sieht schön aus! Top Ware ich kann es nur empfehlen
Die Kommunikation mit dem Hersteller ist sehr gut
reviews.review_title: Gute Qualität ist aber etwas groß

reviews.review_content: Dieses Teil hat eine gute Qualität und Verarbeitung, der Stoff ist etwas dicker und somit gut geeignet für kältere Tage. Fazit: Gutes Preis/-Leistungsverhältnis und empfehlenswert.
Weihnachtsgeschenk für Enkeltochter, passt hervorragend ,
Schöne Qualität
Top Qualität für nicht Originale Produkt aber absolut identisch mit Original.
Nichts zu beanstanden. Vollstens zufrieden!
