Package delivered THREE days late; Not the seller's fault.  Looks good so far - the only issue is with the sleeves.  I'm under 5 foot so a huge amount of room and more than enough length vertically however the sleeves don't cover when stretched in front; example for cycling which is the main purpose for purchasing.  If you have arms like 🦖 you're ok! If they extend the sleeves and make it folded like a cuff it would be helpful. Love the colour! Looking forward to getting more.
Bit thin material. Looks thicker on picture
Hood maybe a bit small, but gr8 for the price!

I was camping in Norfolk for a week a fortnight ago. And had to take my tent down in full on storm . The poncho did its job. The only issue is alway how much you sweat wilstead being active when having a poncho on. But it did it job well, the press button came undone on the arms a few times.
reviews.review_title: Used in a full om storm

reviews.review_content: it was a decent buy but I had to throw mine away on the first day.  It wasn't suitable for the work I do on a farm.  It flaps heavily in a slight breeze and scares the animals.

Light weight and compact when packed into its supplied pouch. Not suitable for prolonged use but handy to keep with you just in case. I am 5 foot 10inches and with a 40L daysack it provided adequate protection. My only criticism would be that if you were to be using Alpine sticks or a thumb stick then your clothing around the wrist and forearm is still going to get wet in the rain so a slightly wider cut would have been perfect. I would buy again.

Ok. But its not quite the same as in picture. Picture show hood is wider. This poncho no grommet that can act as weigh, so if very windy beware it can lift up. But overall it is quite roomy. I can cover backpack as im 160cm and it reaches my knees so tall people need to take that into consideration. Pocket is convenient to put phone for easy access. Plastic fabric like windbreaker material and relatively waterproof
Good quality. Easy to put on and wear. Bit expensive. Overall happy with purchase.

This is like an old-fashioned Pac-a-Mac material. strong enough for occasional use. It is rainproof, although as with all PVC coats, you tend to gather sweat on the inside if you are particularly active so it pays to spread your arms out occasionally to allow air to circulate.  It is big enough to go over a modest backpack. It fits my 6 foot 3 frame down to my knees, good enough if I wear waterproof trousers to keep my legs dry.Good value for money if your careful with it. Better than a black plastic rubbish bag.
Product is nice and compact and does what it says on the tin. Used in our travels across the Philippines. Can say we stayed very dry during a very vet storm
reviews.review_title: Great use.. kept us smug and dry

reviews.review_content: This is great for those looking for a lightweight, compact, and effective way to keep the rain out. I use it on the way to and from work if it is ever raining, but typically wear it over a jacket, so I can't say much for the comfort. I wouldn't solely use it in the cold, but who would, it's not designed for that, but I definitely enjoy it more than a typical water resistant coat for one reason on top of it being lightweight and compact.It's that it hangs below the waist. Sure, some coats also have that in common, but because they tend to be thicker, movement is restricted a bit more than with this. All in all, it has great value for money, with the only downside being my skill to wrap it up properly on the first try.
reviews.review_title: Great waterproofing for more than just the waist up, and compact too.

reviews.review_content: So many uses to it! It’s brilliant! Packs away so small neat and tidy! Highly recommend
I bought this for my son, it is perfect for him, it covers him to below the knee, which keeps almost all of him dry even if he is carrying a small rucksack
Good quality, good style, great length for heavy rain and excellent delivery

Had a few different types of these and apart from gong all in for canvas one I think this is the next best thing. My others have been very plasticky and unbeatable. They also crumble up. This one has a more nylon texture and light feel. Super comfortable and folds back up lovely. You do look a bit like a soldier or Brie Willis in Unbreakable (comments I have received) but not the worst look!
Did the job and dried quickly
These were a god send when we want to Disneyland Paris!! Great size, can get a backpack underneath and kept us dry.
Good job when raining

name: Muc-Off 214-1 Premium Anti-Fog Treatment, 32 Millilitres - Long-Lasting, Intensive Anti-Mist Spray - Suitable For Helmet Visors, Goggles And Glasses
description: About this item    ANTI-MIST FORMULA: When the weather turns, the last thing you want is fogged up goggles or glasses. Our premium formula creates a transparent, micro-thin coating on your goggles to prevent them from misting up mid-ride    LONG-LASTING: Engineered to perform, just one application of our anti fog spray for goggles and glasses will last for up to 5 days - so that you can be sure your ride won’t be caught short by blurry eyewear and visors    MOISTURE ABSORPTION: Designed to keep your vision crystal clear, our anti-fog spray is formulated with advanced moisture absorption properties - so spraying this on the outside of your goggles will help rain and water droplets bead off to make your ride safer    EASY TO USE: Available in a handy 32ml bottle, our glasses demister spray is the perfect ride pack companion for when you’re on the move. Simply shake to activate, spray a light mist over your clean goggles and wipe gently with a dry cloth or tissue.    SUITABLE FOR ALL: Our Anti-Fog Treatment is safe on all plastics and glass, so it's perfect use on a wide range of eyewear. Use it on your motorcycle helmet visor, your swimming goggles, your glasses and sunglasses, scuba masks, ski or snowboard googles and more     ›  See more product details            Brand   Muc Off     Item form   Spray     Scent   Unscented     Specific uses for product   Glass     Item volume   32 Millilitres     Unit count   32.0 millilitre     Surface recommendation   Glass, Plastic     Special feature   Non Slip     Number of items   1     Contains liquid contents   No      See less     From the manufacturer

reviews.review_content: We were using it for Airsoft on our goggles but after a few metres, the goggles started to fog again.

As an anti-fog spray it fundamentally failed to do the job it was designed for.Trying to read the directions on the bottle is a challenge - tiny black lettering on a silver background - I had to take a photo and enlarge it to be able to read what it said.I sprayed both sides of one lens of my glasses with muc-off leaving the other lens untouched. I gently wiped the lens with a tissue as directed, put my full face helmet on and then my glasses. The unsprayed lens fogged up as expected. The sprayed lens went a smeary mess and was actually more difficult to see through than the fogged lensEven worse when I took my glasses off the sprayed lens stayed smeary while the fogged lens cleared.I cant recommend this product at allAlso there is a date of 15.5.2023 printed on the bottle - don't know if that is a manufacturing date or an expiry date

The product appears to work on a nice dry bright summer's day however as soon as it starts raining and gets dark the visor completely gets obscured and I had to slow down to 10 miles per hour in a 40 mile per hour zone Because you are unable to see anything when a vehicle is approaching with its lights on. This product is dangerous. I gave one star because zero wasn't an option

I normally use Bob Heath Anti-Fog on my glasses on my motorbike (I have a Pinlock insert on my helmet visor). It works OK but only lasts a day or so. Decided to try Muc-Off. When I "haw" on the lenses after application it seems to be working great, but once I have the helmet on it's like I spread oil on my glasses lenses.

I bought this spray for a trip to Lapland. It was -20C . Sadly my glasses were covered on frost in and out. I used the spray several times on 2 pairs of glasses ( for me and my mum) we both had the same results.
reviews.review_title: Not working for very low temperature

reviews.review_content: Your product didn’t work at all it was that bad I thought I’d been scammed
Visor steamed up still with even worse visibility
Might aswell spray water on the lenses because this does not work at all. I do not recommend.

Absolutely useless! Used it as per instructions, goggles fogged up within 10 minutes. Completely cleaned them and read instructions again. Did it again and the same thing happened. What a waste of money!

Doesn't work, just end up with a weird greasy like fog instead of normal fog you can kinda see through. I tested it on a mirror in the bathroom to side by side with shaving foam on the mirror next to it... Shaving foam didn't fog up, mirror with this on did the same as in my visor. Won't be getting this again, will just use shaving foam on the dark visor in my helmet! Why can't they make a pinlock for the internal dark visor!

This product didn’t work at all, I purchased this item to stop the fogging in my goggles during airsoft. This item was a total let down after the first 10 seconds of game play. Honestly this bottle of let down ruined the majority of my day. The only reason I didn’t give up and leave was that I actually had to purchase a pair of cheap mesh goggles from the on-site shop which might I say I really wasn’t too keen on but I really didn’t want to cut my day short. Extremely unhappy with this product, I advise anyone to do yourself a solid and purchase a item called catcr*p (yes that’s actually what it’s called) and save yourself from the total disappointment.
Doesn’t really work goes really streaky washing up liquid works better.

Glasses still fogging over, doesn't seem to help a great deal. If there is any improvement from using this product, then its minimal and certainly not worth the purchase price. Will give it a miss in future.
broke after two weeks of owning it

I bought Zeiss anti-fog first but it’s not cheap so I tried Muc Off. I mainly use anti-fog on bathroom mirror and swimming goggles.I must say these two brands have difference too obvious.Bathroom mirror treated with Zeiss would have nearly no fog (just a ring of light fog along the rim) or a film of light fog.When treated with Muc Off, at its best, the whole mirror has a film of light fog (still thicker than the Zeiss treated glass), or often pretty full of fog with water stripping down too (which doesn’t happen on Zeiss treated glass).After spraying the Zeiss is very easy to wipe dry (2-3 wipes would do). Muc Off somehow is “thicker”, leaving streaks with tiny tiny bubbles and you have to rub few more times before it “sinks in” the mirror. You can leave the Muc Off streaks to dry by itself too but it takes slightly longer.
Doesn't actually work.

I brought this for my sunglasses and it made them worse. I tried cleaning them then applying the spray as instructed but the moment I put them on in my car I was blind, they just fogged up instantly. Maybe I applied it incorrectly. I washed them thoroughly and tried re applying following the instructions again. The moment I put them on I was blind again. For the third time I washed them thoroughly and used shaving foam and they didn't fog up at all... if you want a cheap anti fogging solution get some mens shaving foam.

Bought to use inside visor on my motorbike helmet but doesn't appear to work, still fogs up inside & leaves more of a mark than my breath itself.Will attempt another coat but review still stands as I don't think it'll make a difference trying it again.
Smells like fish and alcohol mixed together so not pleasant to use on my glasses

I'm fed up having to put my contact lenses in just to go shopping, but I have to because my specs steam up with every breath whilst wearing a mask. Completely forgetting that I have a similar product in the garage that I bought for my car(!), I went ahead & ordered this.I applied it, donned a mask...........and no mist up! Even breathing directly onto the glass produces nothing. Only a tiny amount needed so this should last a while. Definitely happy to recommend.**EDIT** I retract my recommendation as this stuff is effective for a very short time only. If you dare to get any drops of rain on your specs & then wipe them off, you take away any coating that may be present. On average it lasts for one trip to Tesco.....

I bought this predominantly to deal with glasses misting while wearing a mask. After 20 seconds the moisture had just coagulated into a weird oily film on the inside of my (brand new and very clean, I might add) glasses. I had to wipe it off and then they just steamed up immediately when I put them on. Not sure what the point is?I'll keep this stuff as it should be useful for the outside of my cycling glasses when it rains, but for fixing glasses steaming up while wearing a mask, I wouldn't bother. I still love the Muc-off brand, but maybe this stuff falls a bit short.
reviews.review_title: Seems to just coagulate into an oily scum.

reviews.review_content: Doesn’t work properly. Little less fog.

I have used this demister in my swimming goggles and its pretty good, the bottle lasted for over 18 months..bought more recently but it's all gone..the cap was loose and it's all leaked out..check the tightness of the cap if you buy it..
Does the job but only lasts for 2 days 3. You always have to reaply it.. it helps eith the water drops too.

This does work, in that it seems to keep condensation away, however it does seem to leave streaks and smeary marks which obscure vision almost as badly as the condensation. I followed the instructions to the letter and had the same results on goggles, visors and even my car windscreen.
reviews.review_title: Keeps away condensation, but leaves its own residue which is not totally clear.

reviews.review_content: Compared to my existing version (left) the liquid in the new one (right) is a lot clearer. I feel as though its been watered down or manufactured differently because it doesn’t have the same performance as before.
You wont get foggy lenses, but you will get slimmy ones with slime dripping all over...
turns your visor in to a magnifying glass making it hard to focuse on road
reviews.review_title: Great untill your viser gets wet

reviews.review_content: Applied product as directed, buffed up with clean soft tissue but still noted some smears. Thoroughly  clean glasses again, Reapplied product. Following day glasses misted up again.
Wears off quickly on swimming glasses.On car mirror same.

I purchased this primarily for use with a Ring doorbell that constantly steamed upPro:* 32ml, I have found that due to the small area, I need to use only one spray; it Is more than enough. So, in theory, this should last quite a while.* It’s only been two days since I last used it, but we have had rain, sun and thunderstorms. These conditions are an issue, particularly if it becomes sunny as condensation builds up, this making motion detection useless and having to wipe down constantly. Since using this, I haven’t had to do either, and the image remains clean of debris and condensation is primarily purchased and what I wanted it to do.Con:* If you’re going to use it with a Ring, I thought it could spray and allow it to dry naturally, Don’t do this. I tried, and it left a red residue behind in some areas (although the liquid was clear). It took quite a few damp cloths cleaning and buffing to remove. Ensure when you spray, you immediately wipe.* Having read some of the reviews regarding smell, I can confirm it does have a scent. To me, it smells like boiled eggs, so not ideal if you intend to use it on glasses as you’ll be able to pick up on this. It isn’t an issue for me personally due to solely for outdoor use. My partner did use it on their glasses but found the scent disgusting and lingered; therefore, they had to use liquid detergent to remove it.Overall, I would recommend if you're using outside on a ring doorbell or similar on glasses, probably not so much due to the smell. I wouldn’t also say it’s worth the asking amount of £12+. Thankfully the price has dramatically decreased.
reviews.review_title: Works well on Ring Doorbell, Glasses not a much

reviews.review_content: Pretty nice, does keep glasses from fogging up, but does leave a noticeable film on the glass, which very slightly disrupts your vision while wearing your glasses. But nice for such a low price.

I used this for my glasses when playing airsoft and it was also borrowed by another player for their goggles. The spray is easy to apply with a tissue just spray and let the liquid move sround on the lenses and then wipe off dry it wont leave run marks.I recommend using it on both front and rear of glasses/goggles lenses so you have as much coverage as possible.Please know Throughout the day 9am-4pm of playing i must of applied the spray 4-5 times as my sweat and then rain made the spray come off and resulted in fogging. If you have the lenses away from your face and you use a sweat band/rag on your forehead to absorb sweat it makes the usage better.Overall for someone who wears glasses it's pretty good way to defog just remember to clean the lenses first then apply with dry tissue and watch out for sweat.
reviews.review_title: It's the best i found so far.

reviews.review_content: Does what it says on the tun.I'm a motorcyclist and I sprayed inside and out wiped it down and went for a ride  even with my vent shut still no fog.I haven't tested it on long rides I was only out for 20 minutes but usually within a minute my helmet is fogged and I have to lift my visor but then the wind and dirt gets in my eye so this stuff is brilliant so far.

After applying I could not see any condensation when breathing on visor, but out on a ride in the rain it still fogged up when visor was closed.  Will reapply, but definitely doesn’t make the fog situation any worse and it’s cheap.
reviews.review_title: Worked initially but visor still steamed up on ride

reviews.review_content: It works quit well I've used it in the pouring rain and the bitter cold and it did its jobI've found best let it sit on visor 2minuts then wipe off but don't polish it

The spray does what it’s supposed to do, I used it on my glasses before wearing a mask and there was no fogging up.It’s a bit inconvenient to use however as the instructions on the back state to clean the glasses with a piece of tissue and to not use a microfibre cloth. The tissue sometimes leaves lint on the glasses which takes longer to clean and it’s not clear why a microfibre cloth can’t be used.
reviews.review_title: Does what it’s supposed to do

reviews.review_content: Works for about 20 mins, but then I have to reapply it. Wish it lasted longer as it can be a slight nuisance in an airsoft game but it does help
Good stuff but steam does not appear, but streaks do appear.

Update: After spending a bit more time with this, I've found that it tends to work best if you apply it a while before you actually need it (in this case, a while before you need to wear your face mask). It's still not perfect and sometimes needs to be reapplied a few times before it really works properly, but it gets the job done for the most part.Original review: I found this to be a really mixed bag personally - despite following the instructions to the letter the results seemed really inconsistent. At times it would be fine on one lens and do nothing for another, and other times it just ends up preventing the steam but instead making your glasses look like they're coated with a wet, oily residue - making it similarly hard to see (although admittedly not as hard as with mist).I've tried various other means (using more/ less than the instructions suggest) and just can't seem to get it to work with any real consistency. At times it seemingly does nothing, at others it works to a reasonable degree and other times it essentially replaces one problem with another. The success rate just feels like a complete gamble.It's not terrible by any means but I doubt I'd buy it again after this bottle runs out, as it is rather pricey for something that only seems to just-about-sort-of do the job from time to time.
reviews.review_title: A bit hit and miss - instructions could be clearer

reviews.review_content: I started using this product during the pandemic.I tried a bunch of anti-fog sprays this one was the best for me.I don't know what they've done to it since my last bottle, but the formulation seems to be different (less smell, easier to apply) and the performance is so much better -Way less streaking, much more clearness. Huge improvementHighly recommended
reviews.review_title: Huge improvement to an already great product

reviews.review_content: I use it on my swimming goggles, almost threw them away before i found this spray. I use the spray before every swim, just in case, so not sure how many uses you get out of each top up. Keeps goggles fog free, very happy with it so far!
Works really well on my helmet visor.
I am very pleased: I've had no moisture 'fogging' on my doorbell camera since I used this product.
Good for anti-glare
Is doing it's job
I tried several others and home remedies to stop my visor fogging up. Glad I bought this and won't use anything else now, it's great quality anti fog spray
Easy to use
Perfect product, but needs to dry on visor before using it when the weather rains
Bought to prevent fogging up of goggles during air soft play. Worked very well!

reviews.review_content: Initially pleased with this purchase but they soon lost their shape especially around the neck.
Definitely not compression tops even if you go down a size. If you want an under shirt then these are okay, however their description is totally incorrect! 😕

Here are some of the specific things I disliked about the compression shirt:It was too tight and uncomfortable to wear.It was made of cheap material and didn't seem to be well-made.It was overpriced for what it was.I would not recommend this compression shirt to anyone. It's a waste of money.
I was under the impression these were suppression T-shirts and they were just t shirts. Nice loose and cool but not compression
reviews.review_title: Not a suppression T-shirt as advertised

reviews.review_content: Not a good fit
It doesn’t do what it states, it does the opposite.
Absolutely terrible one are shorter than the outher
Hab dieses Produkt gekauft und 2 von 3 Shirts sind beschädigt. Es stehen einfach Fäden weg, diese Stelle ging natürlich auf
Es ist unglaublich nur ein paar Tage getragen und sieht aus ob es durch den Fleischwolf gedreht worden ist, absolut minderwertig!!
reviews.review_title: T-Shirt löst sich in seine Bestandteile auf.

reviews.review_content: having used compression shirts in the past, these are probably the worst. the material isn't even the "compression spandex" that makes a compression article of clothing - compression! more of a velvet-like material and feeling. not breathable as well.
Hello I place my order because I saw 5 pack on the description!!! But they send me only 3 !!! The quality is great but the Info a price for 3 are super expensive!!!!
Normal t-shirt

I am a BJJ competitor and I use compression shirts for every training session.  I've owned many different brands of compression shirts and Niksa is the only that I simply can not use due to the fit.  The quality and comfortability of the product are spot-on, but the sleeves are too loose.  I have broad shoulders and a narrow waist, every compression shirt that I've owned up to now is tight through the arms and chest with a bit of slack in the waist.  Niksa is the opposite, somehow?  It's too tight in the waist and loose through the chest/arms.  Note:  I tried a medium first and thought that maybe the brand just runs a bit big, when the smalls arrived, only the waist was tighter.
Nette Synthetik-Shirts. XL bei 185 und 94kg zu gross. Gegen zurück

Nulla da dire sulla vestibilità e comodità, ma per chi suda (quindi chi fa sport anche a livello normale) non c'è traspirazione, grondano di sudore, il cattivo odore permane anche dopo il lavaggio. Sconsiglio vivamente, le sto buttando dopo pochi utilizzi.
reviews.review_title: Magliette per chi fa sport per finta

reviews.review_content: Son camisetas normales que se ajustan al cuerpo pero no son de compresion ya me cogi una talla menos de la que suelo gastar y no son de compresion. Una lástima ya que el primer producto que compre fue de mejor calidad.Editado:Se pudieron en contscto conmigo desde la marca y me dieron  solución al problema. Me parecio muy seria y gratamente satisfactorio ya que me dieron la opcion de cambiar el producto por el indicado. El trato por correo e intentando dar una solución es de 5 estrellas.
These shirts are slightly stretchy but most definitely not compression. I bought size small and they just barely hug me. I have regular t shirts that are tighter.

The comfort is fine. Fits exactly how it should. My only complain, unlike others I’ve purchased, this shirt tends to rise a lot. I purchased these for work (I work in a hospital) so they go underneath my scrubs. I tuck the shirts in and eventually they slowly begin to rise above my stomach. I rarely use these due to the rising problem. I’m not sure if others have the same problem, but I would recommend a different brand 🤷‍♀️
This item was a decent t-shirt but definitely NOT a compression shirt. It fits and feels like a regular, extra-extra medium t-shirt.
Poca compresión muscular, dudo que la talla S pueda a llegar a comprimir como debería de hacer una prenda que se vende con estas características.Una lástima, dado que estos colores me gustan mucho.

Sieht in wirklichkeit nicht so aus wie auf den Bildern, sondern wie Putzlappen. Damit will keiner im Studio rumrennen. Hab sie gleich nach der Anprobe zurück geschickt. Die kompression passt allerdings, wer aber was vernüftiges sucht, sollte da etwas mehr Geld investieren

These compression top are not a very tight fit and don't have a strong elastic to pull you in only,XXL is my size  last one I bought were a good fit,pulled my tummy in and was a good all round support wouldn't buy again as only good as a tee shirt
Very nice material, and wash well without creasing
Very satisfied with replacement sent. Small size was perfect for compression. Customer service from Nikes was excellent.
reviews.review_title: Niksa’s replacement for item not suitable

reviews.review_content: Decent but I ordered size advised by amazon and I’d say not tight enough for compression tops . Feel comfortable and help keep warm .
ok as base layer but not a compression top ss advertised
Good quality but the sizes come uptoo small.
If you wear a large top order the xxl sizing is massively off which is a shame because they're nice looking tops and made well
These shirts do fit well and they quality appears to be there up to a point .For exercise etc they are ok but as compression shirts ? No they are not .I will keep them for they are ok
shirts are good, but I didnt know that you'll need to go a size smaller than usual, I got M and thats my standard shirt size, I'd recommend go a size smaller than usual clothes

Ottima vestibilità. Non adatte a chi ha la pancetta o ha un fisico troppo asciutto, perché le maglie sono molto aderenti. l'unica pecca è questo effetto lucido del tessuto, ma alla fine, per quel che servono, non importa.

The sizing is about right for the UK. The fit is snug and does not really relax when you get hot. They are somewhat lightweight, but the only real problem is that they don't breath, so you can get quite warm in a workout.
Good T-shirts. Ideal for working out in. Good quality and look good. Very reasonable price for three tops.
Comfortable and no nipple chafing, very good value.

Excellent quality excellent fit not really what I would call a compression shirt yes there is some support there but nowhere near enough for my needs however they wash well and you don’t know you’re wearing them
I liked the quality of the material and the three different colors enclosed. I placed my order on Friday and picked it up the next day from a close by pick up point. Brilliant 👏

Good so far nice fit , I ordered large which is my usual size, no annoying seems irritating me. Have used as a base layer for M.T.B and walking,not washed them yet though but hopefully they will keep their shape.

Arrived promptly, bought for exercising with the shorts already bought from same manufacturer on an exercise machine and also for bike riding and working on a nature reserve as a lightweight undershirt. For bike riding using as an alternative to winter compression bottom layer for when the weather is warmer but not warm enough for just a lightweight top. Seems OK, dries quickly, does have under arm breathing area but not sure about wicking action.Happy with purchase
Not as good as one of the bigger brands, the neck bits get loose fairly easily but decent for the price.
Medium probably would have been too tight whilst Large not quite as close fitting for me. For most people they are good.

I wear a lot of base layer / compression type t-shirts, and it's often difficult to find quality shirts in basic styles without loads of branding etc all over them.Really glad I found these as they're super comfortable and the quality is great.Recommended
Great fit, very comfortable and great price. Highly recommend.
Good quality and great fit offering good compression and warmth

These compression vests are an extremely good buy.They are a little longer than the normal, which is an added bonus.They're an excellent stretch fit, although I always go for the size under my normal size for a real tight fit.Easy to was and use multiple times, the last pack of three lasted about two years, and I wore one every day.They are also good summer and winter, really good breathable material,  while still giving that core support.Would wholeheartedly recommend this product. 👌
Fits well, comfortable,
Brought these for my teenage son for the gym.Nice material & really good fit, my son was really pleased with themGreat value for money!
reviews.review_title: Great Value, Good Quality & Nice Fit

reviews.review_content: These do hug your body nicely, but you cannot really feel you are wearing one, they keep you quite warm ( despite being fairly thin material ), but they have mesh panels under the arm holes, so do not trap sweat.  I appreciate the low neckline as they do not show when you wear one under a shirt.  All in all I am glad I got them and would buy again.
They are a comfortable fit, and feel great on, the sizing is exactly as described
I bought these multi pack gym tops and they are excellent quality. Very happy with it.Also the delivery time frame was super speedy with next day delivery.Super happy, thank you.
Good quality tops, very reasonably priced. Excellent customer service. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.review_content: Is it my body or is it the trousers
very thin material which creases rather easily.  they are slim cut and a little loose around the legs. not worn as cant get the creases out after washing
they didn’t fit the sizing didn’t seem correct.i will need to return them

I think I got a reject pair as the trouser seams are full of unfinished cotton tails and they were supplied with a completely broken zip that's fully disengaged which also had teeth completely missing on the zip. How they got through any form of QC or inspection I don't know! A disappointing purchase and a complete waste of time for everyone. I cut most of the cotton tails off the seams before realising the zip was broken and damaged. I didn't even try them on with the zip being unusable, they were returned with all the tags still in place for a full refund.

Really good fit and comfortable pair of trousers, but, having worn them to a wedding in September and a carol service in December the zip broke. Three teeth just dropped out of the middle of the zipper as I was exiting the  bathroom. Bot rubbish really. Chose these as they were that same brand as my work trouser I have worn to death which were brilliant. Shame
Material seems good when new. Wash at 30c drip dry and shrank by about 5cm.Seller did not help until Amazon stepped in.
Refusing to refund on a faulty pair of jeans.Avoid this company.
reviews.review_title: Refusing to refund on a faulty pair of jeans

reviews.review_content: Well after wearing once I noticed that the fabric started to pill ?!? Says it’s mostly cotton but I don’t think it is tbh.The legs both sides and bottom of trousers all showed pilling after the first use. Got that bad that I actually started to try and brush it off with my hands as it was embarrassing.Really not impressed.

I could not find anything to like about it: The sizes specified on Amazon are pure fantasy. The waist size would have fit Mr Blobby perfectly. I expected to take up the legs a bit but they were not even the length advertised: A Giraffe would have found them fine.To compound this I can't even send them back: The Amazon returns label just printed out as jibberish. I contacted Amazon about this and was completely ignored.In short, just pretend this product does not exist and ignore it completely. I have been messed about and have lost the best part of a £100 for the useless items I acquired that i can't return.
reviews.review_title: PRODUCT BEARS NO RESEMBLANCE WHATSOEVER TO THE DESCRIPTION.

reviews.review_content: Not much to say, don’t expect new clothing to have holes in the pockets.
reviews.review_title: Smaller than standard size, pocket has a hole.

reviews.review_content: Poor quality, sticking around waist arrived lose and coming apart, right leg has been stiched wrong as you can see in photo.

Just a heads up to any potential buyers if these trousers don’t fit (and they won’t!!). It will cost at least £10 in postage to return them , if you live in the UKDo your homework before you buy. The sizes are all wrong

I brought these trousers as I thought they would be straight fitting chino type trousers, they are not. They are made of a stretchy material and I would describe them as slim fit which isn't ideal if you have a more athletic leg shape. For the price the qualitry seemed fine but they are much slimmer than in the stock images.
reviews.review_title: Fit is not as in pictures

reviews.review_content: I have purchased a lot of similar trousers but these seemed a lot longer than expected I have only just got around to trying them but will not be wearing them as they are a lot longer than normal meaning you have bagginess up the leg that is off putting.

Quality is fairly decent, however these trousers are skinny fit, not ‘slim’.I bought a 38 waist when I’m a 34 to try and get a decent fit on thighs and calves and they are still skin tight.Made for very small and skinny males.
Not as good as the last ones I bought , waist sizes were oversize and thigh fitting is also large very poor shape , more like jhodpurs . Wouldnt buy again .

Admittedly these are quite cheap but I was disappointed when they arrived. They were advertised as navy blue. However, the actual colour of jean that arrived was more like petrol blue.Also, I expected them to look more like a chino. They do not. They look like jeans. So, if you want chino type trousers for work, then these are not for you. Spend a bit more and get proper chinos.Also, this particular pair sold as 'navy blue' have a shine, which is not that nice. They also attract fluff - a lot of fluff.I will be taking mine to the charity shop and not buying again.
reviews.review_title: Sold as navy blue, but the colour is not navy,  fluff magnet

reviews.review_content: Actually really liked these trousers both in photos and when they arrived.  Having ordered my usual size I was surprised to find that they probably wouldn't have fitted my old Action Man.

The jeans fit perfectly, and feel good to wear. My only issue is that straight out of the bag, significant parts of the stitching had broken off. For the price, this is very disappointing, and I wouldn’t recommend them.
These aren’t slim fit but more cut if the circulation in my legs skiing fit. Returned.
They fit as expected and look smart enough. I am considering buying another pair in blue so that says it all really.

The material is a little thin - not sure how they will last.  Plus that means they have a tendency to look a bit baggy and bent out of shape.  But they look decent enough and after a few weeks of regular use are still perfectly okay.I have several pairs of casual jeans/ch9inos, so they don't get that much use.  The zip and a belt loop have gone on these, though.  Cheap, but not great value.  My other pair are okay, though a belt loop has gone on them, too.
To small and tight on the legs

I purchased the 36" waist but were too big then moved to 34" and good fit. Wore once and with the stretch they are very comfortable. Unfortunately seam at side of pocket burst and had too return.  Quick delivery

Pants ok for price.I would say a little on the long side. I'm 5ft 10" and always get regular size. These feel like a long leg.Also maybe a little too shiny for my initial liking, but sure after a few washes they hopefully lose a bit of the shine.  But overall they seem ok.  Delivered fast and well packaged.

The product itself wasnt a good fit for me. Its almost as if it didnt have enough around the butt area. However the supplier issued a refund with no issues at all so great customer service. Im quite a heavy build so these may be suitable for those with a smaller frame. Size guide is hard to judge when buying online and my rating is based on it being a poor fit for me.
reviews.review_title: May suit some but not for me.

reviews.review_content: The material of chinos are nice, yes they are skinny leg which I expected but what I didn't like was the bottom fit, they sit around your bum, not your waist. OK if your a slim guy not so much for the bigger man

They are really tight around the calf muscles. I've got long skinny legs so they make me look like I've got chicken legs. Won't be wearing them. Also they attract lint so if you buy them, get a lint roller!
Product is fraying at sides after 2nd wash., but comfortable enough for work

Needed a cheap pair of trousers that I wouldn't mind getting dirty whilst doing a bit of yard & barn work; normally only ever buy trousers in store so I can try them on & get the right size, but these were cheap & offered next day shipping, so I picked my regular size and hoped for the best. Was pleasantly surprised by the decent fit - a bit tight throughout the leg but that's the style nowadays  (and they've got a bit of stretchy material incorporated, so although a bit tight for my liking, they're not uncomfortable); length was bang on, only real (minor) issue was the waist was slightly on the big side - not enough that I could move down a size, and easily fixed by a belt.They seem a bargain at the price point; they're comfy enough, smart enough & seem constructed to a decent standard - I've already ordered a second pair.
Quality is good enough but am disappointed as ordered 28W but they are too big - feeling more like 30 or 32W.

I'm on my 4th pair of these, as they are comfy, and last up to a year before they wear out.However,the waist size is always much too large, so I have to adjust them every time. I usually wear a 46 waist, so I first ordered that size. I am not exaggerating at all when I say you could fit a watermelon between me and the waistband. Next I tried 44, still comedically large. Then 42, same story. I have a 38 inch pair on the way so hopefully those fit better.
reviews.review_title: Comfy and long lasting, but you'll need the sewing kit.

reviews.review_content: These chinos are really good quality, the texture of the material is nice and fits nicely. This is my 3rd one
Fantastic chinos - company only let down is there returns policy - I had to pay £4.99 to return a wrong size pair
I have to return the 1st one & get a 2nd size. The quality of the trouser material is excellent.
reviews.review_title: Good but the size guid is misleading

reviews.review_content: I ordered 36L. The quality and waste fit was good, but as you can see from the pic, they are too short. These are unlike and far shorter than any other long trousers I've ever purchased... most standard length trousers are longer than these!

Suitable for everyday wear, or one off special occasion, quality is what you expect for the price, stitching is good, material a bit rigid out of the bag, I have slept in these over christmas (late nights) and they do not crease at all, not washed before wearing and this could and possibly will change the crease shrugging. I would by again but a smaller size than I thought as the stretch is forgiving. I am 32/30ish waist more 31 waist and the 32 waist was a comfortable fit but I think that i maybe better suited to a 30 waist with the  stretch fabric?
Nice style. My hubby wears these for work and casually. The only downside is the colour fades pretty quickly but for the price cannot complain too much.Delivery is also always very fast
Good fit, comfortable chino. Slim fit.
Liked the colour very deep navy.
Very nicely made. Just didn't fit my child. Would highly recommend this item.
Good fit nice lines and very comfortable
I like the strong denim.  Good stitching.  They will likely last.
Great for price point
nice jeans with labels
And only because my partner had an accident - they are really hard wearing!
Best pair of jeans I’ve bought in years fit perfect I bought 3 pairs highly recommend
Enzo trousers are true to size and very comfortable to wear.
Good value item delivered on time.

reviews.review_content: Purchased these for a holiday .. big mistake..Because they are soft material they press down so hard on my big toe and after 30 mins I have to remove the shoe because of the pain. I had plenty of space inside the shoeWould avoid these .. not comfortable what so ever

After one day, these will not stop squeaking, creating a continuous noise when walking; considering the cost, they are simply not good enough. The quality of Nike products has declined, and as a result, these are being sent back.

I’ve had these shoes all of about 2 weeks before i noticed an annoying noise when I was walking home one day. I brushed it off thinking it was just because the bottom of the shoes were wet but a couple days later it began making that same noise again, this time more often. Gradually as the days passed the squeaking became louder and even started happening when they were not wet, what baffled me was that it squeaked even when they were dry and I was walking on carpet???? I have to imagine it’s due to the poor design of the sole but at the end of the day, don’t buy these, there’s a reason there was such a good deal on them and it’s because they’re crap and no one else wanted to buy them.

    Only had for a month and it squeaks on every step it take. Super annoying. I will take it up with Nike. Avoid this trainers.

i dont ask much from a trainer but, when i walk i don't want a squeak. i thought it may be the way i walk but when i returned form holiday i was walking along the corridor of the airport and i could hear, squeak, squeak , squeak. i tried to walk differently but the squeak was still there. then i noticed in front of me walking was someone with the same Nike shoes, it was his shoes that were making the squeak as well. shame, they look good and fit well. but the squeak will take away.

reviews.review_title: if you want to sound like SpongeBob then buy these trainers

reviews.review_content: There must be mice in these shoes. They squeak. If you like squeaking mice then these are the shoes for you. Otherwise, avoid like a mice plague

reviews.review_content: Like the design very comfortable only problem is they make a squeaky  noise when you walk in them on hard floors not good for nike 😕
Whilst they are undoubtably comfortable, the trainers squeak when walking so I have returned as not fit for purpose.
The right shoe makes a weird noise when walking. Super annnoying.The back of the shoe is pretty uncomfortable too.

I have bought these shoes for my son before.  He finds them very comfortable.  Unfortunately, with this new pair, an extremely annoying squeak developed in one of the shoes.  It is not soft of subtle in sound.  This has changed is gait pattern as he tries to limit the sound as he walks.  Very annoying, I have had to buy him another pair of shoes.  Total waste of money as they are still in good condition... I must say... I would tell him to put up with it, if the squeak was not so loud! 2 stars because they are still a comfortable shoe.  Lost 3 stars because they are unstable due to the sound...

I’ve never worn a pair of trainers that squeak on and possible type of flooring. Cannot wait these on a treadmill at all. It’s so loud and distracting the amount of noise from these. They we’re comfortable until they spill in the sole

They look great. They’re comfortable. Not a bad price. I like them so much I named them. The left one I call bubble and the right one. Not sure yet. Although I’m perplexed by the fact that there seems to be a mouse that follows me around since I started wearing them. We have great conversations. Although whenever I ask him/her a question, the response always sounds like ‘squeak’.Apart from that… great!

This review would have been 5 star had these trainers not developed such a loud noise whilst walking that my son now refuses to wear them. It sounds like he is passing wind with every step. Embarrassing!
First of all I've got 2 blisters on my heels the first day of wearing these Nike trainers. Secondly they make squelching noises when walking.I'm convinced these are knock offs.
Comfy material and hasn't frayed or anything so decent quality.However they got wet once when it snowed and now they squeak with every step I take.

Very comfy and lightweight. Have used them a few times a week since September and seem durable.Only downside is they often make a loud squelch/ squeaking noise when walking (not wet). This can be a bit embarrassing and sometimes means I do not wear them. This has happened since they came out of the box and continues now 6 months on!

Bought these about a year ago for working in a bakery. You’ll notice after about a month of wearing them that they'll squeak with every step and once you realise it'll irritate the life out of you. Ive recently replaced them with another brand because the squeaking got far too annoying.Ive noticed that alot of other people I work with have the same shoes and the same issue, and have seen people complain online about it so its a design flaw in the actual shoe, not just me going insane.Other than that, theyre fairly comfortable and pretty durable. After a year of working 40+ hours a week theyre still intact and Id still wear them if they didnt make me cryBuy them if youre deaf or if you know how to fix the squeak
reviews.review_title: Great for people who cant hear great

they are good shoes, just after a few weeks start to squeak when you walk

Good but after a month or two the backs wear down and there are holes in the front, needs a strong patch underneath this area to stop this happening.  I have to oversize the trainers and wear thin socks to reduce the wear at the back of the trainers.
Expensive copy

Nice shoes and the 12 year old loves them because, well, Nike! Bit expensive for what they are (not really a sports shoe more fashion) but you're paying for the name! Good quality but too expensive but pretty good
Great trainers, very comfortable, but they squeek like hell, and I mean there's no chance of going by unnoticed,  I love the trainers, but have become too annoying to wear.

squeak Squeak bloody squeak you would have thought that a company as big as Nike and the amount of sneaker’s trainers that are designed and produced by this company that they would use materials that doesn't make this annoying noise as you walk. I’ve washed these trainers to try and stop this and yes I thought I had conquered the problem then hey presto off they go again squeak squeak squeak ahhhhhhhh.
These trainers arrived quickVery lightweightAnd comfortable
Really enjoyed working out with these trainers, great for jogging. Only down side is that it is too popular lol but its a good value for money

As the subject suggests. It's more black rather than the grey in the photo.

reviews.review_content: These are comfortable to wear, but the waistband is large and tends to fold over as the day goes on, this is the only problem so people without a belly should be OK.

Tried and tested many boxers over the years like many men have.  I always got the typical NEXT boxers after the misses went to the boxing day sale and I used to just use them for day in day out work, going out and lounging around.  Took me a while to realise how bad they were as didn't really think about it at first.  Came across these new balance ones and this review sites along side my second purchase which tells you strisght away I was happy with them.  By far the most comfy boxers I've had in years, if not ever.  No riding up and that's genuine, for me at least.  I appreciate we might all be off different shapes and sizes but striaght away these made me realise how poor the NEXT and alike really are.  I get no movement throughout the day which is a massive difference, especially when your in the middle of Tesco trying to right a few wrongs.  Very awkward.  The material is of a small amount of lycra.  This makes them very comfy and keeps the shape really well.  I wouldn't normally wear new balance for a night out but for the fact they are so comfy I've got a pair of the pure black version which are perfect.  Would defo recommend to anyone looking for the day to day comfort and lessen the need to keep jigging things around.  Quality product.

I’m 6ft, 240lbs (110kg) of solid muscle - ok, and a bit of fat. But I’m in the gym 6 days a week, and so my large quads and butt reflect all those squats and hip thrusts. Herein begins the endless search for the perfect undergarment that provides support, but also prevents any chafing, and stays put even during the sweatiest training session or long walk.Boys, I think I’ve found them!Hands down these are better than the Under Armour equivalent that we all know about. The under UA pairs I’ve had all ride up, every day, all the way up until I might as well have worn tiny briefs instead.But not these! No! These are light weight - but not too sheer, supportive - but not compressing, and best of all, even on my solid legs, they stay put. Even after a sweaty walk to the gym, a gruelling leg day (with lots of friction from hip thrusts, RDLs, squats, and some elliptical machine at the end. They mostly stayed completely put, only shifting up a slight amount on my legs100% when I do the same kinds of workout in UA equivalent, it’s Roll city.I could probably squeeze my assets into a large, but I got these in XL and they are a really a good fit - if you have seriously large quads and glutes, get a XL. But large could probably work as well, depends on your wait measurement. Sometimes if you go too small in the waist side, you can fit into them, but then the waist band constantly rolls and folds over - another pet hate of mine.I held these New Balance XL up against the UA equivalent in XL, and these New Balance ones are about 1inch smaller, in the waist. So they are a slightly smaller fit.Can’t really fault them so far, and they are better value for money than the UA ones.Also, not that everyone is interested, but these have seams/stitch that comes up the back of the pants on both sides of your behind, and for some reason it provides a kind of extra lift. Makes your arse look better. And who doesn’t want to have a good looking behind, especially for those lads out there with pancake butt, they can use the help.I will be getting more of these for sure.

These are my favorite pair of jocks as a bigger guy. They are long enough to cover upper thigh so to prevent chafing and the material is nice and smooth. Would very much recommend. I personally reccomend buying these true to size as these are more comfortable being slightly tight rather than loose.
Really good fit and very comfortable.Could do with more colour selection though

If you are looking for quality no fly/button boxers that actually fit, then these are highly recommended.Bought for my extremely tall and stocky son. These ticked all the boxes for him.We did have to wait a while for delivery, but thankfully it was worth it.  I would look to buy again, but at normal price, they do work out expensive per pair.  So I will look out for them on special.

    I wasn't expecting much at this price point, so obviously you're not expecting this to be a piece that competes against similar looking analogue quartz watches from the budget end of the best known, Japanese maker of well liked, inexpensive models but, in fact, this is really pretty good. Seriously, I kid you not, it's a very presentable, well built looking wee thing.I bought the 36mm model and it sits nicely on my 5⅛ inch wrist.The cashback is undoubtedly made of a decent chunk of actual stainless steel whereas many similarly budget minded watches come with some form of nasty zinc alloy that burns the skin as soon as they're worn for more than a few seconds.My picture showing the rear case shows how crisply the lettering and numbers are formed. This suggests that this watch is far from the cheaply assembled piece of nonsensical junk more often found at this very inexpensive end of the analogue watch range available.The strap is also far better than I expected it to be.I'm impressed that said strap is honestly and openly described as  a leather alternative, where many budget pieces are described as real leather.Not only is the strap correctly, truthfully described but, as you will see if you zoom in on the photo that shows the outer finish on the strap, [the strap] looks, wears and feels like a much more expensive one.So far, the watch is keeping excellent time, as a quartz piece should. Sadly not all quartz movements are so accurate, some of my similarly inexpensive quartz pieces lose seconds per day.There is no minute track on the straightforward, uncluttered dial of this watch, so to check its accuracy precisely it is best set at 12 o'clock when you have it out of the packet and are getting it ready to go.(Slight) criticisms as follow:The crown is very light to turn and can cause the minute hand to move when you're pushing said crown in after setting the time. This is easily dealt with by simply ensuring that it is pushed home with a fingertip at either edge of the crown and keeping your fingers from moving, so preventing unwanted moving of the hands.For me, this is no problem at all, indeed I can think of a certain Swiss "luxury" watch in my collection that does exactly the same thing. It's not a fault, simply a characteristic and not indicative of any manufacturing problem - I couldn't find any of those and was trying!Sum up:A good looking, surprisingly well built watch for a lower cost than a new battery for many quartz watches.Parti ularly impressive for me are the quality of manufacture in both rear cover and strap.This is a real bargain and very far from a hastily thrown together piece of the sort that looks and most frequently is poorly made.Well done to the makers of this for supplying a watch that's actually rather good! I may add another colourway to the collection.Thanks for reading, I hope that my words & pictures have been useful.Happy shopping,Jaye ××

reviews.review_content: Der Schuh sieht so ja schick aus. Aber gehen kann ich damit nicht, er bildet bei meinen Füßen eine ganz eigenartige Gehfalte zwischen dem ersten und zweiten Schnürsenkelloch. Da der Schuh aus Kunstleder besteht, ist auch nichts mit dehnen, weicher werden, etc. Es wird einfach nur brechen. Anprobiert, fünf Schritte gegangen und gleich wieder retour geschickt.

These come up extremely small. The Size 11 UK does was roughly Size 9 UK, way too small for comfort. They will likely be made in China where an XXL may equate to a western L, still, shoe sizes are supposed to be standardised for a reason.The slippers themselves seemed extremely almost absurdly cushioned under foot when new. I only tried them on very briefly. Quality was just OK, not sure how durable they’d be long term but it’s irrelevant for me because the sizing is way out and I took a refund rather than replacement. If you’re a discerning gentleman, I would look elsewhere.

When I first purchased these slippers, they were very comfortable and fit very well and I would have recommended without hesitation, but after just 6 months, the upper on the left foot has become disconnected from the sole on the inside front, and the right side inner sole has worn right through and the foam padding disconnected and has become rather uncomfortable.I work from home and wear these slippers all day, but I spend prectically the whole day just sat at a desk, only getting up occasionally, and the same during the evening. I would no expect this level of degradation after just 6 months.Overall very disappointed that I am going to have to by a new pair of slippers already.Given 2 stars purely down to the comfort when I originally bought them.
They are very comfortable but less than 3 months of light wear, they are falling apart.

Initially I thought these were great. Warm comfortable and true to size.Within a few weeks they started to feel a little loose and now they are so stretched and baggy, when I have no socks on they are falling off! Hopeless

These were very comfortable and squishy underfoot at first but very quickly (within 2 weeks) the insole squashed down to nothing and they feel far too big now. I am very disappointed I spent £25 on slippers that I now have to wear slipper socks with to feel remotely comfortable.
If you have wide feet do not buy these, also feel uncomfortable inside when wearing them
The bottom of these seems to have slipped a bit making it not very comfortable under foot.
Not very sturdy slippers and became uncomfortable very quickly. End up in the bin within a fortnight. Wouldn't buy ever again.
Rubbish

I so desperately wanted to love these slippers, they look so incredibly comfortable!  I’m a female who normally wears a size 10 in men’s, so I ordered a size 9 to be safe.. The size 9 was HUGE too so I returned them for a size 8 (I had to pay shipping AGAIN even though it says you don’t have to pay shipping on exchanges) Anyway, the size 8 is also HUGE!!  They’re so big that I can NOT wear them because the heels keep falling off!!  The description is extremely misleading because it says there’s an adjustable strap thing in the back heel part, which there is NOT!!  False advertising for sure and the worst pair of shippers I’ve ever owned!!
My husband hated them because they would not stay on his heels.  Unfortunatley my grandson wore them in the garden so unable to send them back.However, they are very soft and padded well.
These slipper really stretch over time, to the point they are quite loose unless you wear extra thick socks. Memory foam doesn’t last too long.
reviews.review_title: Ok, buy a size smaller than you need.

reviews.review_content: found these to be very tight around the toes....have exchanged for a larger size.
They looked ok but I ordered a size 9. They were much bigger than that and were too loose. Had to return
Description of sole not accurate, size large and quantity is 3 star.

Good slipper just fit not alot of room in them and  could do with more cushion on the inside  but good slipper even if a little on expensive side but if it had more memory foam in and little more room near the toes would be worth it
Ok but to small everything I own is a size 10 these are way to tight , love the label that says wear them for 2 weeks and they will stretch . They don’t and then you can’t return them.

Well they are OK, although defiantly look better of the website. They are comfy, although i bought a size UK9 and possibly could get away with a UK8, maybe because i don't always wear socks. The grip seems very good and warmth factor is excellent.

Very comfortable initially.  I've been using these for about a year and the padding / foam is completely gone and holes are appearing in the fabric on the inside. The rubber outsole appears to be holding up though.
Ok I guess not suitable for gardening climbing ladders or heavy duty construction work other than that it’s a pair of slippers

My review would have been for five stars apart from the fact that I have no way of knowing the 'durability' of the slippers.  Leaving that aspect aside, the 'comfort' is very good.  I took note of the comment by the suppliers that the feel may be 'snug' or a little tight on first wearing them.  Indeed, that was quite right as they were just a bit 'snug'.  However, the shape soon conformed to that of my feet, so no problems there.  They are very comfortable and the soft lining is great.  I much prefer these slippers to my last pair that came from a High Street retailer at two and half times the price !  The value for money offered is also very good.  If the slippers hold up on the durability side then I would have no hesitation in giving it five out of five.

Very Comfortable and fits well but there is a but. I find it stretches quite quickly even so I do like these slippers very much so much so I bought another one in a different colour. If it wasn’t for the stretch it would of been a five star easily other people may of had a different experience. Don’t be deterred from my review because they are as yo stated a good pair of slippers for longing in.
Very comfortable, easy to slip on, great for putting the bins out as the sole is durable
Very warm and comfortableI would suggest going down a shoe  size as I would my 10 size a little large.

Nice and comfortable slippers that are good for wearing around the house. Only reason for 4 stars is the sewn pattern on top is different on both slippers, stitched lines across one foot, no sticked lines across other foot. It doesn’t effect how comfortable they are and I only wear them indoors so nobody would notice but both should match.
They are comfortable and warm
Bought these for my son and within a week the sole had come away at the front of the slipper. I had ordered a pair for myself and have had no similar experience, so perhaps he was unlucky.
My second pair, I find them very comfortable and warm
reviews.review_title: Big soul on the slipper and warm

reviews.review_content: They run a little big. I’m size 10.5uk, but the size 10 that I bought run loose.Also, the side rubbers seem to be loosing their quality.
Cosy and warm for around the house.
reviews.review_title: A treat for my feet after reaching the death of my old ones.

reviews.review_content: Just got these caterpillar-inspired slippers and I’m over the moon! They’re not just for the elderly; even us young folks can enjoy the snug comfort1. The tire-like sole is a game-changer - I can stroll outside without a shoe swap. Plus, they’re durable as heck!The elastic bandage is a neat touch, making them easy to slip on while keeping my feet secure. And let’s talk about the memory foam insole – it’s like walking on clouds. They’ve molded to my feet perfectly and keep their shape.Big win for me – they’re machine washable. The design is simple yet stylish, and they don’t scream “grandpa-ish” at all.Kudos to Wishcotton for sticking to their philosophy of health, comfort, and safety2. They’ve nailed it with these slippers. And if you need help, their customer-first principle means you’re in good hands.I’m all for supporting a brand that values comfort and craftsmanship3. Plus, they’re eco-conscious, which is a huge plus for me.In short, these slippers are a solid buy. They’re warm, comfy, and have a strong sole that doesn’t compromise on quality. Whether you’re lounging or doing chores, they’ve got you covered. Highly recommend!
reviews.review_title: Comfy Caterpillar Slippers - A Perfect Fit for Home!

reviews.review_content: 2nd pair of these I've bought (I wore the first to death)They are warm, cosy, fit as expected and last well despite having been treated quite harshly.Hope they're still available in another two or three years when I've killed this pair!
2nd pair of these, really comfy and snug, warm, worthy spend.

Absolutely superb slippers and so warm and comfortable. Initially, and I am only talking an hour here, felt slightly tight. However, very quickly fit well and my personal advice is to order your normal size. Would highly recommend

I got these for my husband and he finds them cosy and sturdy but a little roomy. I should have got a UK 8 not a 9. He takes an 8 and a half shoe size so I went up to 9 thinking that would be better. I'm going to buy some insoles to try to use up some of the extra space. I probably could have exchanged them but couldn't face the hassle. Apart from the size error (my fault) they are nice slippers and not too "grandpa-ish"
reviews.review_title: Cosy and sturdy but a little roomy

reviews.review_content: Best slippers I’ve had. Good fit(as per UK size) extremely warm, comfortable with decent soles. Don’t slip off and easy to put on. Recommended.

What is for my son as his old pair were falling off his feet. He said wearing them felt like he was walking on a cloud, He is more than happy with them, so should he need some more in the future, I would buy again from this company.
These are so comfortable. After several months, they still have spring in the insoles. The size is perfect. Highly recommend
My husband likes these he's says they're like walking on air.
Cosy and well padded slippers, bought 2 pairs, my son and husband love them.
