reviews.review_content: I suggest you look at the research on fertility when it comes to polyester underwear.  Go on Pubmed or search YouTube for people who go into depth.I mistakenly bought these. I was wrong to think paying extra was going to mean they are made from a material that is basically plastic.  I couldn’t return them.  Waste of money and better ones are available at a lower price.
Too thin

I thought that spending a bit more for a pair of quality boxers would mean a better fit.I went one size up because usually underwear is tight, which I don’t like so i bought M instead of S.The elastic in these is so tight that after a few hours of wearing it leaves really bad marks on my skin. Obviously i can’t  return them as they have been worn.Update: now i am giving them 1 star due to having walked with them for a while and getting really strong pain in my balls. The boxers are extremely tight at the waist area and provide absolutely 0 support to all the important bits and are really unconfortable. £25 thrown in the trash.
Holes/tears after very short time
Save your money, complete waste. Bobbled after first time of wearing and washing. Even emailed company about them and never had a response. It’s been 6 months.
reviews.review_title: Rubbish quality, bobbled after first wash

reviews.review_content: Seller advertised for sizes not accurate. Much smaller than what they say and no possibility to send back.
Too small for me but now I'm stuck with them.  I should have checked before buying, hopefully this review will help others to avoid the same mistake.  Oh well, needed to lose some weight anyway (:
Product looked great, very comfortable, however after 1st wash it went bobbly. Poor quality.
Got sent item pack was already open and one the boxer shorts had stain inside not happy so disappointed with this item
Product looks good quality but too large and no return policy :(

I bought a 3 pack of their cotton trunks and they were the best underwear I ever wore, so I followed up with these. These are a different material, very smooth and silky and shiny. Again they're comfortable and look best in all black, but I find they make my balls sweat quite a lot 😂 so I'll stick to the cotton ones in future.

I bought a few sets of Medium pants as I started at the gym.I can confirm they're good pants. They're pricey, but, they fit well. They're comfy and strong in all the right ways.I stuck with the gym, got larger legs had to order Large-size, replacement pants.However, being a fool, I mistakenly ordered two more Medium sets.Attempting to 'Return or Replace' these new orders I was simply shown a message saying 'Item not listed for returns'. And as much as I try to find contact details for the company, they remain impossible to track down.So, I have two sets of Mediums (never opened, never will be opened) for £60, that I cannot swap for the size I need.I understand it's my fault, I ordered them in error. But to have utterly no way to swap out replace them feels somewhat callous. Unlike the snug, reliable feel of the pants themselves, it does not feel soft or yielding, in any way.Therefore, I can only recommend the pants if you know exactly what size you are and have checked carefully, several times, at each stage of the checkout. And I cannot recommend the company, simply as I can't speak directly to them.The pants certainly service the customer, but the service to the customer, is pants.
reviews.review_title: The pants certainly service, but the service is pants

reviews.review_content: The fabric is very synthetic but it’s fine. As is the quality. However, the waist band comes up to the navel. The rise is far too long. Absolutely hideous fit.
Arrived with multiple pairs coming apart at the waist band. Seems a shame as otherwise they would probably be ideal.

Was looking forward to receiving these and incorporating them into my underwear collection. Wore the first pair which were absolutely fine; felt lightweight and almost as if I didn’t have them on. Wore the second pair and after a few hours of wear they ripped at the front.Very disappointed with this and based on this alone I wouldn’t recommend these.
The boxers ride up and don’t stop chafing . I thought I’d try these instead of my usual boxerjocks from Under Armour but I can’t get on with them.
The quality is great but unfortunately  I wanted them to have the brand on the rubber band they came without  it .
reviews.review_title: They came without  the brand on the rubber band

reviews.review_content: i bought these for sports as a synthetic moisture wicking alternative to cotton. They are indeed synthetic and though they ride up a little when running are much better than average. However, the wastband is in-substantive and flimily flops over creating a nuisance at the top of the shorts that diggs in and is uncomfortable. All the pairs i have are the same so a design defect that cheap boxers from tesco aren’t subject to. VERY DISAPPOINTED and wish i could return as unlikely to use them.
Really comfortable with poor quality an event you can ask for a refund after just two weeks

I bought these for work as I do quite a physical job as an engineer and they are just not comfortable. They ride up your legs and make you sweat alot more than cotton boxers do. I didn't find them comfortable for the gym either, the only time they seem to be ok is when I'm cycling. Definitely wouldn't buy again.

I bought these thinking they were going to be cotton, as I own a few pairs already and wanted new ones. When I received them and they were sports ones I was still happy to keep and try them out as I love my cotton ones.I was disappointed when I washed them though and they have started pilling after the first wash, which will lead to them being irritating.I will only air dry these as it may be that they went in the dryer, but still, I didn't expect that they would pill on the first wash, given how expensive they are.
reviews.review_title: Pilled  on first wash and dry

reviews.review_content: Although the boxer shorts are quite comfortable, the fabric starts pilling very fast. It also seems like the fabric is getting thinner. This is really a pity, as they look great.I also feel that after sitting on a harder surface (i.e., floor for yoga or rowing boat) for more than 10 minutes,  the fabric becomes uncomfortable and itchy. Not a recommendation from my side.
Good product, as described, but nearly didn't receive this as is was delivered into my recycling bin !!!

I purchased these at a cost of around £17.00 (three pairs of boxers) on 01 Jan 20 and I received them on the 03 Jan 20. They come in a light plastic slider pouch bundled up in small rolls. I chose black because I did not find the multi-colour pack with bright coloured seams to be appealing. I am not a fan of underwear made from cotton, since I find they can hold smells or do not sit well on my figure. I normally purchase Under Armour tech original boxers but the price is starting to creep upwards. Hence, I was hoping these would be a cheaper replacement. For comparison UA's are normally around £25 for two pairs.The sizing guide is confusing and totally wrong, this should be removed as I believe it will put people off buying. I ordered my normal size being an XL of which my waist measurements are between 36" and 38" (inches). Needless to say, my guess was correct and XL fit me as expected. The waist band I find to be a bit weird with vertical lines/strands all the way around (see photo), which may take a bit of getting used to. The fit I'd say is average, I have not noticed them riding up much or chaffing but I will not be using these in the gym or on a run.Maybe DE could produce a seamless pair of trucks or maybe I have missed them? Keep it simple!

It's tricky for men to buy underpants unless it's a type and make you know well.  Tricky because they may look good in the picture and others may have found them OK, but it's all down to the fit and the personal comfort.  Men have to buy by waist size but another important feature is what support they require for their "dangly bits".  Standard boxers give no support whereas fitted types (like these) should keep things where they need to be, whatever the wearer is doing.I read the reviews and decided to buy them XL, which is standard for me.  But really they're not supportive enough, in the XL size, so maybe I should have gone for L instead.  Or maybe Danish athletes are sized differently.  They seem to have washed well but in my case I have to rearrange the furniture too often.  Too late to return by the time I found that out.
Great fit and comfort. I found they could chafe after a long day at work which was unfortunate

The material is very comfortable against the skin and at first I really liked them. But the disadvantage I quickly discovered that there is no ‘bespoke’ pouch for the gentleman’s gentlemen. I walk distance briskly and I row for 7 or 8 km a day. For both activities, I found the boys sliding between the material and my legs instead of being snuggly held in place - firmly but gently - as other boxer/trunks have done. The ones I’ve got might do as a fallback sometime, but I’ve ordered some of a different tried-and-tested make. I must remember not to get carried away by hype!

Love the look and feel of these and was, initially, very happy with them.However it only took one wash for a pair to start coming apart at the seams. I broke out the needle and thread and fixed them. Wash number two saw a second pair holed. The third pair are holding up ok. They're not cheap and I should have sent them back. Lesson learned.

I love these, but every now and again I get a pair that either start to unthread, or holes appear after only a few months.I just don’t feel comfortable about sending used underwear back, but if it happens again I will! See pictures.

Great quality and fit perfect and they are very comfortable to wear and I would highly recommend. Delivery was very quick in fact they came earlier than expected.The only problem I have is that 1 pair had a pull in with a slight hole in and can't be worn having said that I really like the quality and the feel of the pants I've decided just to keep the 2 as there very comfortable and nice fitting a little shame but hey ho 😁

I really like these, I bought them for going to the gym. No chafing, holds everything in place and breathable also found that they are good for when riding a motorbike.I like the fact that there isn't an itchy label and it's made from recycled materials however, as soon as I put them in the waist band rolls over. I'm only about 1stone over weight so not a very large belly but the waist band immediately rolls over on these which is annoying. Also it's worth noting that the waist band on the pairs I received are plain they don't have the named in them as shown in the photos.
reviews.review_title: Comfortable but waist band rolls over.

reviews.review_content: Fabric is not very soft

Boxers are supposed to fit 40 to 43 waist my son is 39 waist they are very very small try to return but not able you can not return these,I had already ordered larger  size so very expensive  costing over £60 for 3 pairs.Going to speak with Amazon.
Bought these for a multi day hike and were very comfortable. No chafing whatsoever. Beware colours run when washed
Really good underwear. Comfy, breathable and quick dry. I will buy again.

After reading reviews went for medium as some suggested come up small. For me this is incorrect & swapped for small. They are very comfortable & stretchy. Not quite as compression tight as would have expected for sport underwear. I'm a rower so my thighs are quite big which means the legs roll up into the creases of my legs. This is quite annoying as is slightly uncomfortable. Would have got 5* if not done this.
reviews.review_title: Would be perfect if legs didn't roll up all the time

reviews.review_content: Fit perfect, stretchy and don't get too warm or too cold on hikes. Don't bunch up like a lot of shorts do. Seem to be good quality but time will only tell.
Fit perfectly. Great on the skin and very comfortable.
I've found them to be very comfortable
Very comfy and pleasantly fit well.
Really comfortable boxers, nicely shaped and supportive. Nice material; I really like them.
Bought for my husband and he reports them as being very comfortable.  Long enough in the leg that they don't ride up, and cool enough to wear even for very energetic exercise without feeling clammy.
Good quality, comfortable to wear

I ordered these as a replacement for the Men's Lapasa Sports Boxers I have had for 5 years. They are not in stock anymore, so I decided to order these based on the good reviews they get. Delivery was free and fast and I am pleased with the feel and fit of the Danish Endurance Sports Boxers! I would recommend these! 😃👍

Bought these for hubby as his others (different brand) were less than good. Reviews were good so thought they were worth a try. So glad I did as hubby loves them. Excellent quality, great comfort and support. They wash easily and dry super fast.They’re not the cheapest boxers but so far they appear to be worth it. Time will tell how good a value they are. Fingers crossed that their quality continues to shine through.
Delivered on time. Well made and very good.

Bought a pack of 3 danish boxer shorts ,very moderately priced for the quality . Dispatch was quick and I was kept informed throughout by Amazon and the delivery company . Very pleased overall with the whole experience . Doug BRATT Devon
Worn them now for a few runs, ranging from 5k up to half marathon. Seem great so far, no chafing, uncomfort or anything. 10/10

Santa bought my husband some of these as a lightweight, quick dry option for travel . He turned his nose up at it being such a boring gift. However, he has since made repeat purchases to replace his entire underwear drawer so that says how comfortable they must be and how impressed he is
Partner like em
reviews.review_title: Partner likes em , will be buying more

name: Unisex's Smash V2 Trainers
description: Product details     Care instructions     Hand Wash Only       Sole material     Rubber       Heel height     1.18 Inches       Outer material     Leather      About this item   Smash sneakers   Inspired by tennis. Enjoyed as daily footwear   Updated, improved fit   See less About this item    Product details    Package Dimensions                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  30.3 x 18.3 x 10.7 cm; 700 Grams   Date First Available                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  6 Nov. 2021   Manufacturer                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  PUMA   ASIN                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  B09L5L9SYW   Item model number                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  364989   Department                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  Unisex       Best Sellers Rank:  862 in Fashion (See Top 100 in Fashion)   6 in Men's Fashion Trainers       Customer reviews:         4.5  4.5 out of 5 stars         39,015 ratings               From the manufacturer                      PUMA CARINA   The highlight of this sneaker is the new tooling with a slightly elevated platform sole. These '80s-inspired shoes easily fit today's laid-back sneaker look of Californian beach towns. The premium leather upper and subtle PUMA branding give the sneakers a deserved an air of class.   SoftFoam: PUMA’s dual-density insole provides two unique layers of cushioning for customised comfort, fit and long-lasting durability   Carina  L takes inspiration from styles from the 80's - interpreted to fit today's   laid-back sneaker look of Californian beach towns. The leather upper is   accented by a perforated vamp and a PUMA formstripe. The highlight of the   shoe is the new cupsole tooling though with a slightly elevated platform sole   with texture interest in toe and heel area and cat branding in the medial.   The SoftFoam+ sockliner provides superior cushioning and optimal comfort for   every step of your day.                                                         How to find the right shoe size?                              Why is this important?   Shoe sizes are not standardized. Every shoe manufacturer uses different measurements in terms of instep height, toe shape and foot width. However, the basis for your own shoe size is always the length of your feet. Thus, you should always determine your foot length before buying in order to choose the right shoe.       Step 1: tracing your feet   Take off your socks, place a piece of paper against a wall, and place your foot on it so that your heel touches the wall. Now use a pen to trace the shape of the foot on the front of the toes. Hold the pen exactly upright.   Important: Both feet must be measured, as they are often of different lengths! Feet often swell during the day, which is why we recommend taking the measurement in the late afternoon.       Step 2: measure   Now you can measure the edge of the paper from where the heel was to the longest toe and determine the length of your foot. Use your longer foot as a guidance. We calculated the necessary allowance for enough space in the shoe for you. Find the size that fits your foot length and the allowance included in our shoe size table to make the right choice.             Step 3: Look it up in the shoe size table

reviews.review_content: Wore them sporadically for a couple of months and both soles now have holes right through from the ground to your heel. May as well walk around barefoot considering how terrible the soles are.Never before have I had shoes fall apart so quickly. Sorry Puma, I'll be avoiding your brand forever now, disgusting you're selling such cheaply made tat that's effectively straight out of the box and into a landfill.

I was really impressed with the comfort of these trainers, put unfortunately the soles inside started to full apart. I will not buy anymore trainers from puma again by cheap buy twice. Back to adidas I will be going…
Pain at the toe after wearing it for 4 hours

Terrible materials, very much like the cheap trainers sold at supermarkets. Fit wise VERY narrow to the point of crushing toes together would not recommend, the shoe says unisex maybe would fit a woman better.
reviews.review_title: Buy at least one size up

reviews.review_content: I bought these as I like puma, plus they were on offer. After wearing them once the front rubber part came unglued, and soon after the sole came off. Really disappointed.

The sole and insole are poor quality.After about 4 months of use the insole had become really loose and ripped at the heel and stones were constantly getting in to my shoe. I have included an image showing the insole (pulled out fully now) made up of a thin green foam and blue layer of fabric ripped and broken. I'm pretty sure its not the way I walk as its never happened to me before. I tried putting a replacement insole in but that was also ripped apart.I shall be avoiding Puma from now on which is a shame because it is difficult to find comfortable shoes in size 12 and these fitted OK.

These are smart looking trainers and I can't deny they are comfortable but after less than 1 year of normal wear the inner soul is disintegrating. There are pictures from other reviews that show this issue and its basically fatal for the shoe.  Strangely the outer sole shows virtually no wear. These will go in the bin soon and have taken the record for the quickest a pair of trainers have worn out on me. I won't buy Puma again any time soon, back to Adidas.
reviews.review_title: The bad reviews are truthful, read on

reviews.review_content: Poor lining inside shoe. It fell off and the shoe became uncomfortable. Lining came off literally within a dozen wears. Couldn't return them as it was outside return window.Initially very comfortable, then this happens.Maybe a poor batch.
A cheap version of an old classic look. The footbed in particular is very thin and the foam insole is so flimsy that you will feel the honeycomb style sole digging into your heels.
3rd quality
I've bought two pairs of these and both times they have started squeaking. Not going to buy puma again. My sister has also had the same issue with puma trainers.
Not a fan anymore

Very stylish shoes. They look great for my taste.However they are not very light, and they can be quite cold on autumn in London.Beware, the insole might be cushioned, but the sole itself is very hard. After a few weeks my feet still hurt from walking in them, even if i'm used to very thin flat soles.Usually I size in the range of 8(42)-9(43), this are 8 and run a bit large, but at least they are not too narrow.

I bought these just to wear round the house and my office when I get in from site. The price was excellent but the sizing is all wrong. I have been a UK size 8, (Euro 42) for 45 years, whatever brand of footwear I buy but these are no more than a UK size 7, which has left me with the irritation of having to send them back to Amazon and fill in customs forms etc. Beware buy at least a size larger or buy a different brand, one that can size correctly.
Very narrow - useless for male feet even though they are advertised as unisex - only really suitable for dainty female feet
Toes is too tight and press harshly pinkie.
Only had these 2 months and they have holes, get wet, stitching apart. I don't even use them for exercise!
It looks like fake
Way too narrow towards the toes
Not a true size 12, they weren't long enough and not wide enough either. Quality was generally poor, so I returned these for a refund.
reviews.review_title: Too small, too narrow, not comfortable.

reviews.review_content: I've bought 3 other pairs of this same sho previously, but these ones are noticeably tighter than other pairs. They don't rub my little toes, but the toes are squashed by the edge of the shoe this time. I probably won't buy this shoe again.
reviews.review_title: Not as spacious as previous pairs of this shoe I've owned

reviews.review_content: It was the price that attracted me to them the most, just wanted a casual everyday pair of trainers. These tick them boxes.The problem with them is the fit, they are very tight width way. Have to wear them very loosely.Can’t send them back as I’d had them in the wardrobe for to long before I’d actually used them. Lesson learnt!

Fantastic trainers. My son finds them very comfortable. They look durable, but unfortunately they only lasted for just half a year; and my son only used them for communing to his college and back. The material is worn out where his toes are and the rubber part of the sole cracked in numerous places and there are also holes in it.I wish they were a better quality, but as my son loved them so much, I ordered him another pair. Hopefully, they will last a bit longer than last time.
reviews.review_title: great trainers, but they did not last long

reviews.review_content: Put these in for a wash and they have lost their colour and shape

Like the shoes! Disappointed the track shoes came in it’s box no package cover to protect shoe box so it came damaged. It was going to be a Christmas gift but very obvious what it was, so no surprise there.

reviews.review_title: Comfortable but falling apart after 3 months

reviews.review_content: Daily wear, but far to tight.Couldn't wear them.
Nice style. I ordered a size up. I’m a 12 but got a 13 but they are very tight for me.
Only had these a few months got caught in a heavy rain storm and the insoles fell apart on the inside completely normally good brand but on this occasion not good
i also thought they wouldn't last very long due to the poor quality of the interior.
reviews.review_title: they felt cheap with the foam/soft lining

reviews.review_content: Good pair of sneakers/ trainers for the price. They look hard wearing and are very comfortable. Very glad I took the advice of other reviews and went up a half size. I'm normally a UK size 9 and went for 9.5 - the fit was just right. A 9 would definitely have been tight.
reviews.review_title: Good solid sneakers. Need to size up.

reviews.review_content: They are so comfortable

I would say these shoes are good for those with slightly narrow feet.Size wise they are pretty accurate on my feet.I like my shoes to not be to fussy and these meet the criteria very well.I use for general walking about and the navy are very nice.Not suffered any dye issues yet.
Look good, they are very narrow fitting across the toe's. If you've got fat feet, I would try something else
Got these for my Dad for Christmas and fit him great lucky I got the 10.5 size he usually is 10 but fit him nicely.
Good pliable sole which moulds to feet.
Only concern very slippy under foot in wet conditions.Extremely comfortable look good great value in Sale.
They are good quality but you might need to order a size up from what you usually buy as they are not  a generous fit.
Nice trainer but the soles wear out quickly.
Bought these as they were on a special offer

I was looking for some trainers for a birthday present for my dad, and came across these. I like Puma trainers as they are so comfortable, having owned a pair of Puma myself, I thought my dad would find them comfortable with all the walking he does. I wanted to find a colour more suited to him, so these were perfect being blue. They’re a lovely colour blue, like a Royal Navy colour. They were available at a great price too so I took the chance and bought them. I checked them over before giving them to my dad as a present. They arrived in the original Puma packaging and looked great. I gave them to my dad and he was so happy! He tried them on straight away and said they were perfect size and he loved the style. My dad’s had the trainers a little while now and wears them daily. He said they’re so comfortable, lightweight and easy to clean. So I was delighted to hear that!Anyone considering buying these, just do it! You won’t regret it!!
Fast delivery and really good quality shoes so comfy and warm and nice style recomend this seller
Quality product,good price. Pleased

Bought for my husband, wasn't too sure as he usually wears Adidas,  however he loves these trainers,  very comfortable and supportive.  fit as expected.  they also look smart.  were delivered the next day so good all round.

I recently got a pair of Puma unisex trainers, and I'm impressed by their comfort and style. The cushioning provides excellent support, and the sleek design makes them versatile for both casual and athletic wear. Overall, I highly recommend them for their quality and trendy appeal.
I like that they fit me well and are comfortable
I ordered a size 11 which is normally perfect for my size 10 feet. However these were a little tight around the toes.
Great trainer. Had to return and get half size up as tight. But now are perfect
My other half loves them
Bought as part of my daughters birthday she loves them

reviews.review_content: Good quality for the money . Size as expected arrived fast

The sizing is very strange - the size I usually get is much smaller than any other pair of underwear I've had and the size above is hilariously too large. I ended up getting the pack that was too large.They are very poor quality and it is extremely easy to tear holes in them. I don't have a single pair of them anymore because they're such poor quality and all have holes in, some from wearing (max 10 times) and some from washing! Would not buy ever again and would strongly recommend everyone to avoid.
reviews.review_title: Sizing and quality is poor - AVOID

reviews.review_content: It is not rocket science and it isn't useful to customers. Ultimately customers spend time researching the product they wish to buy, sometimes briefly but sometimes for hours or days and then they spend the money they have earnt to get the item.It simply wastes everyones time if you constantly have to send things back to get different sizes. The website gives a size guide but numerous reviews say the company sizes too small.To this end I deliberately ordered two sizes too big and they still were not even close to being wearable. How very frustrating. I get that some nations have different demographics and therefore a company based in Thailand or Sri Lanka may sell predominantly more smaller sizes than a company based in North America however that does not change how many inches are in a foot or centimetres there are in a metre. If your size guide says should fit a size of waste 42inches then that's what it should fit.Large does not necessarily mean overweight we have entire rugby teams to demonstrate that so if you make something you brand as “for athletes”and they cannot get a leg through one of the holes then you are likely doing something wrong!The product looked great and I was excited to receive it and then it came and I basically wished I hadn't wasted my time and sent it back for refund as I already had the largest size that you had available and my children would have struggled to get into them.  I suggest you review your reviews and adjust to your market if you wish to sell more units.
reviews.review_title: Waaaay way too small for the advertised size.

reviews.review_content: I have ordered danish endurance boxers before which have all been great and a nice fit. But this box set wasn’t the best:Grey boxer trunks have hole in centre stitching.Black boxer trunks are a completely different size compared to the blue and grey trunks.Black boxer trunks seemed to have been cut shorter at the back compared to the front which meant they kept falling down every time you moved around. They were also really tight compared to the blue and grey trunks.Never had any problems before with this underwear brand. Hopefully it’s a one off and a bad batch.
i ordered a “large” size which is what i normally wear as i’m a 34” waist in trousers etc, but the large size is way too small for me … and i can’t return them.

I ordered these in large as the measurements in the description were spot on and agreed with other items I had bought. Tried on a pair and found them a bit to snug for my liking and not something I could wear during a working day. The material also felt rough against the skin. Tried on a 2nd pair and the same un-comfortPoor quality.......don't waste your money as the item can't be returned
reviews.review_title: NOT FOR ME - Don't waste your money,

reviews.review_content: Must have got a bad batch here because these are junk for my junk. Some stitching adrift and holes in them before I’ve even worn them. Could someone involved in the business get in touch please
reviews.review_title: Not great stitching failed on two pairs

reviews.review_content: Only lasted a year and 2 months, Holes in the bottom of them,Danish endurance didn't last very long
These did not last at all, every pair has holes in the same spot along the stitching. I would not recommend these.

I couldn't believe I'd spent so long in such a dilemma about buying some new shorts, but there I was. Comparing the M&S quality deterioration over the years, to the potentially fake Calvin Kline ones I've somehow been able to wear for close to 20 years, the variables were driving me mad. So I took a punt on these. They're awful. The fit is a little bit weird, but that might just be me. The rips that started to appear only a couple of months in were another thing, and today, they've pretty much died, all of them. Rips at the elastic and gigantic holes appearing at the crotch have killed them all now. Currently trialling some sock shop bamboo pants, will see how that goes.
reviews.review_title: Ripped at the elastic, ripped at the crotch and generally, leave you feel ripped off

reviews.review_content: Terrible. Tiny, thin and in no way anything  Denmark would be proud of

I orginally bought these in Nov 2022, I found them great and comfortable, but took a while to get used to. I ordered the same product in March 2024, and I found them to be an inferior quality and not fitting as well, the writing on the waistband is narrower (Black Truncks)I bought white ones at the same time, and they still have the thicker writing on them and they fitted as good as the orginal
reviews.review_title: The newer ones are a poorer quality

reviews.review_content: I normally wear CK and Hugo Boss boxer shorts and thought I would give Danish Endurance a try because I was impressed with some of their other products. The material seems to good quality but the sizing is very unusual. I am 32 waist medium/ athletic build and these are very tight around the thigh and not long enough to sit comfortably on my lower back either. Overall disappointed and would not recommend.

I had big hopes for these having been previously really impressed by the cycling socks. But the entire pack are in the bin only a few weeks after purchase due to holes everywhere. They also lost their elasticity after a couple of washes on 30. I have supermarket underpants from 2020 which are still going strong in my drawer. So really, the quality of these are just awful awful awful. Do not buy!
reviews.review_title: Good first impressions but awful durability

reviews.review_content: These pacifists men’s pants just came undone at the seams

Soft and comfortable, but not durable. Endurance in the name is misguided in my opinion. i have thrown out  5 of the 8 pairs i have bought over the last 18 months or so, because they have holes in the gusset.

These boxers were very determined to expose my generous booty, despite buying the correct size. They also developed holes after a couple of months, and I struggled to find a way to contact their customer service to claim under the one year anti hole guarantee. Thankfully, Amazon resolved the problem with a refund.
Small holes can be found on the stitchings not only that the thread in the seams frays away going to avoid this in future
Wrongly advertised as 4XL when 3XL arrived, not eligible for an exchange!!Nice feel and soft material though.

Okay, so I've bought some of these, but other boxers in the range before.  In both cases, I sized up.  The others were in the region of £8 each (3 pack multipack) whereas these are just over over £5 each.  Personally, I think boxers from the 3 pack are of marginally better quality.  Whilst the 2 pairs in each colour are more or less the same in size, the 6 pairs do vary in size.  This not withstanding, they are very comfortable but and a BIG BUT, they are incredibly thin and see through!  I can see my skin through them once on.  I've been borrowing my other half's boxers every now and again because they're comfy and made of cotton - not the common synthetic rubbish which women are forced to contend with these days!  As a women, I wear these as comfy short shorts around the home but, yes, like many other comments, I can't see them lasting long.  I continue to be astounded by the sub-standard products which the consumer is expected to accept and pay decent money for but that's what we get in today's consumerist society!
Nice fabric. However a bit snug, especially with your junk and if you’ve thick thighs.Would I buy again? Probably not. Unfortunately I can’t return them

Having purchased Danish Endurance for a few years now and never reviewed before, thought now was a good time.They wash and tumble dry well and hold up well with fit and stretch.The price has slowly crept up over time, they are now priced liked designer brands, even when waiting for them to be on offer.The size remained constant except the last few buys they feel tighter slightly smaller, almost as if need the bigger size.They always eventually fail with holes appearing on the crotch.Going to try some other brands on Amazon now as price starting to make these too expensive

I bought a 6 pack of these boxers in Feb 23. 10 months later, 3 of the 6 have holes in the same place, as per the attached photo. All the holes are the lighter coloured boxers.I work from home and only wear these boxers for normal daily business, not for running or MTBing etc. They are incredibly comfy and I was impressed with them when I tried them on. They are the most money I have spent on boxers ever, and I am slightly disappointed with their longevity. I have old Next boxers at 6+ years old still going strong, no holes!Would I buy them again? I don't think so. If I had been using them for sport etc, then I might expect them to wear faster, but sporadic daily use (I rotate boxers) means these have not lasted as long as I would have liked for the money!If the dark ones are made differently, then they might be more robust. I don't know if that's the case but my light coloured ones are now sports boxers, but with extra cooling! :-(

I don't know if you are familiar with 'builders' bum', but when you bend over you might expose more than you thought with these! Low slung underwear may be fashionable (is it?) but is not particularly comfortable for me. Otherwise a perfectly fine product but I prefer underwear that stays put, a bit higher on the waist.
I reordered the same item , the cut does seem a comfortable as I remember, perhaps I’ve been unlucky
The material is good but it has developed holes after wearing it for a few and washed it twice.
Lovely soft & supportive material but don’t go for medium if your a 34” waist. Snug!Would definitely buy again but a bigger size, not returnable so get it right first time otherwise it’s £30 wasted..
I bought the size Amazon recommended, based on my other purchases. They're too small. Fine around the waist, but too tight where it matters. Also they sit low on my hips.

I was in the market for some new boxers.  My favourites were unavailable at the time, so I had to resort to looking around for an alternative.  These popped up and seemed really good. Looked the part, slightly smaller in height (not a problem, I am a short dude) so took the plunge.When they arrived I tried a pair.  I'd been aware that they had to size up - I usually buy L/XL for most things, so I'd ordered XXL.  Perfect fit.  They were the right height for my 5'7" body, even with my slightly chubby belly.  Great.  10/10 for comfort and fit.The only downside so far?  They weren't particularly obvious which side was the front - being ALL BLUE and stitched very similarly front and rear...  But they worked.  Comfortable and snug.A week later, one pair had started separating at the seam on the waist elastic.  A couple of weeks later, two more pairs had started to do the same.  A handful of pairs had already started to split/separate in the base of the crotch area.Now, months later, only ONE pair out of the six are actually whole.  The rest have been discarded into recycling.  My usual favourites (Under Armour Cotton Charged) are much better.  Of the three I ordered in 2020, 2 pairs are still going (just).  Out of the 6 pairs of these I ordered in 2021, 1 pair is barely hanging on.So the conclusion:  Fantastic comfort, would buy again in a heartbeat if it weren't for the fact these are really poor with quality control.  Stitching and fabric wear is a big problem with these.  So it's a middling review, because of the hugely polarised pro and con to them.Caveat: I walk for my job - doing a large amount of miles per week, plus riding a motorbike, so my wear-through rate is probably a lot higher.  That said, the Under Armour's success at not falling apart at the sight of my working day wins over these Danish "Endurance"... which they don't.  Endure that is.
reviews.review_title: Super comfortable, but appalling quality issues - scratch the "Endurance" from the brand.

reviews.review_content: Overall, I was disappointed with the DANISH ENDURANCE Men's Cotton Boxer Shorts. Despite being made of a soft, breathable cotton material, I found them to be quite uncomfortable to wear. The material was also surprisingly easy to tear, which was a major concern for me.In terms of sizing, I ordered the correct size based on the measurements provided on the website, but I found that the boxers did not fit me well. They seemed too tight around the waist, legs and crotch area, which made them even more uncomfortable to wear.I did reach out to customer support for assistance and they were very helpful, sending out a larger size for me to try. Unfortunately, even with the larger size, I had the same issues with fit and comfort.Overall, I would not recommend the DANISH ENDURANCE Men's Cotton Boxer Shorts to others. While they may be made of a soft, breathable cotton material, they were quite uncomfortable to wear and did not fit well. The company's customer service was helpful, but ultimately I wasn't satisfied with the product.

I usually take an X-Large, I’ve purchased non cotton sports pants from Danish and the XXL fit best, so continued to go one size up, I’m thinking maybe I should have gone two sizes up - tight but they’ll do
Well made, comfortable fit.Good price.
These Danish Endurance underwear are probably the most comfortable I have owned. They are well designed and well made.
Very comfortable and soft , only gave 4 stars as the black pairs are slightly smaller for some reason .

I can confirm that Danish Endurance boxers are quality products. However I had previously ordered a large in their Bamboo range which gives you some extra stretch. With the Cotton version and not having the benefit of the stretch they are either exact or slightly too small for me in a Large. Yes I know probably a me problem. I would have to order an extra large to feel as comfortable with this cotton range as I do about the bamboo range. Finally if you order a size and they don't fit, unless there is a fault with the items then they are not eligible for returns. So don't order multiple sizes in the hope you can confirm your size and return the others or unless you know for certain your size.
reviews.review_title: Decent boxer but order appropriate size

reviews.review_content: Pretty comfortable underwear for men. It's never easy choose the right size with the product of this brand, the fitting is fine but can be improved.
Okay but a next size up my fit better. Well made bought for gift.

Have been buying this product for a while now. Fit and look excellent, however have noticed the cotton and therefore softness content has lessened, enough that I am considering changing to a different brand in the future...a real shame because I love these but the (assume) increased man made material is not very comfortable
I am sure they will fit my son perfectly, it's a Xmas present
Very comfortable and good fit
Part of Christmas gift.
Very comfortable
Great quality,  good sizing,  doesn't go out of shape when washed
Hoping these will endure as per their name.  Nice colours a little expensive but hey hoping they will last longer.
unpacked and wore at once and the fit is goodworth the price for the pack
These are very good quality for the money, I’ve purchase 3 times now
Hubby says better than any undies  he’s bought before.100% better than supermarket brands .
My husband said they are comfortable and good value. Recommended.
These garments fulfill all the requirements for comfort and warmth during the winter months and I am sorry it took me so long to find them.
Great design and value

reviews.review_content: I thought this will be good for my food but not the shoes are very hard not comfortable to work with them a long distance or be with them at work hole night I’m so so disappointed in the price but to get this , wearing this shoes is as good as wearing a rock. Having swelling feet every day is not nice!
reviews.review_title: Hard material not good for the feet.

reviews.review_content: I was going to buy birkenstocks but I though I'll save a few quid and buy crocs what a mistake the comfort was brilliant the fit the weight all amazing but I have just come home after a 12 hour shift in the kitchen and I took them off and heaved from the smell of my feet woooooow it resembles when I got my plaster cast off my arm after 8 weeks when I broke it but in just 12 hours!! I don't get smelly feet never have even as a teen but now my feet are soggy rancid and white! I think if I wore these for a week I'd get trench foot 🤔 i have now cut the vent holes out to let a bit of air get in just so they last me until payday so I can go back birkenstocks what a waste of money I'm gutted....
Ok in summer but soles came off when wet in winter
what i dislike is. one leg is bigger than the other but same size. i placed a return so that i can have my size, Amazon ignore collection and i can not use the shoe as its too large for my size.
reviews.review_title: Shoe procduct or quality not  expected

reviews.review_content: Ordered a ladies size 5 more like a 4. Definitely small made.

I ordered these because they were the Pro version. Those have an adjustable heel strap and a more comfortable Orange insole. I waited weeks for them to come from Europe to the UK.What arrived was bog standard Bitro Clogs at a much higher cost. They were also massive - one size above that ordered. If they say size 10 on the soles, that's what they are in the UK too! They are a roomy fit...Nothing good to say really. They are not as advertised on the current listing took ages to arrive and are not what I wanted...
reviews.review_title: Very Disappointed- Not Bistro Pro at the moment

reviews.review_content: This item was shocking looks like one of the shoes had melted different sizes unwearable shocking
I wear size 6, bought a size 7 and still fits small. There are no holes on the shoe, so no way for the foot to breathe. After wearing them for a while your feet sweat and really smell
Previously were good quality made in Bosnia but now made in Vietnam, shoe size inconsistent. Poor fit, one show smaller than the other, sole peels and dangerous, became a trip hazard.
reviews.review_title: Previously were good quality made in Bosnia but now made in Vietnam, shoe size inconsistent.

reviews.review_content: Ordered for work as I have a club foot,it literally caused sores on my foot
I bought them because someone recommended them for my wide feet. Unfortunately they were not big enough at the arch for me to get my foot in comfortably, despite having spare room at the toe and heel

I have had these crocs for just over 2 years now. I have not walked in them long distances. I only used them to walk around my garden for a few minutes each day. Now the sole has become detached on one of the shoes. This should not happen after just 2 years. This kind of shoe should last many many years with light use like mine. I am disappointed. The other shoe is still good. This can only mean that one of the shoes was faulty to start with.
Had to return it. Hard and uncomfortable to wear. Smaller than expected. Returning it was easy at least.
I have not been able to wear them as they are too small.I can not get my foot into the shoes.Thanks

Was too wide and way too long. Purchased size 11-12 for son for work, who is normally size 11. There was an inch to spare at the back and around an inch all the way around top of shoe. Way too wide. Shame the size guide is over 2 sizes.

I bought these mainly due to the fact that my feet sweat a lot at work ( in a kitchen ) and I got the impression through the reviews that they were verry cooling shoes. They are not I have worn them for 2 weeks now and have thrown them in to my spares pile. They are comfortable for the first 3-4 hours but after that my feet get verry hot and it is quite discomforting. Besides from this to any who still wish to buy get a size smaller than you are I'm a 9 but had to get them changed for an 8
I had to return the size 10 male clog as it was much larger than my husband's previous pair of size 10 crocs.  A disappointing birthday gift.

These are for work, just got them so I will see. I got a size 6 to be on the safe side and they are big.Again the delivery  on my orders said the parcel  was handed to me, not true they had gone before I'd answered the door.Will review  after a week of wearing.
Comfy but feet get to hot in warm weather!! Strap failed after a week, so I wouldn't buy again.

Bought these for my OT practice placement but far too big. Sizing guide is way out. I’m a uk 9 and have very wide feet but they fit like boats! I’m sure they’d be fine if they were the right size but the guiding was incorrect
foot wouldn't go fully into the shoe without cutting off blood supply because the top opening was so tight. Shame because the inside felt comfy and the toe box was nice and wide.

I was looking for a comfortable shoes post foot surgery. I find crocs comfortable BUT this one is not. I like there's no holes to protect my feet but it is quite tight when you put it on. It rubs on my upper feet and not wide enough. Mind you, I have a wide feet (not very wide as I'm only 5ft) but still, it was a disappointment that this model of crocs (Bistro Clogs) is tight and heavy on my feet to walk. I have returned it.
reviews.review_title: Not very lightweight, Tight on my feet, Return it.

reviews.review_content: I ordered these for work but were too small.Order the next size up at least and not your shoe size
As per title
reviews.review_title: Suitable for work, long term comfort or support not good

reviews.review_content: Need them for work, but not sure if that style feels comfortable, nothing wrong with the product, just not sure their for me prefer lace ups, might invest in a pair of birkinstocks.
unfortunately did not fit, refund has been considerably delayed despite promptly posting return via royal mail
reviews.review_title: didn't fit , lower instep to my other crocs..

reviews.review_content: They are not as comfortable as the standard Crocs are but that is expected in exchange for added protection, my issue with them is that the soles are designed in a way that everything sticks into them and are very difficult to clean, this is not ideal in a professional kitchen environment as you keep leaving a trail of squished food mixed with blue roll and pretty much anything you could think of

I'm in two minds here, if you're just using them as lifelong slippers (like me) buy a size smaller as although they don't fall off they just feel a bit wrong - comfy though!I suppose with thick socks to work in a kitchen they will be great!

Edited 6 Dec, 2022:  I contacted Amazon, and got a refund,  no bother.  So that's 5 stars to Amazon, (and 5 stars to the product) but only 3 stars to the seller.I ordered these as a present for my husband who already has a pair that is wearing out a bit.  I ordered his size (UK Men's 10.)  When they arrived, the stuck-on label on the bag said: m/10, w11 ...but the size on the bottom of the shoe is M-11.Confusing?  Not half.  And now I either have to go through the hassle of attempting to return them, or just give them to a charity shop.Beware ...you'll be playing roulette with the sizes here, although if you strike it lucky, the product and the price is excellent.
reviews.review_title: Product is excellent, sizing is misleading

reviews.review_content: Size of shoe was perfect in length but I found these to be very tight fitting and they would definitely rub the tops of my feet if worn which would not be convenient on long shifts in the kitchen. Had to return them. Maybe the material needs expanding in some way and they'd be fine but I needed them urgently so this wasn't convenient.
reviews.review_title: Size of shoe is true but very tight fitting.

reviews.review_content: Good solid Crocs. Thought I’d buy some without side vents, as for some reason, they tend to split. This pair however is very wide in the foot. Maybe it’s because it’s meant to be a work shoe. More stibbles on the inside sole. Quite good but not my favourite pair.

nothing wrong with the product, however the sizing chart deviates drom common practice, so i eeneded up two times refeiving a size too large. i have a EU45 which usually corresponds to a UK11 in store. unfortunately a UK11 for this article fits a size EU46-47 which i didnt notice. i had to return the article twice. shoes are good but check their sizing chart.
I am a 37.5 feet and i carefully measured my feet length and read the sizing guide before I ordered. It fit me perfectly with socks on. I will be wearing it to work
Good I used for work

Working as a chef I wanted a pair of crocs as I love the originals and seen these. Nowhere near the comfort of the originals. They seem to rub the top of my toes which was uncomfortable for the first few weeks but now my feet has adjusted to them they are quite comfortable. Anti slip soles are a great job and I recently spilled boiling water on my feet and these kept my feet fully protected. If you're on your feet all day they are definitely better than trainers etc but I notice how much more comfortable the originals are when I put them on. However the protection in the bistros are excellent
The size guide is out when you order - uk mens 5/women’s 6 is actually a women’s size 5!!! So my crocs are a bit on the small size rather annoying. I should have sent them back !!!!
Good product
Comfortable and sturdy good grip on the sole
Just too wide

Have bought crocs since the day they first came into being.  This time they are slightly on the large size.  I found it difficult to order the same size as we had had before because the sizing combinations seem to have changed.  Having said that though,  we will keep them because we find them so useful and comfortable.
The best crocs for kitchen workers.So comfortable. Non slip and easy to clean.Would definitely recommend and buy again.True to size.
Super comfortable, the work style so high heel lip and no holes for fluid risk. And infinitely cleanable. Extremely happy, perfect ward shoe.
These are great easy to wear light and comfy.
True to size and good fit. Very comfortable for work.
They looks like on the picture. They are anti slippery which is nice. Perfect for hospitality and very comfortable.
Good quality and very comfortable
Love it
Came up a bit small needed to size up one size
I use these for work in a kitchen. They're super comfortable and doesn't make my feet achy.
too small

reviews.review_content: The photos are the results after one wear and wash! Stitching is shocking material is cheap. Emailed them before putting this review and no reply. Stick to brands like gain the edge, I know there a lot more than these but pay cheap pay twice.
reviews.review_title: Absolute rubbish, stick to good brands.

reviews.review_content: I've bought a few pairs of these in black, yellow and then a red pair.Unfortunately as soon as my boy put the red socks on they laddered and we're ruined. He'd not even worn them to play.No issues with the other sets though.
As soon as my kid went to pull them on, one of them frayed/laddered the whole way up.
reviews.review_title: Ripped as soon as they went on

reviews.review_content: terrible quality like so poor

I read some negative reviews about this product but gave it the benefit of doubt as we were in urgent need of these socks to go with my sons grip socks before training. They arrived and he attempted to put them on, but they literally began to unravel in his hands. Needless to say they have been unworn and refund requested. Don’t be like me, take notice of all the other reviews and don’t waste your time
Material quite thin and had catches on it

The sock threads after one wash and completely unravels itself. To add to this. There is no way to contact the sellers for a chance to either refund or have some new ones sent out.On the photo above you can see the amount of shed that the sock has had in comparison to a new unused sock.

I bought a black pair and during the 2nd or 3rd wash, one of the socks virtually disintegrated in the wash. A thread came out and unravelled and wrapped around all my other washing. The sock was unwearable. I then ordered a replacement pair and exactly the same thing happened.
reviews.review_title: Do not buy - very poor quality

reviews.review_content: Absolutely terribly made. The moment I put these on they frayed at the bottom and they haven't stopped ever since. I cut the excess material off hoping i could find away to make it  stop but it has continued and after just one use I've had to throw them in the bin. Absolutely shocked by how poor these really are
these where wate off money both kids had them one wash they fell apart
Took it out of the package and it had a thread coming out of it so I pulled it and the whole sock ripped in half, other sock is still in-tacked but I’m missing a sock now

The seam started to started to come undone from the moment I unpackaged the product. I threw them in the wash and the threads wrapped around my clothes (it was a nightmare). I may have received a bad batch. However, from my anecdotal experience I would not buy from this brand again.
After wearing & washing just once, one of the sock sleeves has completely fallen apart. Fraying from one end all the way up to the logo. Very disappointed!
Had to return after one wear as the stitching on the cuffs started to unravel
My Son had these for his birthday. They looked fab at 1st, but after 1 wash they frayed badly. Very disappointed
Nice looking but started to fray at the bottom after about only 2 wears. Good long socks, warm and stay up well.
Poor Quality, started to fray after being worn twice
My son liked the sock sleeve very much ordered two pairs in black. Ordered a red pair but package was open and a big hole in front of socks un usable. Quite disappointed as black ones were fab
One of them started to fray unfortunately, otherwise good and comfortable just not the best quality.. stitching could be better
I purchased 2 pairs and the 1st pair are perfect this is the 2nd pair and frayed as soon as he put them on. Sent them back for a refund and will order some more, hopefully a bad batch.
Great fit and quality

Bought these for my son who was desperate for them. Not quiet sure they're worth the money as it would be cheaper to buy normal socks and cut the feet off. However he is extremely happy with them so what do I know
Bought the sock sleeve for my son. They are a  near colour to his team colours. They are a nice fit. The only bad thing I would say is they are a bit thin and the click very easy.
They look good
Love these - good for any sporting person needing shin pad supper.Well made, well presented, great packaging, great quality and value - highly recommended by us.
Good quality, true to size.Did the job.

Pros:- Good value for money (£6.99 at the time of review)- Allows you to wear the socks you want to ensure good fit and have these over your shins to match the colour of your kit/hold shin pads in place- Don't require sock tape due to elasticity of socks- Can be used as another layer on top/under normal football socks for warmth- Plenty of colours to choose fromCons:- Would have preferred it without the brandingI hope you find this review helpful.

These are literally socks without the foot bit, fit's like a football sock, but stretchy and comfortable enough to not feel like you are cutting off blood circulation. Length is good and should cover most shin areas. Also it doesn't run up and down, or scrunch while wearing much, so sock tape is not essential for this item.

Got these for my son who plays for the u11 team.  Intention is to wear these as a base layer then shin pads then socks - this way it’ll provide extra warmth during the winter months and also make wearing the shinpads more comfortable and reduce rubbing.Son loves them.  So much that he wore them in bed.  They therefore pass the comfy test.Will try them this weekend if cold enough.
My son likes them but he’s used them once and the elastic is coming out already which is a shame

I bought the socks sleeve for my 14 years old that plays football 5 days per week for an academy.I must say that it is perfect, long enough and a great support to hold the shin pad during a powerful and fast football match.  The feedback from my son was great and I even ordered a second one.Thank you
These items were purchased for my Grandson's birthday who is a Goalkeeper for Portsmouth Youth Team
Perfect for my son. Great colours
Very comfortable he wore them today at a match and he was delighted with them
Birthday gift
My son used the Gain the Edge brand and they're fab. I got these ones as a Xmas present for someone else - just as good!! Will be purchasing my sons other kit colours from here instead now:)
great fit. feels very comfortable
Quality and fit
Bought for my son. Excellent.  Will definitely buy again. Delivery was very quick.
Savage quality

Upon opening the box and getting the tie out from the plastic packaging, I was quite impressed with the lovely vibrant red colour. It was called burgundy, but had a very good sheen to it and looked great.The material on touch wasn't amazing, but it was decent enough.Putting on the tie though, I wasn't quite impressed, unfortunately, as I started to notice a few quality problems, and on close inspection, there were a number of flaws.First of all, the stitching of the tie at the back is quite poor. It's loose, feels flimsy and just not done very well. The problem with this is that it can easily allow things to get hooked on and damage the stitching.Another issue is the little loop for the thinner part of the tie to slide in to keep it tidy suffers the same issue, but the loop itself has a lot of material flaring out and a lot of loose threads. Again, just not very good in quality.£5.99 for a tie is pretty good, and this being in a colour I really like, I honestly wanted to praise it, but unfortunately the quality is subpar and not quite up to the standard I expected. If it is damaged easily due to the poor stitching, I would rather spend a little more money on a better quality tie so that it will last longer.

reviews.review_content: I can't believe that Havaianas are not finally changing their sizing system, as everybody around the world seems to be complaining about it! Now I see why! I looked into the size chart which said that size UK 5 will be my usual EU 39 so ordered them but they are tiny, and would fit at most a 37-38. This is super confusing as this is shown as the brazilian sizing, and next to it it says this equals to EU 39-40. So I see you should either look at the brazilian size as your EU size, or just assume that the brazilian sizing runs 2 sizes small. So I had to reorder a larger size which equals to a EU 41/42, which more or less fits, but slightly large... I would much more prefer if they did individual sizing as only having a choice of 2 sizes up or down is quite ridiculous, especially for such a large company like Havaianas, they should feel embarrassed. I really hope they will do something with the sizing as I love that they make non toxic flip flops from natural rubber that actually look good in comparison to other natural brands which are super ugly.Also another negative point..... those "bobs" at the bottom of the sole are so badly cut out that they hardly fit into it and I tried to force it and it still kind of sticks out... (see photo)For this price of a flip flop I would really expect quality!

reviews.review_content: Very disappointed as I bought these out of my birthday money and I bought a size up from what I am, whet to try them on and couldn't fit my foot past the strap. I am a size 6 but bought size 7, I really liked them as well. I only bought them online as I can't get out of the house for medical reasons and they was to wear in the summer around the house.
I have had many pairs of these in the past, they seem to have changed them now as my size is tight and the material seems a lot harder.  Nowhere near as comfortable as they used to be.  Sad days.

Totally pointless. Ordered a size 10. Couldn’t get on feet.  Couldn’t be bothered to send them back so gave them to wife. She’s a size 7 and too small for her feet.  Assumed I’d ordered wrong size but I hadn’t. Waste of cash

reviews.review_content: Flip flops and sliders are my absolute go to form of footwear, and I have bought hundreds of them over the years so sizing up has never been an issue. However these particular slide are the high end of poor sizing and quality. I am a size 10 UK male so I should buy a size 11 for comfort However due to previous issues I ordered a size12 just to make sure, but when I received them they fitted as though they were a size 9 the weren't of course, they sent the right size but they are just not manufactured to the sizes there supposed to be.

We bought them as I was going abroad, needed them for a short walk to the beach.The slippers seemed ok  but they cut my son's foot. We then swapped slippers as he was in pain and the slippers badly cut my right foot too.It has been 10 days and the wound is still healing. I couldn't even wear my favourite shoes today. Do not buy them.
I am a 10.5 or 11 and 11 was way too small. Changed for a 12 (the first 12 I have ever bought) and still way too small. Gave up, returned.

Brought a man’s size 7 for my nephew for Xmas …sizing completely rubbish! Opened them Xmas day tried them on way way too small…I’m a size 4 I tried them on & fit perfect! Biggest problem is can’t send back now as over the return date so lost money & have to go else where to buy some

The reviews said to take heed of sizing issues and I did, having ordered one size above my normal sizing. Upon receipt of the goods, they were still vastly too small around where the band goes over the arch. I was unable to even place my foot inside. Ordering an even larger size is pointless as the sole would then be grossly too big. Waste of time.
Does not fit, far too small for a size 5 slider.  Waste of money.
Marked up wrong size and quality poor
I'm a size 10, I bought a size 11, I feel like I'm wearing my son's shoes. Adidas are selling these on name alone, they're not comfy and they don't fit well.

Feeling very annoyed, the sizing on these is incorrect. I was being organised and buying early for Christmas and now it’s too late to return. I bought 2 pairs :( on the label the US and UK sizes are the same - this is impossible. I would say the sizes advertised are US so buy 2 sizes up!!

Wasn't really happy with this product due the size was small

Goof job bought for partner as narrow fitting

Adidas slider sandals: "Adilette Aqua" FY8047; SIZE 9UK &US; FR 43; JP 275; CHN 265. Made in Vietnam. New, original, in sealed bag with QR & BAR CODES factory stickers, & ADIDAS Hanger. Sold & delivered by Amazon UK, at a welcome discount. The Mrs & I have had items, such as clothes, (and even a 2016 MICROSOFT 640XL, which still works well for calls & SMS, and calculations) made in Vietnam; and found their quality control high. * A light blue, with white stripes across the instep, which, I realised would suit a neighbour, as they match his Fiat 500 - so I really should show them to him! There is enclosed a long list, on a small card, of 21 activities, which the sandals are suitable for - including walking, cycling, golf, & swimming - but not for bobsleighing, before anyone asks! These are of a strong build quality, & a good fit across the instep; & leave a generous gap of around 3cm, front & rear, which I require as a buffer zone for my toes & heals (my normal size is UK 9.) CONCLUSION: Recommended on quality for the price. If, like myself, you can be a bit clumsy, with a long history of broken crockery and glasses; and I  never want to walk again into an abandoned wooden pallet - in flip flops, - I also recommend your choosing your usual shoe size, as a generous fit, or one size up! ❗ UPDATE: mid-July 2023. I have sunk into the sole of the sandals, as per the shape of my feet. I recently saw a young man  in a park in Nike sliders, who had sunk further into his, than I; likely, he paid a lot more for his! *In comparison, the chunky Mrs has not sunk into her genuine CROCS (See my Review.) They were on offer; and I ordered a pair of unattractive White ones, on price, and minus the badge, but they were waaaay too big, even with socks on. So, I recommend the CROCS, if on offer, and if you order one size up, which worked for her. If on a firm budget, seems only the company name is the difference with the competition. The Mrs is very pleased with her CROCS, so, then, I am not subject to her kicking them off in my direction!
reviews.review_title: High quality, good fit, & value - ADIDAS Quality!

reviews.review_content: I quite like these sliders, they are quite comfortable after break-in and the bottom is quite grippy on normal surfaces. No complains on this end.However the sizing is quite annoying - I am typically a size UK 11, and ordered accordingly but the pair that arrived did not fit me at all. After exchanging, the new pair (UK 12) still felt a bit tight, but over time it has "expanded" to fit my foot better. Not going to take stars off since the seller was willing to exchange, but it would be wise to order 1 or even 2 sizes bigger for a more comfortable fit,
reviews.review_title: Great pair of sliders, but sizing is weird

reviews.review_content: My ONLY gripe with these, they take a while to stretch to the side you wanted, my last pair ripped and so I bought the same size as they fitted perfectly,These when new are slightly tighter over the top of the foot.I'd suggest going up by half a size in these.(maybe even a whole size if you plan on wearing socks (but who does that - right!)Super comfy when they fit correctly - perfect summer "House/ Garden" attire!The foot contour is fantastic and really gives you good support!I Won't buy any other brand / make of Slider now!

The Adidas slippers I purchased on Amazon have been a delightful addition to my daily routine. Though a bit pricey, they prove to be worth every penny. The perfect fit for my size adds to the overall comfort. I find myself using them daily around the house or for quick local outings, and they've been a game-changer. What's particularly impressive is how they resist getting dirty easily, maintaining their sleek appearance. Despite the initial cost, the durability, comfort, and style make these Adidas slippers a valuable investment that I'm happy to have made.
fit, quality and style
Love these sliders bit uncomfortable at first but once your foot moulds into them they are mega comfy these are my 3rd pair
I bought these for my wife since I have a similar pair in black that have been with me for ages, always giving the best comfort and utility.
reviews.review_title: Great comfort and value for money

Bought these as a Christmas present for my boyfriend to replace his old ones. They fit him perfectly although appear a lot smaller than his old ones, though appearing quite narrow they still fit his wide feet. They are made of a strong and high quality material which will hopefully last the same time or longer than his old pair which were also Adidas brand and pretty sure he had them for 8+ years. These are definitely great as easy to put on slides in the house and quick trips outside as well. They are fully rubber so also fully waterproof.
reviews.review_title: Good quality, durable sliders, perfect for indoor and outdoor use

reviews.review_content: The shoe was very easy to put on and comfortable, and the extra width noticeable (I have an annoying combination of very high arches and short and wide feet). I also use an orthotic insert so the removable insole was a plus. That’s the good stuff.Now for the bad.The size guide was confusing. the guide has a row for product size and another for UK size. I wanted a uk 8.5 so I followed the size guide and ordered 9. What I received was labelled UK 9! Ignore the guide! Even then the ‘size 9’ I received was enormous - way bigger - I’ve worn 9s before for the width, but this had over an inch of extra length. I’d say it seemed like a 10 at least.The shoe design, was a disappointment. the construction was very lightweight. It was not what I expected at all, more of a glorified slipper. Not a shoe I would wear outdoors. The sole was flat, with minimal grip, more like an espadrille or a slipper. up close it looked cheap.  For £60 I expected more than a plimsole.The price is way too much for a pair of shoes that I would only wear indoors. Luckily I ordered “try before you buy”. They’re going back.

Shoes were purchased for my father who has swollen feet due to diabetes, they were great until one shoe stopped fastening after 6 weeks, the velcro no longer sticks rendering the shoes unwearableVery disappointing considering the price point

reviews.review_content: Bought these twice, once in my size 11 they slipped off very easily. Then bought again in size 10.5, also slipped. It's the fastener, Two straps laterally across the foot. With heel inserts I manage for use in my garden. I bought the newer model with 1 single strap (double-winged) that attaches at the sides as well as with a pull up over the top of the foot. In a size 11 my TRUE size works great! I keep them pretty and only wear them when I go out. Sorry I don't remember the model but it's by the same seller shipped in from the States to Canada. If you need anything fast like 2-day in Canada you'll only find this 2-strap version in the warehouse. I waited about 2.5 weeks and got the replacement much sooner than expected. Good luck?!

Really wanted and needed to love these.  Ordered a size bigger than my fathers normal shoe size, and ordered the widest option available.  Sadly, this wasn’t enough to allow even the Velcro to reach together.  The width seems ok for him, but the “height” or whatever term there is for that… isn’t ok.  My father has blood flow issues and a few other problems that cause his feet and ankles to swell.  The top of his foot doesn’t allow the straps on these shoes to even go in the direction they are supposed to.  Given he has issues with his feet… I was hoping these would work for him due to the description.  He also stated how hard they felt when he stood up….So overall these left me still looking for some shoe that he can wear around comfortably.  However, they are built ok from what I can see… the Velcro seems strong… and the shoe itself looks like it could be a nice lightweight option for someone with feet that aren’t as “tall” or swollen as my dads.  We will keep them to use when he needs to walk to the bathroom etc… but I will be doing some cutting and a little redoing to make them work for us.

reviews.review_content: The heel has good lateral support, however; The shoe is too hot and the mesh exterior is misleading because the inside has a foam coating on the inside and the hole indents on the side panels are sealed also. One other design flaw is the velcro closure tabs do not match up with the shoe body hitting the top of the foot when closed or has a wrinkle on top when adjusted to stick.

When  you first get the shoes. the straps look like will close and support your foot.  BUT when you put your foot into the shoe and use  the Velcro straps to close the shoe the straps are WAY off.  I have a wide foot and high instep. The 1st strap is useless. It rides high on on the ankle and rubs the socks/skin it does not close on the shoe.  The second strap  actually closes where the 1st strap should close.  it may be fine for smaller feet but not if your foot is shaped as mine.

Looked smart and appeared to be well made. Came with three different pairs of insole for each foot so you can build the inner up to suit the size of your feet. Where they fell down was in the width across the arch of the foot. I'm wide and with additional dressings the front of the velcro strap wouldn't fit across the widest part of my feet and so were useless. Might be helpful if you only have to wear compression hosiery but not much use for anything else.
