Brauchte dringend weite Schuhe , weil mein einer Fuss momentan angeschwollen ist , ich sonst nur in Latschen passe . Rutsche hinten raus . Hab dann improvisiert und hinten Polstereinlagen reingemacht , gleich 2 übereinander geklebt . Nicht perfekt , aber besser .  Das ist statt Größe 40 wohl eher 41 . Normal hätte ich die Schuhe zurück gesendet , da ich aber dringend erstmal Schuhe brauchte , in denen ich rein komme , habe ich  sie nicht zurück gesendet  .  Wirklich schade , dass die Passform nicht der Norm entspricht .Auch wenn der Schuh recht wertig wirkt , rate ich vom Kauf ab oder  Sie bestellen zwei Größen zur Anprobe  .

This shoe is very comfortable to put on the velcro opening makes it very easy, it is a sturdy shoe that gives good ankle support however the sole of the shoe is hard and hardly has any give which makes it a but tiring on the feet after wearing them all day.

Die Schuhe haben 4 Sterne verdient -  der Händler jedoch nicht..., denn der hätte eigentlich NULL Sterne von mir bekommen! Deswegen habe ich hier einen Stern abgezogen. In der Produktbeschreibung fehlt die Information, dass die Ware eine ungewöhnlich lange Lieferzeit von mehr als 2 Wochen hat. Des Weiteren wird die Kreditkarte sofort belastet, die Rückerstattung ist (trotz unverzüglicher & "genehmigter" Retoure) jetzt aber bereits mehr als überfällig und nichts passiert!!! Die Schuhe machen optisch einen guten Eindruck, der Geruch schien mir etwas chemisch, aber nicht allzu penetrant. Die Verarbeitung der Schuhe war gut, was man bei dem Preis aber auch erwartet. Die Passform ist großzügig ausgelegt und trotz der Weite sieht der Schuh nicht klobig aus. Schade, leider passte der Schuh nicht, er ist wohl eher für sehr stark geschwollene Füße geeignet. Das Fußbett ist sehr bequem, der Schuh ist jedoch insgesamt deutlich weiter als vermutet und sitzt trotz geschwollener Füße sehr locker und schluppt. Sicherlich genau das richtige Modell, wenn man z.B. eine Fuß OP hatte und einen dicken Verband tragen muss - er bietet wirklich sehr viel Platz, auch über den hohen Spann. Absolut bequem verarbeitet und somit für richtig dick angeschwollene Füße bestimmt bestens geeignet. Bin gespannt ob ich mein Geld irgendwann doch noch erstattet bekomme oder nicht. Allein aus diesem Grund werde ich zukünftig genauer hinschauen, WER der Verkäufer ist (und sich in diesem Fall über die vermeintlich seriöse Amazon Plattform ein Gewand verschafft hat das nicht hält was es verspricht).NACHTRAG: Nach Kontaktaufnahme mit dem Amazon Support und einer Wartezeit von ca. 2 Wochen wurde der Betrag zurückerstattet. Danke für die Unterstützung!
reviews.review_title: moderate Qualität , wie bestellt in Gr. 40 geliefert - hat aber 2 Wochen gedauert

reviews.review_content: Whilst the delivery wasn’t quick, and the price is probably a bit too high, the shoes are easy to put on, very stable and are by far the best wide fit I have bought. I have very swollen feet and the tops of my feet are a problem when putting on most shoes. These shoes are dead easy to fasten up, and are comfortable to wear.I have to say that I would recommend these to anyone who has a similar problem.

A well made shoe easy to put on fits nicety on the feet. They are very comfortable to walk in. Easy to clean with a damp cloth. I found them an excellent buy. Very pleased with the product. Value for money recommend.

These are really good shoes for people with foot issues like myself. My only gripe is that I bought the wrong size, I could've done with going half a size smaller.I would buy another pair and will get them at least half a size smaller next time.
reviews.review_title: Really comfy shoes but get them at least half size smaller than your normal shoes

reviews.review_content: These shoes are highly comfortable and they definitely fit the bill. My feet sink into the best shoes that I have been able to wear. Would recommend to any man that has problem feet.
Design s good & shoes are easy to put on, but as yet I haven't found anything regarding waterproof.

Easy to put on , great if feet are swollen or if they swell during the day
reviews.review_title: Great if you suffer from swollen feet

reviews.review_content: What you need and what you get are not always the same thing.  The shoes should have plenty of room to accommodate my swollen feet, yet still feel cosy and comfortable.  I am capable of tying laces and pulling zips but my previous purchases have shown that these can be too tight when fitted and I was therefore looking for shoes with a velcro fitting which allow the wearer more flexibility with regards to tightness or looser fitting. Comfortable insoles would be nice as it makes standing and walking much more pleasurable. These shoes promised me all of my needs and when they arrived (a day earlier than promised) I couldn't wait to try them on.  I was not disappointed,  luxury and comfort as promised.  Stylish and practical in every way,  I am happy to recommend them as being exactly as described.
reviews.review_title: My specific needs were all met.

reviews.review_content: fit perfectly easy to get on
Good wide fit and easy to get on and off

I got these shoes some months after toe fusion surgery as my foot was still swollen and didn’t fit into my usual shoes. So far to date they have been very comfortable and suitable. I put an insert in the shoe for the other foot and used the Velcro opening to adjust for that foot not being swollen. I purchased the size I normally take and it’s comfy. Not sure what they would be like with a dressing as I wear them without one. Would recommend, even just for people with wide feet as the toe box area is wider.
Our local shoe shop said they sold the widest shoes available, but thankfully the Fitville shoes proved them wrong!
Because of my leg ulcers and swollen feet and ankles THESE shoes are ideal for me
help my feet being very wide feet especially around the toes and foot came all fine
Unfortunately my terrible feet did not fil these shoes. Return was easy!

No tenía pensado escribir ninguna reseña, pero han intentado comprar mi valoración 5 estrellas con un vale de Amazon por valor de 20€ y he cambiado de opinión.Las zapatillas se las ve bastante cutrecillas, por lo que valen tampoco se puede pedir mas, lo que no me ha gustado nada es que el dibujo de la suela atrapa cualquier cosa mínimamente pegajosa que se pise (barro, hojas húmedas, granos de arena, etc., y luego es muy complicado quitarlo, hay que esperar a que se vaya solo generalmente dentro de casa que es cuando se seca. Una pesadilla fuera de los meses de verano o de sitios donde no llueve casi nunca. Mi valoración son 2 extrellas menos una por el intento de soborno.

No hay que decir mucho más a parte de que son plástico puro. No se ajustan para nada a los pies y tras un par de días usandolas las he tenido que quitar porque me hacían demasiada rozaduras en los pies. No son cómodas, resbalan más que una pista de hielo si el suelo está mínimamente húmedo y no transpiran nada, a pesa de que en la imagen da una impresión contraría.Una lastima la verdad.
Shoe seemed comfortable at first, but inner materials are failing within 2 weeks of wear, regret getting it over a better quality branded shoe.Only buy on offer if you don’t walk much!

Non ho idea se il difetto si presenti solo a me, se sia colpa della conformazione del mio piede ma il piede mi scivola a fianco e la scarpa non lo tiene per cui mi ritrovo con parte del piede a fianco alla suola. Le scarpe, per il prezzo pagato sono pure belle, molto leggere e comode tanto che le ho tenute. Purtroppo posso usarle giusto per uscire per andare al bar o a fare la spesa, non certo per qualche camminata

Normalerweise verfasse ich keine Rezensionen - weder positiv, noch negativ. Vor dem Kauf dieses Schuhs allerdings, muss ich entschieden abraten. Auch nach tagelangem Lüften riechen die Schuhe immernoch nach nassem Hund mit einer Note Kot. Für gewöhnlich lächle ich nur mild, wenn sich Leute in den Rezensionen über "chemischen Geruch" verschiedener Artikel ärgern; ich bin da eigentlich eher unempfindlich. Aber ich hatte diese Schuhe 5 Minuten im Flur stehen und es war nicht zu ertragen; ich musste sie nach draußen stellen.Darüber hinaus ist die bestellte und ausgewiesene Größe 46 maximal eine 45, wahrscheinlich sogar kleiner.Nichtsdestoweniger gibt es einen zweiten Sterb, weil sie tatsächlich gut aussehen bzw. die Optik der Beschreibung entspricht.
reviews.review_title: Fürchterlicher Geruch, fällt ziemlich klein aus.

reviews.review_content: Für Hallensport (Reha-Sport) benötige ich bequeme Schuhe mit hellen Sohlen. Sie sind echt bequemn, günstig und in der Verarbeitung auch sauber, auch echt schön anzusehen.Jedoch der Chemiegeruch ist furchtbar. Ich habe die Schuhe bereits seit 4 Wochen und der Geruch ist nur minimal besser geworden. Wenn ich laufe in der Halle kommt jedesmal ein Schwall dieses Gestanks  nach oben zu mir - macht echt Kopfschmerzen.Da ich sie jetzt mehrfach getragen habe, muss ich sie behalten, aber wenn der Geruch die nächsten zwei Wochen (sie stehen auf dem Balkon) nicht weg ist, wandern sie in die Mülltonne.

Die Schuhe wurden super schnell geliefert, daher auch 2 Sterne.Gr 42 bestellt, fallen aber vieeeeel kleiner aus.Zusammengequetscht in einer Plastiktüte sodass der Hacken ein geknickt ist und es somit stört beim Tragen.Schuhe stinken extrem nach Chemie

Costano poco e valgono meno... potrebbero anche andare con solette interne migliori, ma la cosa peggiore purtroppo è la puzza dì petrolio che emanano, sembrano proprio tossiche.Non le consiglio mi spiace.😞
j'ai du les jeter, elles glissent sur les sols dans les magasins, aucune accroche sous la semelle. j'ai failli plusieurs fois tomber,du coup poubelle !
Bisogna partire dal prezzo che è molto vantaggioso, per il resto non le considero assolutamente scarpe da corsa, sono scarpe che possono andare bene per altri impieghi
Muss ganz ehrlich sagenDie Schuhe stinken ohne Ende nach ChemieUnd sie fallen kleiner aus als angegebenKaufe ich nicht mehr
Pas confortable du tout.

doch leider ist nach grade mal 3 Monaten am linken Schuh die Sohle hinten gebrochen, wie auf dem Foto zu sehen ist. Ich trage sie gerne, da sie bequem und schön leicht sind, jedoch bin ich von der Qualität enttäuscht.

Son cómodas pero la suela tiene mucho olor a plástico vas andado y sube el olor
La chaussure est agréable mais c'est une semelle rigide pas une gomme, du coup elle glisse énormément en extérieur ou en intérieur...
Basket pour le prix, mais les pointures ne correspondent pas taille petite.
In meno di un mese, calzandole max 30 suole suole si sono spaccate, non le consiglio.
Arrivate puntuali,arrivano in sacchetti trasparenti niente scatola, suole secondo me molto dure quando si cammina si fa molto rumore . leggere valgono il prezzo pagato niente più. Misura corretta.
Son económicas y no dan mal resultado
Suela de plástico duro. Al salir a correr por asfalto suena así "clac clac". Parece que bailes claqué mientras correr. Sólo las usé una vez porque no me han gustado.

reviews.review_content: Nachdem ich mehrere Wochen lang die Gelegenheit hatte, meine neuen Turnschuhe zu testen, freue ich mich, meine umfassende Bewertung mit Ihnen zu teilen.1. Erster Eindruck: Ein visuelles FestDas erste, was bei diesen Schuhen auffällt, ist ihr außergewöhnliches Aussehen. Die ästhetische Gestaltung ist modern und ansprechend, perfekt für alle, die Wert auf Stil legen. Die Farbkombinationen sind geschmackvoll gewählt und unterstreichen die dynamische Form des Schuhs. Es ist offensichtlich, dass viel Aufmerksamkeit auf das Design und die Gesamterscheinung dieser Schuhe gelegt wurde.2. Komfort: Wie auf Wolken laufenBeim ersten Hineinschlüpfen in die Schuhe war ich sofort beeindruckt von ihrem Komfort. Sie bieten eine perfekte Balance zwischen Festigkeit und Nachgiebigkeit, was sie ideal für lange Tragezeiten macht. Ob beim Gehen, Laufen oder Stehen, meine Füße fühlten sich durchgehend unterstützt und wohl an. Dies ist zweifellos auf die hochwertigen Materialien und die ergonomische Konstruktion des Schuhs zurückzuführen.3. Leistung und Dynamik: Für aktive LebensstileDiese Turnschuhe sind nicht nur bequem, sondern auch leistungsstark. Ihre Sohlen bieten ausgezeichneten Grip und Stabilität, was sie ideal für verschiedene Aktivitäten macht. Beim Laufen bieten sie eine hervorragende Bodenhaftung und Dämpfung, was das Risiko von Stößen und Verletzungen reduziert. Auch bei schnellen Richtungswechseln bieten sie hervorragenden Halt und Flexibilität.4. Langlebigkeit: Gebaut, um zu haltenNach mehrwöchigem intensivem Gebrauch zeigen die Schuhe keine signifikanten Abnutzungserscheinungen. Die Materialien und die Verarbeitung sind von hoher Qualität, was darauf hindeutet, dass diese Schuhe für eine lange Lebensdauer ausgelegt sind.Fazit: Ein ausgezeichneter KaufZusammenfassend sind diese Turnschuhe eine perfekte Wahl für alle, die sowohl Stil als auch Komfort schätzen. Sie sind ideal für einen aktiven Lebensstil und bieten eine beeindruckende Kombination aus Ästhetik, Komfort, Leistung und Langlebigkeit. Ich würde sie jedem empfehlen, der auf der Suche nach einem hochwertigen, vielseitigen und stilvollen Paar Turnschuhen ist.

reviews.review_content: I bought UK size 12 - 14. It was fairly obvious after unpacking that they were far too small. Despite stretching when I tried them on they were overnight and dug into my skin causing swelling. I had to take them off after a short time.  Very disappointed indeed.
reviews.review_title: Far too small and tight for quoted size

reviews.review_content: The ribbed part of the leg starts about two inches above the ankle and is EXTREMELY tight, so your ankles bulge while your calves are highly compressed. Seems terrible for circulation and is generally not a cute look. The feet on the size 3-5 are too long for a size 6, so the heels shift around and rub. The toe seams also don't "lay flat and comfortable" at all, so you can enjoy blisters all over your feet. It's rare to find a sock that's both too big and too small.In terms of fibre content, I'd be actually shocked if there was any cotton in these at all--they feel very rough and plasticky. Don't buy these.
Ordered size large they more like a small also there was only 3 pairs when it's meant to be 6
These socks have lots of positive reviews however I found that the stitching above the toe has come apart on every pair, some only worn once. Do not recommend.

Got some black after getting the coloured set which are great.  Black ones, fit is the same, support and variable tension however, worn for a day at work, not only did I have deep tide mark cut in from the elastic neck, I had red, sore, irritated skin on my calves and around the ankle, worse on the left than right but it was very uncomfortable for a few days till the irritation when down.  It looked more like a graze than a rash so obviously some kind of reaction to the material, colour dye or ???  I will give them all a wash before trying again, hopefully that will do it as I really like the style and fit.
poor quality
I have been purchasing these socks for 18 months, however last pack had a hole in the sole due to manufacturing defect before being worn..Amazon refunded me

If the product description was correct I'd have given 5 stars.These are good quality sport socks, slightly smaller than expected but still a very good, comfortable fit.I bought them because the product description said they are 85% cotton. It's really hard to find cotton/high percentage cotton socks these days.When I got them out of the package they didn't feel like 85% cotton so I wanted to check the labels and everything on the package to see. There is no description anywhere about what percentage of what materials did they use to make these socks. (not sure that's legal)Based on the feel of the socks I'd say they are between 45% to 75% cotton.If you don't mind what they are made of and looking for nice sport socks then no worries just buy them. But if you are looking for sport socks over 80% cotton you'll have to look elsewhere.
Not a great purchase at all.Every time I’ve tried to wear them, my blood circulation is cut. The size was good so that wasn’t the issue.Wouldn’t recommend.
The actual foot part was fine, but my ankle felt like blood flow was being cut off. I also have a latex allergy and these did make me itch
Very thin for “hiking socks”. Each pair had a hole in the big toe area after two wears. Pretty useless.
Misleading advertising on the quantity of item
reviews.review_title: On the header details it’s states ‘6 Pairs’ when it’s actually 3 pairs / 6 socks

reviews.review_content: Not great to be honest. Despite the look, these socks rotate around your foot far too easily. Probably OK if you have footwear on all day, but these spin around as soon as you take off your shoes/trainers.

I've ordered these several times in the past and found them comfortable, and they do last a few months before holes start to show.Only negative is that the socks are not consistent in size, nothing worse than one sock bigger than the other.I do not recommend buying this product due to the odd sizes.

I ordered the 12-14 size of this particular sock. I am generally a 13.5 in sports shoes and hiking boots.I was seduced by the good reviews, but the reality of the actual sock was different. The material is thin which may be fine for you, but this is not a walking sock. Getting a sock on was a real effort even with my slim ankles. They were very tight and I suspect totally unusable after a first wash. They were so poor that I actually returned them to Amazon (good return service on this item).I have given the socks two stars as I was probably naïve to think I could buy decent socks for this price.

I'm normally a size 11-11.5 and I generally order slightly larger as I have a large instep. With these socks I ordered 12-14 and to be honest they are exceptionally small (I did check the label which confirms 12-14). They are very thin and flatter to deceive and could not in any way be described as either a sports sock or a hiking sock. As another review puts it they are infact transparent in places and only have any sort of padding on the sole, not around the ankle where you need it with hiking boots. A most disappointing purchase.
reviews.review_title: To small, no way a hiking sock

reviews.review_content: I am diabetic so have to be very careful with my feet. I am UK size 9 so purchased the 9 - 11 size. I found them very tight and difficult to put on. I can't see anybody with size 11 feet even getting them on! Once on they really clamped tight everywhere especially around my calf. I only wore them for half an hour and had to remove them they are just so tight and really dug into my calf, restricting blood flow to my feet. In conclusion they look very good and nicely made and if my feet were size 6 or 7, they may have been okay. I will be gifting them to a relative with smaller feet than me.

I purchased these for my 13 year old son, who has size 5.5 feet and is very slim and athletic. His ankles and calves are very thin, but he found it virtually impossible to get them on!! They are VERY tight!!! Sadly he has worn two pairs, so I can’t return them, but they left marks round his ankles because they were soooo tight!! It’s good to have correct fitting socks, but these would stop your circulation if worn for a long period of time, I’m sure!! Either get a size or two up or don’t waste your money….
These are nice socks and have been warm to wear through the winter but have started to get holes in the heels after about 6 months.

These are nice socks. Not thick enough for long walks/hiking but okay for everyday use and dog walking etc.Unfortunately, one pair I had were faulty, made so thin you could see the skin underneath. Thought I would report it to the seller via Amazon so they could put it right and request a further pair as the others were all fine. Alas no response from the seller so disappointed.
reviews.review_title: Shame, let down by one pair and lack of response from seller

reviews.review_content: Nice quality socks but way too tight round the leg and top so they dug in my sons skin.

I bought the small size (3-5 I think) I’m a size 5… I was worried they will be too small being a 5 however they are too long for my feet so I wouldn’t bother buying if you are a 3/4. Hopefully they shrink a little in the wash as currently my feet are not on the heels, the heels have bunched higher up my foot.
reviews.review_title: Hoping they shrink in the wash…

reviews.review_content: Not a good sock to small
To tight for me like wearing elastic bands round my ankles ,but a nice looking sock well made ,gave them to my daughter she liked them she got really skinny ankles .

These socks are on the whole fine.They are a little tight around the calf area but otherwise the fit is good for me.The biggest issue for me is that they shed all over my carpets and I mean,all over!! All my family have had socks over the years that shed fibres but these are something else!!.I am hoping that after a few washes they stop.

These weren’t as good as I expected, the reviews implied they would be amazing but I’ve found that they aren’t very cushioned and are really tight around the ankles.I’m a size 9 (women’s) and bought men’s size 9-11 thinking they’d be really big as I wanted to pad out my new boots to stop them rubbing.They aren’t all bad, they are lovely and soft and very warm and it’s great value getting the 7 pairs.
I’m a size 10 so get the 9-11 but they’re a bit tight disappointing really as they are a comfy sock

These are good quality socks but as a size uk ladies 13 on bottom i have to say the top of the sock that goes around your ankle / calf is very tight indeed. I’m going Tom wear them and wash them and hopefully they will loosen up otherwise I won’t be able to wear them as they cut off the blood supply!
Holes appeared in the socks after the first wear/wash.Holes were in the centre of the sole part.It's a shame, as the first lot we bought were perfect which was why we bought more
I am a size 8 and these are just a tad too small, they also slip round some and makes them a little uncomfortable on the smaller toes. Other than that, they are fine.
Thick and warm. A bit tight though. Ordered size 12-14 and its difficult to get onto my size 12 feet. Pity anyone that wears size 14 and orders these.
reviews.review_title: Rather comfy and feels well made. Runs small.

reviews.review_content: Bought some for my son for school but I’ve now bought another set for myself because they’re so comfy and warm. Good value for money and I love the elasticity and grippy feel. They bobble a bit after several washes but that’s to be expected. Overall very satisfied.
The quality is alright, feel soft.
Very nice as black winter socks or even summer

name: Unisex's Smash V2 L Low-top Sneakers
description: Product details     Material composition     Textile       Care instructions     Machine Wash       Sole material     Rubber       Outer material     Leather      About this item   The Puma Smash v2 L for men and women is a new interpretation of the legendary Puma Smash Inspired by tennis, the sneaker impresses with an improved fit and soft leather upper   The skate shoe's rubber outsole ensures a pleasant comfort and durable grip The full lace closure of the football trainers offers a snug fit   The athletic footwear for women and men come in the typical Puma style Puma formstrip on the side, logos on the shoe tongue and the outside of the training sneakers   Stand out with comfortable gym shoes by Puma Sneakers by Puma are as stylish as they are comfortable Thanks to their high-quality and cool designs   Puma's footwear comes in a variety of models Whether as low-tops, casual sports shoes, trainers, or gym shoes Sneakers by Puma ensure well-bedded feet in combination with a unique style   See less About this item    Product details    Is discontinued by manufacturer                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  No   Product Dimensions                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  24.99 x 15.01 x 15.01 cm; 600 Grams   Date First Available                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  23 Dec. 2017   Manufacturer                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  Puma   ASIN                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  B077MJHYXS   Item model number                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  365215   Department                                     ‏                                         :                                     ‎                                  Unisex       Best Sellers Rank:  1,632 in Fashion (See Top 100 in Fashion)   14 in Men's Fashion Trainers       Customer reviews:         4.4  4.4 out of 5 stars         75,225 ratings               From the manufacturer            Achieve your goals. Forever Faster.    Forever Faster isn’t just about speed. It’s about strength, about getting better every day, about wanting to win... And that means it’s about you. Our mission is to make you as fit as you want to be, because we know that the sky’s your limit. And we’re here to take you there. As fast as fast can be.           Walk the walk with PUMA sneakers for men.                              Go ahead. Make your day.   Any plans for later? Don’t miss any of them. And whatever you do: don’t change. Yeah, that includes your shoes. Because PUMA men’s sneakers will take you anywhere and let you do anything, with fabrics that wick moisture away from your feet, soles that absorb any shock, and treads that give you maximum grip. All that’s missing is a destination.       Cold feet never. Cool feet always.   You’re always ready to go? Then don’t overthink it and GO. If anything, think about which pair of PUMA sneakers best suits your style. Because they’re all made to give you solid support and superior grip wherever you’re going, and built from breathable materials that keep your feet cool even when you’re turning up the heat.       Semper Fit.   It’s midnight, your pedometer is above 20k, and you’re ready to rock the dancefloor. Our men’s sportstyle sneakers are here for it. Because they’re so light and cushioned you barely feel them. Because they’ve been designed to make life easy for you and your feet. And because they want you to crack 30k tomorrow.              How to find the right shoe size                              Why is this important?   Shoe sizes are not standardized. Every shoe manufacturer uses different measurements in terms of instep height, toe shape and foot width. However, the basis for your own shoe size is always the length of your feet. Thus, you should always determine your foot length before buying in order to choose the right shoe.       Step 1: tracing your feet   Take off your socks, place a piece of paper against a wall, and place your foot on it so that your heel touches the wall. Now use a pen to trace the shape of the foot on the front of the toes. Hold the pen exactly upright.   Important: Both feet must be measured, as they are often of different lengths! Feet often swell during the day, which is why we recommend taking the measurement in the late afternoon.       Step 2: measure   Now you can measure the edge of the paper from where the heel was to the longest toe and determine the length of your foot. Use your longer foot as a guidance. We calculated the necessary allowance for enough space in the shoe for you. Find the size that fits your foot length and the allowance included in our shoe size table to make the right choice.             Step 3: Look it up in the shoe size table

I am a size 10 and generally have no issues with shoes, fitting or comfort.  In lockdown I decided to go for these (£20) as I haven't been able to go out to shops to buy shoes.After a month of wear,  they have been consigned to "Gardening shoes" and unsuitable for daily wear.The issue is that they rub unyieldingly on the knuckle of the big toe (I cant find anything obvious inside that causing it) to the point where a crippling pain developed.  in both feet.  To the point it was also wearing a hole in my sock at that point also.  I persevered hoping the material inside would loosen or soften and it would get better but if anything it got worse.  I tried, I really did for a month but they are unfit for general use. God forbid if you tried to do sports in them!  I'm only walking the dog!So I would avoid these particular trainers.

Never tried in gym.Nice looking sneakers, light weight, even value for money and comfortable but surely not for long walks. Your feet will be tired, the sneakers sole is thin, so they do not absorb shocks, at moments you feel these shock in your head.Definitely not for rigorous physical activity or long walks.If you want shoes for real physical activity or long walks, spend money and buy some good shoes, which are comfortable, shock absorbers, does not matter how long  you walk and what sort of road you walk. There are shoes with sole that you do not feel any tiny stones under your feet or cracks in road, yet they are light, shock observer and do not hurt or cut feet under , above or on sides. So I have used these shoes almost daily since about June 2022 and here are my thoughts.I Walk roughly 4 miles a day to collage and back alone due to this these shoes have seen a lot of use and are still kicking despite being one foot in the grave. As long as you don't beat your shoes to death like me they will last longer as a result of constant abuse my pair have worn heavily on the soles but haven't worn through and the heal on the insole if completely worn away and the insole has started to break away. The inside lining has began to wear holes and some of the finish has peeled of on the left shoe. These have taken a beating and have stood the test of time.They are incredibly comfy to wear since they are very padded with foam and don't cause my feet to get sore due to this they are great for wearing casually for hours on end and became my go too shoe for college due to their monotone look and excellent comfort as a result they beat out comparable offerings from Adidas since the shoes i had before were a pair of Adidas gazelles which i literally wore a hole into the sole however despite these being comfortable i thought they lacked padding which the pumas excel at due to this i prefer them to other life style shoes like converse, vans and more. If your like me and are quite heavy footed you will benefit dramatically from the foam.Despite being a tennis shoe it doesn't scream sporty with no massive logo or perforations due to this combined with monotone colour options the are perfect as a life style shoe and can definitely pass as a "white sneakers" style shoe but with much more comfort.Overall I highly recommend them if you like shoes of this style since i find that similar shoes from Adidas lack padding and feel very flat these on the other hand have a padded and cushioned feel to the point were i could wear them for more than 8 hours a day and can stand up to daily use of that duration. The clean design and monotone colours also make them excellent for a minimal everyday shoe.

The little bumps are way too rough and pronounced and feel uncomfortable.  The feel of the clog is rather plasticky than rubbery.  Additionally, they run a size too small, but I knew that in advance. I already own a pair of crocs, the same size and style as these, but a different colour. The first pair (for the garden) are so comfy and practical that I decided to get a second pair for wearing around the house. How disappointed I was to put on the new crocs and find that I could fit two fingers between my foot and the shoe. I know they are supposed to be roomy, BUT how could they be so different from the other pair? They just didnt feel right, so I have returned and am buying a pair in the classic style to see if they fit any better. For info, the returned crocs have 'made in Vietnam' stamped on them. The first pair don't state the country of manufacture. Gutted I am!
The crocs were fine but for the price you’d expect a box. These are a Christmas present and they came in a plastic bag!

I am a new Crocs wearer, I bought my first pair exactly a week ago and now I have three: 2 Classics Crocs and one Baya. One  pair of my Classic Crocs are my house slippers and I have been wearing them consistently since they came a few days ago, and due to having Sesamoiditis in both feet, one case rather bad, I had been wearing the Crocs for the garden out and about prior to receiving the Baya. Unfortunately I do not find the Baya to be as comfortable as the Classic, the roof of the clog seems to be considerably lower, low enough to have caused my arched feet alot of discomfort, for the first 15 minutes of walking I was in alot of pain, continually slipping my feet out of the Baya for relief. My Classic Crocs made me forget how much the Sesamoiditis was effecting me and the Baya reminded me immediately and with surprise. My left foot has the most pain with the right being very mild (with the sesamoiditis), I found myself limping, again within 15 minutes and my right foot is now inflamed and sore again. I did however notice the after 30 minutes or so the roof of the Baya started to loosen somewhat, so I'm thinking that moreso than with the Classic, your feet has to mould the Baya to achieve the best fit, I'm hoping? Otherwise, in terms of the size, I am happy with them. I am a woman and wear a size 8, one foot measures 27cm the 26.something cm and I wear a M8 | W9 UK (42/43 EU), which on the back of the Croc is M9/W11.
reviews.review_title: The top of the Baya is lower than the Classic.

reviews.review_content: To begin with, nothing wrong with the material or stitching - these are very soft and well made. There are 2 fundamental things wrong with the trousers however. Firstly, they come up way too small. I have an average-sized body with waist size 34. Following the sellers guidelines I should have bought medium, but as I suspected they would come up small I went for a large - but even these were too small for me! The waist was fine, but they were too tight around the legs and too short in length. The top was also undersized. Secondly, the shape is all wrong, the trousers hang down below the crutch - there is a gap that only Big John Holmes would appreciate! This makes them uncomfortable. It's a shame because the material is very nice and they could have been very good, it's just that they got the sizes wrong, didn't put enough material in the legs, and got the shape wrong around the crotch.
reviews.review_title: Sizes too small and shape is wrong

reviews.review_content: The fit on these is just bizarre, the legs are about an inch too short, the crotch area isn't deep enough for them to pull up over my bum, but the waist is huge, elasticated but still too loose to stay up.It's like someone took some kids leggings and expanded the waist out for someone with a beer gut.The top is similar, barely comes down below my belly button, really tight around the shoulders but with sleeves that cover my hands.

Comfy socks with a flannel style texture on the inside. The socks don't have too much stretch and I think those with larger calves may struggle.You get a good amount of socks for the price age they feel good but upon wearing the yellow ones I heard a thread tear and upon closer inspection, the area at my heel is thinning out. It looks like an important thread at the heel broke while I was putting it on and now there isn't much protection for the back. Over time that area will wear out very quickly and might unravel the whole sock. In disappointed with this quality so I've removed 2 stars.UPDATES:1) I've found that the elastic isn't properly sewn. The elasticated "cuff" thing around your calf is folded over and sewn on the inside but it's only attached in some areas and not ask the way around.2) Also it dawned on me that these socks are meant to be for feet sizes 6 through 11 but just barely fit my 8.5 feet. The black band that goes around the centre of my foot (wrapping around the arch area) is rigid. There's next to no stretch. Larger feet will struggle! I've removed an additional star for this because you expect things to fit the size on the label and not be pot luck. So currently the socks are 3 stars down and I can't recommend them unfortunately until quality improves.
I have quite muscular calves and these only go midway so it makes them really uncomfortable for me. They are however really well made and lovely thick and warm just not for me.

The CityComfort Mens Multipack Thermal Socks arrived in a plastic bag and were bunched together into a cardboard sleeve to hold them. There are 5 pairs of socks in the pack and they are brightly coloured in an orange, green, blue, yellow and red design. The quality on inspection is very good with a material mix of 77% polyester, 20% cotton, 3% elastane – I do prefer a higher cotton blend but these seemed fine against the skin. There is a slight conflict in terms of the selling page and the socks themselves the former stating machine wash and the latter hand wash only, however we have tried both – no problem with hand wash and none on a 30° machine wash - there has been no issues with shrinkage or colour bleed.The socks are a little tight around my calved but that isn’t too surprising as I train them and walk for miles so they are chunky and muscular – I have managed to stretch these a little and they are fine. Originally I recall these were a little cheaper but they now retail for £13.99 for the five pairs, which is still good value for the quality on offer.
reviews.review_title: Long, Warm Socks Are Good Value But May Be A Little Tight On Thick Calves

reviews.review_content: Used them for skiing. They were great especially for the price.
I needed some long warm socks to wear under my knee high boots.  These ski socks fit perfectly, are not too thick but lovely and warm.  Very happy with this purchase.
Good quality. Would order again
The item suited my needs
Thick socks for winter.Been through many washes and still look good.Great for wearing with Winter boots.
Great brought for my son as he went skiing. Kept feet warm not to thick soft fabric
I bought these for my husband and he said they were a great fit and very comfortable
As pictures
Excellent product great service thank you very much delivered with a smile. Great value.
Very good socks for winter

reviews.review_content: My big problem with the slippers is that they just don't last long enough. My pair have split on the sole. The sole just isn't thick enough and the grooves are even thinner making them the weak point. And they then split along the seams, quite dangerous going up wooden stairs as the can catch.
I actually liked these , but after 3 months the wet is coming in underfoot , only very light outside use ,  inedaquate sole etc , wont be buying from this company again .

Avoid this product.  Pull on strap at back of slipper pulled off!  Quality of stitching is poor.  Interestingly slippers arrived with a label advising to liaise with the manufacturer if an issue.  After numerous emails and sending photos of the faulty item, was advised to take the matter up directly with Amazon as that is where they were purchased.  As expected Amazon did a great customer centric job of dealing with the matter.Avoid purchase if wanting a quality product.
reviews.review_title: Poor Quality product and Manufacturer Customer Service

reviews.review_content: Only lasted a month the Stitching on the quilted front of the slipper dug into my big toe just couldn't wear them
You need to go one size up which I can't as they only go to size 12.
Too narrow
Received one charcoal grey slipper and one dark blue !! Returned and Amazon refunded promptly.

Didn't turn up the first time I bought them, this time they were a day late. Poor enough quality, not very comfortable, loose on the ankle so feel like they slip off when walking, the memory foam must be pretty thin because you can't feel it. Take a look a a different slipper cos I wouldn't recommend this one.

These slippers look warm and comfortable in the picture but in real life they are quite the opposite. When they arrived I went to put them on by using the tag at the back which ripped the second I gave it a pull, the memory foam cushion has lasted about three days and my feet are freezing. Wish I kept my £5.00 slippers from primark but instead I am using my gym trainers to walk around the house in. Don’t bother worst things ever get some flip flops made from brick and barb wire.

For  size 10 is fine but to get your foot in easily is Not, I had to squeeze in puffing and blowing with an extended shoe horn, I cut the tags off or would have sent them back, are made for a skeleton to wear not your average bloke with size 10 feet.  Along with they are not a nice looking slipper but you could live with that around the house if you could slip them on and off easily, but you can't.
reviews.review_title: Very small tight fit to get your foot in

reviews.review_content: Loved wearing them when they arrived in April but by November both soles have split which is disappointing. Would have been 5* if the quality was there

These slippers are very comfy and warm.  Build quality is ok, but the sole is way too thin and flimsy and wore out too quickly and developed holes.  If it wasn't for that they would have lasted much longer as the uppers have plenty of life left. Beware!
reviews.review_title: Comfy slippers let down by fragile sole

reviews.review_content: Cumfy an sizing correct
I ordered a size too big and they only just fit me! So beware.
reviews.review_title: A bit on the small side

reviews.review_content: £20 and a good genuine UK10 fit, initially very comfortable and keeping my feet warmer than' slip on' slippers.However, after just a couple hours of indoor wear the insole of one of the pair has 'ridden up' and caused a ridge beneath toes which makes wearing it most uncomfortable both with and without socks.Tried to persevere but it is now getting more uncomfortable and it will have to be returned - such a pity as the other slipper is so warm and fairly comfortable.
reviews.review_title: WEARING THEM TWO MINUTES AFTER DELIVERY AND VERY COMFORTABLE, BUT ......................

reviews.review_content: These shoes were doing a good job as I basically walked between the house and the garden office each working day. Unfortunately they have let go within a year. The sole has come away from the shoe which is disappointing as generally I thought they were good
Very comfy and quite well made BUT soles are as thin as can be. Wear out in 7 to 8 months of daily wear in house and on patio.

Whilst these are very comfy for the first month's they quickly lose the spring of the insole and you may as well be walking on the rubber sole with socks on.These do however keep their warmth for as long as I've owned them, which is roughly 3 monthly now passed this point I can't say

When I initially bought these slippers in November 2020 they were comfortable and I was pleased with my purchase. But after only 9 months the soles of both slippers have developed holes. A better quality sole is required and these slippers would then be worth the money.
Comfy for 2/3 weeks then the rubber bottoms fall apart

I should have looked more closely at the pictures as I find wedge shaped soles do not suit me, I prefer shoes, slippers with a heel as I find wedge shape uncomfortable. I did not find them cosy either my feet were cold until I  reverted back to my old slippers.
Great at first but the soles don't last long before they split. Cheap construction.
reviews.review_title: Really good at first but the sole splits after very little use as construction is poor.

reviews.review_content: These slippers look nice and are pretty comfortable. Within a month of using them though the elastic has stretched out and not returned to its original length making the slippers fit very loosely. I think they will start to fall apart soon.
These seem well enough made and very warm but size 12 were hard to get on and feel very tight. Hopefully they show some give quickly but I would buy a size up as they appear to come up very small..

I like the way I can tread the heals down to slip on yet it'll pop back up if I need to put them on properly to run upstairs:)not very warm for an older person but the foam around my feet and soul are very comfortable
Great slippers thanks Great quality & very comfortable

These were great initially. Nice and warm, comfortable and kept their shape. Unfortunately, after a few months of reasonable wear and tear, the soles split along a weak-point in the sole pattern on both, and due to the pattern the split exposed a 'tongue' of plastic when the sole was bent and I kept tripping on rugs, stairs and electrical cables. Due to them becoming risky to wear, I had to retire them.
reviews.review_title: Warm and comfortable but didn't last long

reviews.review_content: In all other respects a good slipper. True to size (a Nike 11 is the same fit as an 11 in these). Comfortable, warm, useful sole for nipping outdoors. There is however a distinct lack of any cushioning under the heel.

Comfort is very good. Durability of uppers and sides is also very good. Durability of the bottom sections is poor, both inside the slipper and the sole. The material on the heel area inside the slipper has worn through, and the soles have worn down to almost flat and cracked on the section where the ball of my foot is, just behind the toes. Usage has been mostly inside the house on carpet and only worn to go into the back yard on the odd occasion.I reckon if you stick to indoor use and fit shoes inserts (Superfeet inserts are excellent) then you'll get longer life and of course better insulation from the floor.  I think 20 quid is too much for these - ASDA had very similar for 12 quid but not my size unfortunately.

Bought as a replacement for Zizor ones I bought last year.  Working from home I pretty much live in them.  These looked very similar in style and were marginally cheaper, so I thought I'd give them a go!  Arrived on time, but I am a little disappointed.  They don't fit as snuggly as I would have liked - especially as they are likely to give a little after wearing them.  There are not as comfortable either, and seem to have less memory foam in the soles.  I've kept them only as a spare pair / for travelling.I immediately re-ordered the Zizor ones - really should have done this in the first place.  Much better fit and far more warm and comfortable.  I'd recommend you do the same!

This is my second pair of these slippers. I really love the way they look, they are very comfortable and they fit well.My big issue with the slippers is that they just don't last long enough.  My second pair have split on the sole in exactly the same place as my previous pair (see photo). The sole just isn't thick enough and the grooves you can see in my photo are even thinner making them the weak point. My last pair have only lasted approx 9 months with occasional use so unfortunately I won't be purchasing a 3rd pair. Such a shame as I really love the style of these.
reviews.review_title: Love the way they look but they don't last long enough

reviews.review_content: Hmmm… mixed feelings on these..Pro’s - warm and comfortableCon’s - First wear they are snug (true to size) but stretch quickly !  3 weeks in I’d say they have stretched to the point they are loose and almost too big without socks.The sole is also just about ok, they are defo indoor only as the sole is quite thin compared to some slippers.If you can find these on a deal then go for it but I wouldn’t pay full price.

As a chilblain sufferer I have found these a big help in regulating the temperature of my feet. The initial grip is beginning to diminish so they'll probably get a bit 'sloppy' with time but I accept this. My tip is to wear 2 pairs of socks rather than one thick pair then if your feet get too hot, say in a hot room, then you can take one pair off. Would buy these again.
They keep your feet warm

I'm normally a 8 / 8.5 If I ordered again I'd get a 9. Very snug but nit bad enough to send back. I'm not sure about durability yet as only had them on for one night. Seem to be well made and warm. Happy with them so far.

I am always reluctant to buy any footwear online, even from brands I have bought from before as I often end up with stuff that doesn't fit right or is uncomfortable and then the return process is such a pain. But I figured I'd take a flyer on these slippers as I liked the look of them and wanted ones with rubber soles. I live in Ireland and so the ground outside is perpetually wet and I wanted to be able to pop out to the garden or garage if i needed to without my feet getting soaked from the bottom.These work great and are holding up, they are really warm, too. They do fit slightly large. I am almost always a US 9/UK 8/EU 42 and these fit loose unless I wear socks with them. You wouldn't notice the looseness around the house as you wont take big strides like outside so it's okay, and tbh I find wearing socks with them works better anyway because the fleece lining is so warm your feet will sweat way more without socks. Without socks i will only wear them for 20 minutes due to that. That's why I took off one star because to me the whole point of slippers is right in the name - slip them on my bare feet to do litle bits and pieces around the house before i get properly dressed or after cooking home. I don't want to wear socks with slippers really, I would rather put my socks on only when gettind dressed to leave the house
reviews.review_title: Decent quality, warm, fit slightly large

reviews.review_content: NICE AND WARM  BIT SOFT SOLE
Vry nice slippers but a bit too snug fit wise. Gave them to my sister who is please with them.

My husband's a size 9 shoe but often finds slippers come up a little small so ordered a size 10 and they were fine. Comfortable and warm but slightly disappointed that one slipper had started coming apart after less than two years but liked them enough to order another pair.
Good quality slippers.Unhappy with delivery. Left outside with no knock on door. Amazon said "handed to customer." It was not. Luckily I checked before any dishonest passerby pinched my purchase.
My feet are always warm, comfortable and dry in these slippers. 5 stars. Highly recommended.
reviews.review_title: Great fit, very comfortable, well made

reviews.review_content: As my husband already has similar slippers to these, but the ones with the lower back, incidentally (which are still going strong), and needing a 2nd pair for when being washed, then spotting these on a lightening deal - we didn't hesitate to snap up, with the hope that they are just as good as his other pair just mentioned.As the other pair have easily been the best slippers he has owned, full stop.Unfortunately, my hubby is housebound, so slippers are his everyday shoes, mostly they never last; it's lucky if a pair goes beyond 6 months before hanging off his feet!Yet, the 1st pair have been excellent and have certainly lasted longer than they normal do.Now, having owned these slippers for many months, he can say without doubt that these are just as good - actually better, than the aforementioned pair.In actual fact; these slippers are pretty similar, the exception of the raised back on this pair, they have very quickly become his favourite pair of slippers of all time, boy, that sure is saying something!They are very well made, unbelievably comfortable, as I agreed - like clouds on your feet; when he insisted that I try them.The sole is very good and not very slippy, say, on wet decking, and they have lasted the longest out of all his slippers to date - fantastic! :-DSo, a very happy purchase, yes, they might be a tad more pricey than hubby's usual slippers, but there's a reason for this and they sure are worth it!Edit: Unless something drastic happens, his thoughts are he'll definitely buy again, as nothing lasts for ever!As per last thoughts, we're in need of another pair, as I've said nothing last for ever - yet these have substantially lasted much longer longer than any of previously owned slippers m, so much so he's asked for another pair, after splitting them when being caught, very happy to be purchase another pair.Simply excellent slippers, warm, constable, good fitting, good soles and hard wearing, again, this 1st pair have outlasted previously all other owned slippers, some even more than twice as long.
reviews.review_title: The Longest Lasting Slippers: Very Comfortable: Like Clouds On Your Feet. Well Made/Great Soles!

reviews.review_content: Excellent,warm and soft. Just like me

I wear these daily and even after 4 months of use, there's no sign of wear and tear! The backs are still in tact, no holes, and the soles are well adhered to the fabric. They are also so comfortable and even after 4 months, still spongey enough. I do think these will be flatter and need replacing in a year but that's expected.I'd recommend sizing down with these though - once the foam settles to your foot shape, they do feel a bit loose.Overall highly recommend.

Where did you buy your last pair of slippers?  Were you like me and bought them from a supermarket? They looked OK at the time, but soon disintegrated after a couple of month's wear? If so, these may be what you've been looking for!After a bit of research, these VeraCosy slippers seemed to combine the perfect balance between quality and value. With the exception of the slightly twee name, all looked good and I ordered a pair.As is usually the case with Amazon, they were delivered the next day and I found myself unfeasibly excited to try them on!  They definitely didn't disappoint!These slippers fit exactly as expected, which was a relief. The plush lining provided a good degree of warmth, and the rubberised sole gave both grip and comfort around the house.  That can be especially important on laminate or marble floors, where smooth soled slippers can be dangerously slippy. Just for clarity, the soles haven't marked any of the floor coverings, which I was initially concerned about.The design of these slippers, with the back of them extending up over the heel (in contrast to the lower slip-on styles) also allows for improved safety when ascending or descending stairs. You'd be shocked at how many people - particularly, but not exclusively, in later life - suffer awful injuries through tripping on stairs or carpets due to ill-fitting slippers. I'm confident that these are sufficiently well designed to minimise that risk.I've had these for about a month or so, and due to lock-down they've been on my feet for most of each day. They're still as warm and comfortable as on the day they arrived, and I'd have no hesitation in recommending them to you.*** If you've found this review useful, please hit the "Helpful" button. Your appreciation makes writing reviews worthwhile 😊 ***
Bought UK size 11. I'm normally shoe size 10. Fits perfectly. Plenty of room. Not too big. Not too tight. Extremely snug & comfy. Would recommend.

reviews.review_content: unfortunately item is not 65% Cotton 35% Polyester as described, it is in my opinion 100% Polyester. There is a legal requirement in the UK to label clothing with the material composition, and there is NO label on the shirt. EU 1007/2011 also requires a label.

I liked the shirt ,but not the stains on it .don't even ask me what it looks like . disgusting.Take a look at the pic and make your ownMind up.Definitely was not a new shirt . someone must have sent it back and they just sent it back out again.😡😡 Very unhappy with this

This shirt is not poly/cotton as described. It is 100% synthetic. Poorly made with hens that turn up as the cut has been stretched when the pattern was cut. Fine if you can tolerate polyester in a hot climate, and don’t care if the shirt only lasts for one holiday.For me it is unwearable.omwe

I'll see how it comes out of the wash but I was planning to buy a couple of other patterns and now I probably won't.

Ladies and men of all shapes, sizes, ages, and creeds rejoiced at my arrival, offered me Rum and snacks and multitudinous naughty favours, 80% of which i had to decline for time constraints. This popularity had nothing to do with my traditionally handsome features and superhero style physique, it was mainly due to this soft beautiful flamingo emblazoned shirt. Did I mention its hot pink? I know right. You should buy one now. The respective gashes you encounter will be instantly frothed.

reviews.review_content: As reported in October 2023: This purchase was a replacement buy for a pair of Lakeland Active Rydal and Neoprene wellies purchased earlier this year. Those too were excellent until going out in the first wet and boggy outing this autumn, I came back with a soaking wet left foot, where the boot had leaked due to a hairline split where the sole joins the shoe area of the boot. Hopefully that issue was from a 'one off' faulty pair as Lakeland Active themselves states was probably the case. Amazon were excellent in agreeing a refund for the faulty purchase back in this Spring.. Fingers crossed for this pair. Revised report today: I have now returned the latest boots from Lakeland Active because they also leak- after 5 months wear! Rubber persishing on both boots. These have been carefully looked after and cleaned regularly with plain water only. Now there are two of these lasting no longer than 5 to 6 months its clear they are not up to the job of regular use. Its a shame really as they are comfortable wellies and as near as you can get to calling them a stylish item. I will NOT be buying anymore Lakeland Active boots. If you do and wear them a lot, beware..

Comfortable and warm.  Generous sizing.  The only weak spot is the liner on the back of the boot wore through after a month.  for the price, I wish the liner had lasted longer as I'm going through socks like sweets.16feb24 Update - little over a month of buying them, a large split has appeared on the right boot on the inner side - 11 days after the return policy (including damage / failure).  Absolute rubbish.
reviews.review_title: They are comfortable and warm, but liner fails very quickly

reviews.review_content: After two months, the insole in one boot disintegrated, with the neoprene and foam crumbling away to dust and exposing the internal part of the heel, which is extremely uncomfortable to walk on. I have put in some decent heat mouldable footbeds rather than return them, as a new pair will likely go the same way.Fit-wise, they are good: go with your regular shoe size and wear chunky socks, but unless you have calves like tree trunks, the adjustable buckle is too loose and poorly designed. The buckle is a cam lock type, and you have to pull the tab against the lock to tighten the top of the boot. Because it is a plastic/nylon affair rather than metal, if you pull too hard and try to tighten the calf properly, the cam lock buckle just pops out of the housing.Update: They're shot. 8 weeks old and the liner has worn through at the heel, so now very uncomfortable to walk in.

These wellies seemed excellent, comfortable warm and good grip, better than previous’high end’ brands, but only 4 month old they have failed across the toe. Purchased late October 23, returned March 24. :-(.I hope they sort out the design fault and produce a great alrounder.Bruce

Got these early December 2023, I really didn't want to spend £85 on some wellies but decided they would be an investment in comfort for walking our new dog.What a waste of money, after only four months of use, an hour or two a day not even every day, they have started to split, and it's down to poor quality as you can see in pictures, the rubber is persishing and the boots have started to leak. I'll be avoiding any Lakeland boots in the future and my advice to any other potential buyer is do the same, four months light use for supposedly "active wear", it's an expensive joke.Avoid.

    I bought these boots at the beginning on November 2023 for dog walking purposes. I have worn them about a dozen times, normally I tried and avoid walking in deep puddles however, there was an occasion recently where I had no option but to do so.This was a big mistake because, I ended up with very damp feet. Upon investigation I discovered both heals were showing signs of wear after only four months of use.I had expected better from these boots but, like most things these days the quality is sadly lacking.Needless to say I will not be buying them again.

Boots fit well but following one month's use, worn about 5 times a week for dog walks the liner is wearing through at the heel. The material then rucks up creating a lump which then gives me a painful blister. Less than impressed with the build quality for what is an expensive wellie.Update. Less than 2 months after I started wearing them for dog walks the both boots now leaking, cracks at the back of the boot. Don't waste your money on these very poor quality wellingtons.

    The boots were bought for Christmas and as you can see a hole has appeared and the lining inside the boots has come away not impressed for a supposed high quality boot

I bought a pair of these two years ago - and the rubber perished and split around the toe area. It was within the guarantee period so I returned them and no quibble - got a new pair - great!. I have now had the new pair for just under a year (!) and have perished in the same area and also split along the back seem so no longer waterproof. I am not a heavy user - dog walking for three to four months of the year daily in the winter period - tracks not mountain climbing. They just do not seem to last.The replacement pair arrived on 5th Nov - I am not sure I can get a replacement this time? Not sure whom to contact as there is no Amazon return even though they are guaranteed for a year
reviews.review_title: Replacement pair has now failed after one year

reviews.review_content: Unfortunately, I am not satisfied with the shoes, I used them for less than a month for my work in the garden and the left shoe has cracks through which water is leaking
After only ordering them at the beginning of January, these wellies have only just lasted a while month. They’ve spilt & come away & are leaking in water.

for the price they were I would expect the durability to be much higher, I've had the boots less than two months and the neoprene lining wore away at the heel.They were very comfortable for the first month though and the little notch on the outer heel is helpful for removing wet/muddy boots.
reviews.review_title: solid rubber and comfortable, weak inner lining

reviews.review_content: When you're unemployed with health issues affecting feet, legs, joints, and so much fun more, making an investment in any pair of footwear requires much thought and consideration. Because of dog walking, and given our wonderful wintery weather, I need welly boots that I can rely on to both last, and be a comfortable support against my pain.As far as looks and comfort go, you're great.When it comes to reliability, you fall flat on your face. I bought my boots last month and by the end of the month, I'd noticed a slight leak. Today, I find myself having to buy a new pair of boots. Thanks guys, that's just what I really needed to have to do!!!One of the splits that occurred happened on the top of the foot of the boot. I am aware that this is a manufacturing defect.It feels like the soles are full of air pockets. If this is the case then I'm even less impressed as that means that the soles days will be a lot less than they should be.

Haven't had these a year and they've developed a crack already. My once dry feet are now quite unhappy. The lining had to be replaced with insoles after the first couple of weeks. I thought going for an expensive pair of boots would mean they would last, sadly mistaken.

I use these for the occasional dog walk when it’s wet underfoot, so they are worn a few times a week over winter and not in the summer. The lining inside the boot has worn away and so for the last month or so the plastic has worn through at least 6 socks, some of which were brand new. These boots (imo) don’t last long enough so I’d avoid.

Very comfortable initially however the stitching of the inner liner inside at the heel area started coming apart within a couple of months (despite a very snug fit so little foot movement).  After 12 months the inner area at the heel has disintergrated making any walking blister-inducing.  Thankfully they put themselves out of their misery when the left one split on the top of the foot area rendering them non-waterproof and therefore useless.  Amazon customer services saved the day by refunding the original price without argument.
reviews.review_title: Split right on cue at 13months.  Thanks god for Amazon refunds.

reviews.review_content: Used for daily dog walking. Warm and comfortable.  Wide fit.In less than 4 months the heels sections of both soles had wore away sufficiently to allow water ingress.So disappointing as I loved these boots. The soles need to be harder wearing!!!
reviews.review_title: Sole wore away in less than 4 months

reviews.review_content: I have had to order another pair as they perished on the top of tje boot. Is there a guarantee?
reviews.review_title: The boots eere purchased beginning of dec 23

reviews.review_content: My partner bought these 3 months ago and already the side strap has snapped off and there is a hole in the heel of one boot. Can’t recommend sadly.Initially they were great. There’s no option for me to contact the company to complain.
Like the comfyness but the insoles came apart and inside the Welly tore up within two months, and outside of Welly splitting after four months.
The wellies were very comfy but sadly didn't last barely 9 months that barely got much use but split 😢
They're pretty good boots but they are very high and tight on the leg, and they don't have protective caps.
reviews.review_title: Good boots, but not for work.

reviews.review_content: Purchased Uk size 9 (43). Lovely boots but they were extremely big more like a size 10s as I’ve worn them outside I guess I will have to wear more or  larger boot socks which is rather annoying
Lasted just over a year before the rubber started to perish  2nd pair this has happened to, so not really happy.Only used for walking so not abused
Only had these a week, and after daily use the insoles (really thin) have started to fail. Would be a good review but for this issue. At this price you'd expect better.

I’ve had these for about 9 months, initially really great, comfy, well fitted and of course waterproof. Worn them twice in the colder weather over the past weeks and they’ve slightly cracked and are letting water in the right foot. Inevitably a massive disappointment.

Boots were perfect initially but after about 4 months of walking my dog approx 4 miles a day the boots started splitting and letting water in,I contacted Lakeland customer service department who said because I'd purchased through Amazon they couldn't help me.as the return date had passed with Amazon I am now having to buy more wellies from a different company,I couldn't recommend these although at first they were perfect.
The boots are very rigid and not very supple around your calf’s

Pros -These wellies look nice, nice shade of green.Neoprene keeps feet warm.Good thick sole.Adjustable buckle on side.Cons -These wellies have split on the outside after not even 4 months use. The interior stitching has all split too.Overall they would perhaps be suited to someone who doesn't need to regularly use them i.e. just for walking the dog. However they are not suitable for regular farm and Equestrian use.Bit disappointing to have split in several areas in less than 4 months.I wouldn't buy again personally. However they aren't the worst wellies I've owned!

Really comfy with a thick pair of socks on. Insole is cheap and thin so either get used to wearing thick socks or by an insole yourself. They do keep water out and feet warm but I must have had a bad set of mouldings as the heel on mine have caved in and they are no longer water tight

Overall very happy with these. They are warm, comfortable, have a good grip, and are easy to put on thanks to their soft and flexible construction. Great for medium length walks through muddy fields and woodlands. Because they're soft, and flex well at the ankle, they are more comfortable than the cheaper, plasticky type of wellies.I wear these with thick, insulated socks and the fit is fine in my normal size (12) but they still feel roomy. If wearing over normal socks they would be slightly too big and I would need a size smaller.The adjustment strap at the side, which is used to loosen off the boots for easier putting on and taking off, has a flimsy plastic clasp with a cheap hinge which can come apart when pulling the strap through. It can be fitted back together, but is annoying. A metal buckle with a bolt-type hinge would not have been too much to expect at this price, so I've knocked them down one star for this.
reviews.review_title: Great for walks, minor issues with clasp

reviews.review_content: Used almost daily for six weeks. A well made boot that is comfortable to walk in and to date has not leaked. A decent grip in really muddy conditions, which is important.One downside is warmth. Feet have got cold at temperatures around zero degrees which is unexpected as the manufacturer rates them as warm down to minus twenty.Overall  worth the money so far.
Like the calf fit… don’t like slidey insole…Overall a good welly
Good waterproofing, also high with good heel
reviews.review_title: good to walk in, but tricker to get on and off than neoprene ones

reviews.review_content: Very heavy though, fast delivery

I recently purchased these wellies, and overall, I am very satisfied with them. These boots are very sturdy and keep my feet and legs dry, which is exactly what I was looking for.However, I did find that the sizing is a bit larger than expected. I ordered my usual UK size 9, but I found that they were a bit too big. Additionally, the zipper is not as resistant as I would have liked.Despite these minor drawbacks, I still find that these wellies do the job very well. They are also surprisingly elegant for a pair of wellies, which is a nice bonus.Overall, I would recommend these boots to anyone in need of a sturdy and reliable pair of wellies. However, be aware of the sizing issue, and the fact that the price is a bit higher than some other options on the market.
reviews.review_title: Despite a few drawbacks, an excellent acquisition

reviews.review_content: Does what I was hoping for : fits well , comfortable and warm.
It is adequate for our needs

Bought these Wellies for dog walking through muddy fields. They work, are not leaking and have been used for 6 weeks, so long term wear not yet known.As they appear to be robust and they fit well I recommend them.They fit well - I tend to go a size up and wear a thick sock or two pairs of old socks!
reviews.review_title: Well make and a good fit

reviews.review_content: Great product and cheap, very comfy fit 10/10

As a dog walker and someone that walks on his days off, I was hunting for boots for a while. Going for high brands, like hunters etc and looking at low level products.. but fed up of high prices and boot that last a few weeks before leaking. Window shopping reviews at all sorts of boots. Whilst having the lakelands in my basket.The warmth I can not fault. I've stood in freezing ponds these last couple of months to get action shots of dogs running into the lakes, Meadows etc.  This feet and tootsies stayed warmed than a roast ham! I was a little bit shocked as I only paid £60 for them during a flash sale. But at £120 I would of been happy paying knowing what I know now.Comfort - is beautiful, cushioned and don't seem to rub. Even tho there's a fair amount of space for the boot.. this does help with removing and also has a little tag at the back to hook your feet on when removing. Don't geg me wrong and extra pair of socks has made them perfect, but boot protectors and rubber insoles I would buy just so you keep these boots so much longer. Can't believe I'm enjoying the boots so much. Little tightening tag is perfect, easy to fix after it came loose during a collision with a dog.Few months of wet, frozen, flooded, muddy, woodland, farmland, chalkand adventure walks and they're still waterproof, still comfy and still pleasing me
reviews.review_title: Very warm, comfy and seem to have kept their water resistance

reviews.review_content: very comfy, as a farmer I sepnd my life in them. I put a sorbothane insole in them all, which makes them very gentle on the feet. One calf clasp lost on one boot and the attacment for the strap detached on the other, so not good
reviews.review_title: lovely boot, tightening calf clasps fell off

reviews.review_content: These are the best wellingtons I've ever brought they fit perfect and are so comfy .You know the saying you get what you pay for . I've always brought cheap wellingtons and when it snowed my feet were freezing not these they are good for -20 and my feet are lovely and warm will recommend to family and friends

I’ve had these a little over a year (late Feb 2022) so unfortunately just out of warranty. Worn them approximately 6-7 times (8-9 hrs of standing around and not walking far) just to take my child to her weekend football, so nothing intensive.  The sole has begun to come away from boot body around the ball of the foot area which is disappointing.They’re very comfortable and warm, but for the price I’d advise you to pay a bit more and get a higher quality Wellington boot. If you’re not a regular wearer then maybe a cheap pair would be better, as my last cheap pair lasted 15+ years, but wanted something more comfortable, which these definitely are. I wouldn’t advise these for the price point they’re at though.

Fast deliver.  I ordered a size 8 which I thought would be  a size 41 but received a size 42 which unfortunately was too big.  The boots were a good wide fit around the calf of my leg, looked very durable but just too big so have returned them

Purchased a pair of these on 23rd February this year ready for lambing time.  I would normally expect a pair of neoprene wellingtons to last two years, maybe a bit more, but these, got a bit of wear at lambing time, but really very little use since April, for obvious reasons. Now that we are getting some wet mornings again they are in demand again, except after a couple of weeks of use they are leaking.  The neoprene has split where it flexes by the toe.  In total probably a maximum of 3 months of use; if they had lasted two years they would have been excellent value for money, but at a current cost of £84.98 that works out at a cost of £679.84 for two years.  Would I but them again? Would I say that they are appalling value for money? Would I say that they are a load of rubbish?  I leave you to draw your own conclusions. I parbably would have got better wear out of the box they came in!
reviews.review_title: I would probably have got better wear out of the cardboard box they came in!

reviews.review_content: These boots are comfortable, and waterproof and have been worn for many hours for outdoor work
Very comfy and warm not like your normal boots that are always cold not had long but seem OK would say they are a bit pricey
Boots are warm snd comfortable. They also appear very sturdy. I’ll gollow up in 10 years🤞
10 out of 10

    Die Performance-Pants von „Perform-Collection“ wird in einem einfachen Plastikbeutel mit Zipper versendet. Das ist aber auch vollkommen ausreichend so.Die Hose sieht super aus. Sie wird mit zwei Knöpfen und einem leicht gängigen Reißverschluss geschlossen. Der hohe Stretchanteil macht die Hose super bequem. Sie macht jede Bewegung mit. Fast so wie eine LeggingsIch trage normalerweise große M bis kleines L und die Hose in 34/32 passt mir perfekt. Sie ist sehr modern geschnitten und eignet sich sowohl für die Freizeit als auch für eine festliche Veranstaltung.Eigentlich die perfekte Hose. Aber auch nur eigentlich, denn die Materialien aus der sie hergestellt wurde sind nicht besonders umweltfreundlich. Die Materialzusammensetzung besteht zu 75% aus Polyester, zu 22% Viskose und 3% Elasthan. Das Futter besteht sogar zu 100% aus Polyester.Polyester ist ein Überbegriff für verschiedene Kunststoffe mit unterschiedlichen Eigenschaften. Die Vorteile der Fasern ist das, sie relativ reißfest sind und lange in Form bleiben. Das große Problem bei Kleidung mit Polyesterfasern ist allerdings, das sich beim waschen immer winzige Fasern herauslösen und die winzigen Fasern dann als Mikroplastik ins Abwasser gelangen. Kläranlagen können die winzigen Partikel leider nicht herausfiltern und somit gelangen sie in die Meere.Da Viskose aus recycelten Pflanzenresten besteht, wird das Material häufig als umweltfreundlich und nachhaltig bezeichnet. Die Herstellung erfordert allerdings viele verschiedene Chemikalien wie Natronlauge, Schwefelkohlenstoff und Schwefelsäure. Das sind nur einige der Stoffe, die bei der Herstellung eine Rolle spielen. Auf der einen Seite haben wir also einen Stoff, der aus natürlichem und nachhaltigem Material besteht und auf der anderen Seite haben wir die Nutzung häufig giftiger Chemikalien.Wenn Sie nichts auf die Umwelt geben und eine bequeme Hose möchten, sind Sie mit dieser Pant-Hose sicherlich gut bedient. Von mir gibt es für diese Hose allerdings keine KaufempfehlungVielen Dank das Sie sich die Zeit genommen haben um meine Rezension zu lesen. Ich hoffe das ich Ihnen damit ein wenig behilflich sein konnte.
reviews.review_title: Sehr bequeme "Made in Bangladesch" Hose aus umweltschädlicher Polyester + Viskose....

reviews.review_content: Bought these for my son as he wanted fitted golf pants. The picture showed them as tight fitting at the ankle which they were NOT- very wide bottom leg and size was bigger than expected. Material was nice but on the heavier side. My son did not like them due to the FIT. Fit is more appropriate for older gentleman who likes normal fit and wider and not tapered legs. Not recommended for older teen/young adult

Es machte eher einen Eindruck einer Jogginghose und weniger eine Stoffhose und sicher für Freizeit wer es mag vollkommen okay Mein Sohn lehnte dies sofort, ab, die auch größer aus fällt, durch den Stretch verliert es an Form und halt!Konnte weder überzeugen noch den Erwartungen erfüllen !
